review: This is and probably will always be our consistent, go-to dinner spot.  I don't check in here as often as I should, and I should really stock up on those gift card deals that they offer around the holiday time, but that's okay.  I will still come here, regardless of whether or not I'm receiving a special deal or discount. I always go for the sicilian -- I'm a big fan of its thin crust, and I love, love the flavor and spiciness of it.  I usually pair that with the asparagus/brocolli soup (what??!!) -- yeah, it's actually pretty good.   1 time out of 10, I'll probably go and order the jambalaya in place of the pizza.  Again, the heat is awesome. Goes great with a beer. One bad thing for us (but good for them) is that this location is pretty crowded.  As a rule, if we're not there during off-hours, we'll call ahead, and just take it to go.  Big plus for them is that the food holds well as take-out.

Wow, why is there always a line for this place whenever we plan to go here? We arrived ahead of our other friends and asked for a table for four, and our wait was set at an hour and there were people all up that handiramp just muttering how hungry they are.  Anyway, after browsing through the mall a bit, we came back hungrier than we had left. We were seated at the far end of the restaurant where it gets narrow. Its a more intimate space in my opinion because the tables are further apart and you have a whole window to yourself. If we could come here and request seats, Id definitely request this one. So we sat down and ordered a few appetizers while still deciding on what we wanted. The waitress came back and we put in our orders and asked for house bread with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. We then ordered a bottle of moscato (that was just okay..) and our entrees came.... Haha, my friend was egging me on to tell the waitress that our apps never came! I just said to cool it cause they're busy. Anyway the manager comes by and helps bring our apps out 10 minutes later, and the server comes back and tells us shes sorry and that the apps are on the house...! O__o wow, very nice of them. Anyway, we weren't flustered at all and had a great time. It really does make a difference when the service is exceptional.

The food is always delicious! Everything from the pizza to the pasta's! So many choices to choose from but I love their spicy jambalaya pasta! The location isn't great since their always busy and the prices isn't the most budget friendly but if you love to try the traditional comfort food with a twist then you gotta try CPK! Plus their red velvet cake for dessert is to die for! Heaven in your mouth kind of delicious! unfortunately they don't do reservations, so you have been forewarned!

This 5 star is based on the service we received from our server Jodie. She was phenomenal!   I go to CPK pretty often, and always order the same things.  What I didn't know was that if you order something different, and not like it, they'll happily replace it with your usual.  Score! So you have the chance to try something new without being bummed that you missed out on what you normally love to eat here.  Great idea!

The wait was for dinner was an hour. Personally, I think the restaurant should be a little bigger for the amount of business they do.   The quoted wait was 1 hour, and we pretty much waited the whole hour. The best thing about it was they offered to call us on the phone when our table was ready and having the mall right next door made the wait seem a lot shorter. The hostess was great in calling us and seating us at our quoted time.  And she presented our menus individually.   Our server greeted us right away and we placed an order for everything (we had time to look at the menu while we were waiting).  Drinks came out a few minutes later.  Our server brought out bread and by the time we were done with bread, the appetizers started coming out at different times because we said to just bring everything out as soon as it was done.   The bread was nothing special.   Spinach Artichoke Dip ($10.25).  My kids dont eat artichokes OR spinach so when they were eating the dip, it was kind of shocking!  I like how the consistency was more like mush, cause chunks of spinach or artichokes would probably deter the kids from eating it. Lettuce Wraps with Chicken and Shrimp ($13.75). Very tasty sauce, a lot of shrimp and chicken.  The sauce was sweet tasting and it came out still steaming.  I liked this better than the ones they serve at PF Changs! Chicken Tequila Fettucine ($14.60) I LOVED the lime flavor that the pasta came in.  It wasnt too overpowering.  The sauce was not overdone and the pasta wasnt drowning! I would definately order this again. Five Cheese Pizza ($11.65) Cant really review it since I didnt try it but my kids liked it.  Cheese on pizza....what kid doesnt love that? But it did look tasty for just being a pizza. Kids meal: Pepperoni Pizza and Mac and Cheese ($5.50 each) The kids pizza was bigger than a lot of kids pizzas that ive seen at other places and my five year old finished it all.  The mac and cheese looked pretty big for a kids size and my son said it was kinda bland.  It wasnt as cheesy as a mac and cheese should be.  It also came with corkscrew pasta. Service: The service was pretty good.  We were greeted and served right away.  The only thing was, the server that greeted us took our orders and brought out our drinks and appetizers.  But after that, it looked like she was helping the bartender by washing glassware and stuff behind the bar and other servers started helping our table.  Im not sure if thats how it was supposed to be at this location....but it didnt matter to us. When we were done, dishes were bussed, dessert menus were delivered, and payment was processed quickly! We were served and NOT ignored!  Service was great by everyone who helped our table....and that equals a $20% tip. My family and I will definately be back again sometime! I wish I could tell you the name of everyone that helped our table but it there were a bunch. But our receipt says, Keli.
Good service good food. Fish tacos a bit overpriced @ $12.60 for two plus chips and salsa. Tasty but it's mostly cole slaw in the tacos.   My gf had her usual the jambalaya, never disappoints!

I just wanted to say how much my family and I enjoy this restaurant. We go there about 2-3 times a month. We love the wait help there. But we were very disappointed when we were told that the company has decided to stop carrying chopsticks!!!  What are they thinking, this is HAWAII after all.  How are we supposed to eat our salads now?  Honestly we either have to bring our own or not go there as often.  I hope they reconsider their decision, I'm sure it doesn't cost them that much.

It was my favorite foodie friend's birthday and we knew we were going to have a fantastic dinner planned...but what were we going to do for lunch? CPK wins by default! Here's why? They have great small plate options. We had the spinach & artichoke dip with corn chips, the mac & cheese bites & the Shrimp lettuce wraps. All were yummy! Then it was the pizza! Had to have the margherita pizza...it was so nice and fresh...definitely a favorite. They have WINE! Enjoyed a couple of glasses of red wine while we enjoyed our lunch...why not? It was 5PM somewhere, right? And if it's your birthday, you do what you want to do! Since my favorite foodie friend is a ham, and an utter attention whore, I decided to let the server know so that she could embarass him in every possible CPK way. Unfortunate for me, CPK doesnt do "loud birthday embarassing" type things. Seems someone complained and they have since stopped this practice. Darn! Anyway, we had a great lunch, enjoyed a couple glasses of great wine and had a nice singing free birthday dessert. Thanks, CPK!

Now, the pasta from CPK is my first love, but I'm ashamed and delighted to say I strayed.  Not wanting to be reeking if garlic on my trek through Pearlridge, I decide on something else.  Dynamite shrimp to start, and the pear gorgonzola pizza.   The dynamite shrimp was just that.  Dynamite.  Spicy, on a bed of white skinny shrimp chip things (yes, that IS the technical term), and not too mayo-y (again, a technical term).  It was just what shrimp perfection was meant to be.  My pear gorgonzola pizza was great.  Too many greens and bleu cheese for my taste, but a little scraping never hurt anyone.  It was heavenly.   If you've been eating at CPK for awhile, you may be used to their old menu, but if I could make a suggestion, cheat on your pasta!  Or cheat on your pizza!  The new menu rocks!!!  There's more to this place than Alfredo! We've been going to CPK for years, and I can't say that I've ever had an exceptional meal there.  This was pretty close.  The service was great, the two kids were extremely happy.  The minus one star is for the cancellation of the crab cakes.  Bring my beloved crab cakes back!!!

This CPK has consistently good food and great service! I have NEVER been disappointed by any experience I have ever had here. Their food is always wonderful. I love the chopped salad (don't forget the garbanzo beans!) and their margherita pizza is delicious too! You can't go wrong finishing it off with Red Velvet cake. Super yum!!!! The only thing I am not super thrilled with is the bread. I think it would be better if it was warm. I guess that is more incentive to waste your calories on something far more delicious...like their appetizers, entrees and desserts! Sevice is out of this world! Managers, wait staff, bussers...EVERYONE is incredibly friendly. Service is really quick and I really appreciated that our waitress asked us if we had to return to work and when she found out that we did, she really made an effort to be efficient without rushing us. Was that thoughtful or what? This is hands down the best CPK I have ever been to!

Great atmosphere with a great and friendly server., it was my first visit so she really helped me a lot and always checked up on us after each servings, refilled our drinks before they were empty which showed great service considering it was busy,, I took all her suggestions and dinner came out tO be awesome. Order the lettuce wrap which had a little spicy/ tangy kick which was very delicious. Next had the works pizza which is similar to a combo or supreme pizza but a fresher version. Last had the butter cake which is a miniature version of shokudos signature honey toast which was then a wrapp! All in all great dinner! THABK YOU CPK FOR AN AWESOME EXPERIENCE!
Pizza and beer. Really can't go wrong here.  This our goto place when we need a descent meal. Key lime pie, is a yummy to the tummy.

CPK is one of my family's go-to places when we go out altogether.  There are quite a few dishes on the menu I like here, such as the clams w/linguine (tomato sauce), mushroom pizza, tomato basil spaghettini, cheese pizza, etc.   While there are good food items at CPK, the quality and tastes varies depending on who's working (a problem all the locations have).  Service can be hit or miss too, though we generally have good service.  Wait times can also be a bit long, so it's best to come early!   Be aware that other customers here can tend to be rude and bothersome.

Went here for lunch the other day -The Original BBQ Chicken Chopped  Salad - Very Good!!! -Garlic Cream Fettuccine with Chicken and Brocoli - normally Super Good but wasn't so good that day -Spinach Artichoke Dip - WINNER!!!  A MUST HAVE!!! This was our first time here in a while and MAAAAANN....I don't think we're coming back.  Our meal plus tip was like 50 bucks!  FOR LUNCH, FOR 2 PEOPLE!!!  Holly crap!!! Did you know...we can go to Assagio's and pay a little bit less???  (That''s if 2 people share a large portion)....but still. 3 stars for that...

Girls Night Out!! Bf never brings me here so Im glad I came with my girl friends for dinner and drinks. FOOD:  Half order of Field Greens salad: I liked the candied walnuts, but the dressing gave me a tooth ache.   Sicilian Pizza. The best pizza! lots of meat and the thin crust has shredded parmesean baked on it. It is a little spicy.  yummmm~ (highly recommended)  Fried Mac n Cheese: Sounds good right? Its not.  My friend ordered it and I watched her eat it.  She said it tasted okay but she would have liked it if the dish was served hot.  The cheese was not ooey gooey awesomeness, but more like a block of cheese. Another item I like (but didnt order) is the Garlic Fettuccine Alfredo with chicken. SOOO creamy and garlic-ky.  Highly recommended. DRINK: New castle beer!!! thats all.... SERVICE: Theres always a line here.  Even on a Sunday night @ 7pm...  The food didnt take too long...Though one of my friends was waiting for her salad as we all ate our own...  The waitress was new, so she made a couple mistakes (the salad, plus I got charged for ordering fried mac n cheese). Its all good!

Good food, great service.  I am normally not a fan, but this visit helped to change my mind.  The Asparagus/Spinach Spaghettini with Grilled Shrimp was very tasty, as was the Asparagus/Arugula salad.  And it's always great to be with friends!

Whenever you go to a California Pizza Kitchen (CPK), you know you are going to have the same experience and food that you would get if you went to a CPK across the world (I've tried it and it's the same). That being said, the Pearlridge location which started it all in Hawaii, is simply ok. It offers the menu you have come to expect, however its service is ok and the location itself is simply ok. Located right on the edge of Pearlridge Downtown, I just have to ask, did they decide to put a greenhouse on the side of the mall and give it to Pearlridge? Cause that's what it comes across, and although tastefully remodeled since its inception, the size is just a tad bizzare and doesn't have enough waiting space to accommodate the masses as they await their table. It's a small strip sidewalk that you have to hug onto the edge for dear life while you watch people walk by.  The menu is what you would get at any of its other locations. How many times can I really talk about their Spinach Artichoke Dip or its BBQ chicken pizza? So instead, I implore you to try some of the items that you might not normally have when you go and repeat the menu over and over again. Perhaps try the mushroom ravioli? With its nicely cooked pasta embedded with a good array of mushrooms and served in a wonderful garlic cream sauce or maybe the chicken piccata? Will it be as authentic in Italy? No? But it definitely is good and full of flavor. Service is ok. The hosts are extremely good at telling you your wait for a table and are right on with their estimates. The wait staff is a little different. It didn't quite live up to the normal expectation that CPK has set for itself and sad to say that water glasses went empty.  Is it great? No, but at the same time it doesn't disappoint and the choices when you cross Red Hill quickly get limited (I'm going to pay for this last comment aren't I?).

CPK in my mind is like gourmet pizza. Well not necessarily like real italian pizza but pretty creative combinations. Pearlridge CPK is a place I used to go to growing up on this part of the island when you felt baller status in high school. I came here with my husband one night when we were lazy to drive into town. For some reason there is always a line here. Because we were only two our wait was about 20 minutes or so on a weekday. Not too bad. It has been a while so I ordered my favorite drink there Appleberry Sangria. I ordered the barbeque chicken and bacon pizza and my hubs ordered the habanero carnitas pizza. Mmm! I got to eat half and half. The salsa that came with the carnitas pizza was super hot. Like so hot that two servers reminded us not to touch your eyes if you touch the salsa. I put tiny amounts of the butt burner on the carnitas pizza and it was pretty good. My bacon and chicken pizza was good too. We pigged out of course. Pizza is like one of our favorite meals. Our server was nice and kept checking on us even though it was really busy. CPK is a go to place when we feel like spending a little more dough on pizza and staying in our neck of the woods.

Really great experience. Sat at the bar and had lunch there with a friend. Jessica was the bartender and she was so nice. She had a lot of really good suggestions and was very attentive. Miso Shrimp salad was so yummy. I will definitely go back and sit at the bar again.

I'd only been to CPK in airports before . . . someone gave us some gift cards for Christmas and we finally got around to using them. I was impressed as we went in, CPK was nicer than I expected.  It was busy, but we were seated fairly quickly.  The hostess and wait staff were friendly and helpful. The menu (and kids menu) were also more comprehensive than I'd realized. The food was very good too.  I'd go back.

I love CPK. I never can get tried of the spinach dip. I prefer to have the dip with the bread tho instead of the chips provided. I always get the Roasted Garlic Pizza....i love love it. :) Service is the same as always. good service. I'm editing this because I am soooo upset that CPK revised there menu and not longer have my Roasted Garlic Pizza. :)

Food was great, service was super attentive!  The Miso Salad was delish!  My only complaint is that we were there for lunch and it was LOUD.... but that's what happens when you got a good thing going culinary wise....

You can never go wrong with cpk! Today we ordered broccoli sundried tomato fusili, cheese pizza, and the Chinese chicken salad! For the 3 of us, that was more than enough food! We had a wonderful waitress! She was super catering to our needs and she even said whatever we want she will do for us! :)

love it !!!! Miso Shrimp Salad, those avacado rolls are awesome and wow butter cake mmm... actually i have been gong there since they opened at kahala mall and then opened at ala moana .. have had many fond memories eating there with my hubby who passed on .. it's an enjoyable atmosphere and the staff is so helpful and nice.. even got to see tom selleck at the kalaha location..

Ok I know I might be one of da few people that never been to CPK but Tuesday night was my first time. My gf had to take me kuz I never been there...LOL. My impression of CPK was that it was a pizza place that served weird kine pizzas, I never knew they served more den pizza.So when I got there I was surprised when I looked at da menu and found out get more den jus pizza.  So dat night we went with her son and her friend. We wen share da original chopped salad which was pretty good, any salad wit meat inside is all good wit me. It had chopped lettuce, tomatoes, onions, other stuff, and salami tossed in a light vinegerette or whatevers. Then we also shared pizzas, I ordered the carnitas habanero pizza and they order the spinich and chicken pizza. The habanero pizza was pretty awesome, I love spicy food so when it came out and there was the side dish of the habanero sauce that I put on every thing. The chicken spinich pizza was good too but not my style. So overall I liked dis place would definitely come back again because the atmosphere was cool and da prices decent.

The servers here are a hit & miss. Although for the most part, we've had great service. I can't say the same for other locations. I love the Italian cream sodas, this is what we come here for; & the egg rolls!! The wait time is long & they don't rsvp. There's always take out.
Bad service tonight! Waited 40 min. for table another 30mins. for our kids Alfredo noodles because they forgot to put the sauce. Damn!
I like coming here with my daughter. We been coming since she was 12 yrs old. Boy how fast time flies. CPK has awesome salads, pasta, pizza's. appetizer and deserts..

I love the roasted vegetable salad here.. This is my fave CPK to go to. The one at ala moana is two crowded and have to wait long even for a small party. I feel this CPK is quick and great servers.. I love the salads here and the sangria.

Tonight I tried something different and I really enjoyed it. I was kind of hesitant when trying their lettuce wraps because I'm not a huge vegetable fan but the chicken and sauce that comes with it was absolutely delicious. If you haven't tried it you should give it a chance. I believe you can replace the chicken with shrimp. Our waiter, John from Alabama, was very attentive and polite! Never received bad service from this location yet (knock on wood).

My coworkers and I always go to this CPK after work. They always cater to us (since we usually have very large parties) and are absolutely amazing. Last time we went there we had a group of about 18 people, my pasta was the very last meal to come out so they gave it to me for free! The customer service is awesome and the food is always delicious!

I've eaten just about everything on the menu and it's always been really good.  We sometimes get take out at work & they do a great job packing the order accurately.  Although today they did forget one of the salads.  I had the  Thai Crunch salad with Avocado & it was one of my least favorite items.  The tase was a little bland - could have used some fresh cilantro and maybe some pickled vegetables.  I would not choose this item again.  I also tried the strawberry shortcake (new).  The cake was flavorful and soft, strawberries were tart which was offset by the sweet whipped cream - lemon zest addded a nice touch.   The Dynamite Shrimp was really good - tender, not greasy, and mixed well with the crunchy noodles.

Incompetent and rude hostesses. Inability to seat despite a half empty restaurant. Seating people in front of me also wins points. Oh and CPK, that couple who also left when we did? We saw them at Bravo where we were seated immediately.

This CPK always gave us exceptional service. I have gone here twice for a co-workers going away dinner and the other one a birthday day dinner, mind you there were 19 of us, and they accommodated and were so attentive to us. For both times we did go around 7pm when they were busy. They always checked in on us (while we were waiting outside and while we were seated) and the food is, of course, delish! I love the chicken avocado rolls (not the exact name).  Yes the wait is kind of long, we waited maybe 20-30 mins, but when you have a good company with you the time flys by fast :) Definitely going back!

Been to other CPK's before, so this review is just on the Pearlride location and our takeout service. Being that there is no CPK in Maui (sans the sad ASAP location at the Kahului Airport which you can't order from unless you're traveling,) we wanted some takeout for our dinner that night. Didn't call ahead.  Male server who took our order wasn't the happiest of people, but figured he had a rough day.  I still left a tip regardless of his service.  Ordered the Asparagus & spinach spaghettini and Broccoli sun-dried tomato fussili to go.  Another server packed our dinner very nicely.  Noticed that her hands never touched the bread, as she used the plastic bags they come in as a glove, grabbed the bread and turned the bag right side out, threw in the butter packets and tied in a knot.  Very nice to see that. As we left, the male server said "Have a good day."  Hopefully the tip made his day better.  ;)

Whenever we walk past, CPK in Pearlridge always seems busy with a line out the door.  Finally, we were hungry and there wasn't a line so we went. I decided to try the mac and cheese entree.  To relieve a bit of the guilt, I ordered it with the whole wheat pasta since CPK serves the pan type that is made to order.  It was good, better than cheap boxed stuff and better than Wendy's, but nowhere near as rich, creamy, and and cheesy as Panera Bread's or Boston's MMMac & Cheese's. The Mrs. ordered the Hawaiian pizza.  Okay with lots of pineapple and Canadian bacon but not enough sauce.  Should have taken Jane L's cue and ordered the honey wheat crust because the regular crust wasn't too good.  Medium thickness, not crisp but not quite substantial either.  Really didn't have the texture of a pizza baked in a "real" pizza oven.  Some colleagues have told me that the frozen pizzas taste just like the restaurant one and now I really believe them.

CPK never fails! I love their pizzas!  It seems very busy so make reservations or you know what, Call it in and pick it up!  I usually sit at the bar because it's always entertaining to see the cooks make the pizzas and how fast they do it.  My recommendations - the japanese eggplant with honey wheat crust along with thai chicken pizza!

This place is really relaxing. Only problem is you have to wait and drink beer while you wait. The beer is really good and the waiting is pretty interesting. There were a lot of interesting people to people watch. Not like perv kine just ... Well you know. It was a great evening eating all of my fav's... Malama Pono Lester.

Overall, the quality of the food is great. Sometimes the appetizers can be a little over-salted (The last few times I've been, my lettuce wraps were a bit too salty)...but that might just be me and my sensitive taste buds. I love, love, love their salads. Never had one I didn't like yet! Their soups are also very delicious. My biggest gripe with this CPK is the long wait.  There seems to always be at least a 30-45 min wait (which isn't that bad, unless you're super hungry!!!) I guess this is a sign of good business, so it's not that big of a deal.  This review is probably one of the shortest I've ever written, lol. But I figured I'd give my two cents.

If I could give this place 6 stars I would! Manager Randy and our server Neil took especially great care of my mom and I, and what a wonderful way to end an especially rough week for my mom.  We ordered the chicken lettuce wraps, roasted vegetable salad, and our favorite habaneros carnitas pizza with a glass of a delicious. The timing of our appetizers and  entrees were perfect, and the service from the seating to the food were excellent.  At every CPK I've been to between hawaii to DC, the food has always maintained a certain standard and I really appreciate that you can expect the same quality of food at every restaurant. Service can be hit or miss, but Pearlridge CPK definitely has my kudos!  Thank you thank you again to Manager Randy and Neil for an evening that was very much enjoyable!

Love,love,love CPK..  I look at YELP daily, so I need to wright more reviews since I love this site. 1)Service is great!! I've never had bad service there.. 2)Food- BBQ salad,  BBQ pizza, S..t pretty much any pizza is good..     The wife eats some kind of Veg sandwich too.. supper good.. 3)My kids like it, so if they like it I love it... lol KID ARE SO PICKY!!!! 4)Shopping is always fun, so going to the mall then eating CPK is a good day to me..
Love CPK. Great salads. fast service. friendly staff.

Love the food here!  Friendly service.  I really love the Mediterranean Salad and the Lettuce Wraps.  Those are pretty much the only things I order when I go here.  Wish they didn't discontinue the Focaccia Bread.  That should have been a keeper.   Other great items on the menu are Chicken Piccata (love capers) and the Spinach & Artichoke dip.  My husband always orders the Pepperoni Pizza, so I'm assuming it's pretty good.  Just a great place to go with friends or the family. Wait can be gruesome.  Gotta go right before the lunch and dinner rush.  Otherwise, you can end up waiting over 45 minutes.

Hands down, they give the BEST service compared to the other locations *cough*Ala Moana*cough*.  I always come here for their garlic cream fettuccine with chicken b/c no other restaurant makes it like that!!! The only down-side is when it gets busy (95% of the time) the food lacks. Some days my pasta is superb and other days I feel like writing a complaint. I love that you can try food and if you don't like it, then you can return the food and get what you do like!!! Service is great & the managers are extremely nice. They have recently changed their menu & the hot fudge brownie sundae is not one of the desserts anymore :(

CPK food is always delicious but today they earned only 2 stars for their service. First off we were seated right away as the restaurant was not busy. But our server took forever to come take our order. Once she did come by we made sure she got our drinks, appetizers and main course because we didn't want to wait for her to come back. Well, we had a couple of requests on our meals, no cilantro and no onions. When then meals came out, guess what. Cilantro and onions. We sent it back and had to wait for them to come out with "new" dishes. New in parenthesis because the pizza still had onions embedded in the cheese. So I think they just took it in the back and plucked off what they could.  The restaurant was busy but not packed but the service was slower than expected. Will we go back? Probably because we like CPK food. It's just on this visit we were not impressed by the service.
Today i thought i would try something besides pizza. Had the jambalaya fettucinne. very good.

Decided to finally try this place after walking by it for many years. It was okay. The chicken piccatta is a bit too lemony. But the butter cake ala mode is to die for. Will definitely go back for dessert.

Nice friendly service here at the Pearlridge location. This place gets packed, even on weekdays, they open at 11 a.m. and it is filled by 11:30 a.m.  I did a take out order today, about a 20 minute wait from ordering to getting my order. I only ordered a salad, so other items could take longer. They now have a buzzer at this location which is great, they told me the buzzer works in Ross and in Pearlridge Center up to Cookie Corner. Much better than having to wait there for your order.  I took off one star not because of this location but because of the CPK pricing. $10.50 for a 1/2 size BBQ Chicken salad plus $2.50 for avocado is pricy for a 1/2 size salad. But heck, that isn't this location's fault. I enjoy this location on island the best.

love,love,love CPK! Food never disappoints. Service was great, refills kept coming before we ran out.  Server was attentive and on it. Appetizer came out quickly, egg rolls are the best and main dishes followed shortly after. Manager even stopped,by at the end and asked how everything was and if they can do anything to improve.  It's great to see companies that care and want to improve for their customers.

We went there for a late night get together.  There was 9 of us, and the staff welcomed us warmly and took very good care of us. All of us ordered different stuff, and shared.. The appetizers, pizza, red velvet cake, and fudge was amazing and we ate like kings. All of it was delicious.

Peter the bartender doesn't really watch the bar that great.. 2nd time coming and same service from him.. drinks not refilled.. 5 people standing within 5 ft of me all,talking story while I wave my glass in the air.. Even the mgr walked right by without noticing.. Id rather drive to kahala where I actually get service..

The 3 stars is for my daughter who loves anywhere that has cheese pizza. As for my husband and I, it was okay.  The bread and butter was nothing special, plain bread that you can buy anywhere.  I ordered the chicken picata that was soaked in lemon.  I could enjoy it at all, I puckered with every bite.  We will probably go back for my daughter but I will have to try something else.

My taste buds are dancing! I ordered the spicy chicken chipotle pizza and it was like a flavor explosion in my mouth. The chipotle sauce had a nice spicy kick to it, but not too spicy where you feel like you ears are steaming. I was afraid that the adobo sauce was going to be a little salty, but that was not the case. It was delicious and had a perfect balance of flavor. It came topped with a corn and black bean salsa and I'm someone that hates corn, but the sweetness of the corn gave the pizza a sweet and savory flavor, which I believe was a necessary flavor to make this pizza amazing. So kudos to them for this amazing flavor combination. This was my first visit to a CPK and I had always assumed it was just a regular pizza place with the normal sauce, meat, cheese kind of place. I never realized just how much variety they offered. The restaurant was pretty clean and our waitress was very attentive to make sure our drinks were full and everything was tasting great. The food also came at a pretty fast pace considering it was a packed restaurant.  I will definitely be coming back to try the many different unique selections they offer...maybe try the peking duck pizza (sounds good), but overall a great experience and the only bad thing is that I never had any room to try their desserts. I recommend any foodies out there to sink their teeth in their deliciousness. Happy eatings! Note:  The appleberry sangria rocks!!!

When: Thursday, Nov. 29th 7:00 pm, Party of 2 Adults We normally visit this location at least once a month and sit at one of the counter chairs. We love the food, but have encountered slow customer service issues in the past, but it wasn't anything major. However, the experience that we encountered last night will make us spend our dining dollars somewhere else. It took "Mike" about 15 minutes before acknowledge us and clearing the glasses & napkins from a previous customer. Another 15 minutes went be until we finally  get to place our order of 1) Pear & Gorgonzola Pizza, 2) Original BBQ Chicken Pizza and 3) Cup of Tortilla Soup. The Cooks delayed our order because they wasn't any Pears at the Prep table. When the Pear Pizza finally came out of the oven, the Kitchen Supervisor calls out "where's the Original BBQ" Cooks reply, "went out already", Kitchen Supervisor responds, "fast track an Original BBQ". After nearly 50 minutes since sitting down at the counter, we get to eat. By then, Mike knowing we were angry avoided eye contact with us and kept telling the cooks "you guys killing me". He then calls the manager, who in a non apologetically manner comes to us and says "sorry for the wait, we will comp the meal, but cannot comp alcohol", then walks away. Fine, with that attitude and customer service I can take my disposable dining dollars elsewhere, and we will.

After some shopping at Pearlridge, my husband and I decided to grab a bite at CPK before going to the movies. We sat at the bar and were served by Shelly. Service was friendly but a little on the slow side. Only got one refill even though my glass was empty again before finishing my pizza so I didn't have anything to drink with my dessert. That's the only complaint I have about the service.  The food did come out fast and was absolutely delicious. I love sitting at the bar because you can actually see your pizza going in and I think it took about 10 min or so for it to come out. I had the Jamaican Jerk Chicken and my husband the BBQ Chicken. Both were cooked perfectly and the flavors are great! Definitely recommend these items. For dessert, I had the usual: Belgian chocolate souffle and my husband was kinda mad he didn't order it because it is sooo delicious. Very rich chocolate flavor and I always get the ice cream on top to give that nice balance between cold and warm.
Great staff.  My order didn't come out properly the first time but the manager corrected it very fast.  waitress was very friendly.  Always had a smile on her face.

I don't think I've ever had a bad experience here at CPK. Tonight the wait was relatively short (about 10 minutes) and I'm glad that they have buzzers now to call you when they're ready to seat you.  I'm probably really late on that, but I haven't been here in a while.   The service was great. Friendly staff that greeted us from the moment we walked in, helped us at our table, and thanked us when we left.  Our server was Kurtis, and he did a great job at making us feel comfortable and told us which items were popular on their menu.  He seemed legit.  I ordered the Margherita pizza and my boyfriend ordered some pepperoni mushroom cheese pizza.  We shared the famous spinach artichoke dip as an appetizer and the chocolate souffle for dessert.  All were amazing choices and I would definitely order them again.  I usually order the Jamaican Jerk Pizza.  That has been my favorite ever since I started going to CPK. Overall, this dining experience was great and we will definitely be back.

Came to this location for the first time on dooms day around 8pm, it was pretty packed for this hour. I guess everyone wanted CPK for their last supper. they said the wait was around 20-25 mins. waited for around an hour! Got seated. and then waited for about 10 mins for our order to even to be taken Now 2 families were sitting on both sides of us and they were being taken really good care of.. BOTH their orders came out first when they ordered way after us -___- our waitress said ours would be out shortly.. by the time the families were half way through dinner ONE of our pizzas came.  while it was still really busy one of the workers were fucking vacuuming in the middle of the walk way, you cant find any other time to vacuum the store?! seriously, pissed me off when our waitress said our wait was taking long because everyone was busy. so at the end she felt bad that we basically had a 2 hour dinner and offered us dessert on the house. I passed because that wouldve taken another 30 mins to just scoop up ice cream and bring it out. by the time we got our check our waitress was missing. so i went up to the take out stand to pay, she basically chased me down right when she saw me go up after about 5 mins of waiting for her to get the check.  What, did you want your tip? you are getting a friggen dollar for this experience.  Making big families your priority because they tip better is a big mistake.  We usually tip $20+ because we know you guys live off tips  Ala Moanas CPK is more professional, not to mention alot bigger

My friend & I had lunch there today. I arrived at 10:50am to meet at 11am. Not much of a wait wasn't that crowded yet and the hostess seated within 10 minutes. Our server Jodie was excellent, very attentive to us making sure we were okay with our meal & drinks. I had some screen shots of Yelp photos of CPK dishes I wanted to try. 2 out of 4 they no longer served which were Miso Shrimp Salad and Broccoli Sun Dried Tomato Fusilli. Jodie said they change the menu every once so often. I had a Strawberry Mojito which was just okay tasted like juice. The next drink Mango Mojito was much better. I had the Asparagus & Spinach Spaghettini with Salmon. Portion was large but the spaghettini was on the dry side. Menu did say light pasta with olive oil. Appetizer we shared lettuce wraps with chicken, this was tasty & light. No room for dessert but I wish i had, I wanted to try the Salted Caramel Pudding. As we were talking during lunch I later noticed we were sort of "yelling" over the music. This was the only downfall. The bill was reasonable for the 2 of us not so sure if I brought my family (total of 4). I think my bill would easily be over $100 plus tip. I definitely would come back to try different dishes AND drinks.

Was out and about today and needed some quick gluten free food.  Used the Find Gluten Free app and there was this place.  Pizza isn't GF, but the salads sure are great!  Had one that resembled an Italian sub.  That works!!!!
Great service, friendly staff. Great food. This place always hits the spot for me. Highly recomend anyone lookin for a decent establishment to spend their hard earned dollars on.

I'll be honest, I haven't been to a CPK I didn't like.  Fun factoid of the day: I've met quite a few people here who had no idea what CPK stood for.... WHOA mind blown! This CPK always seems crowded for dinner.  I completely understand since there aren't too many sit down places for pizza here in Aiea.  Boston's doesn't count.  For a group of 4 we waited close to 45 minutes the Friday before Halloween.  Honestly, I wouldn't wait that long unless I had an entertaining group of friends to keep me going.   The hubs and I always end up sitting at the bar, though, where there is always room for two and you can get buddy-buddy with the bartender who pours your glass of wine! Yeah that looks like five ounces :D Most people obviously order pizza, but guess what? You can buy that at Safeway!  If you are feeling a little adventurous, try their chicken enchilada/fajita soup and their tossed greens salad.  It is my favorite salad ANYWHERE.  The lettuce is not dowsed with dressing, merely glazes.  Accompanied with walnuts and sliced pears.  You can share a whole portion with a partner, or buy a half portion for yourself.  Honestly, I'm full by the end of my half portion.   Paired with the soup, the soup ends up in the to go box.   Don't get me wrong though, every flavor of pizza I've ordered there has been delish.  A safe bet, you just can't go wrong.
The service was great had an amazing dinner the jambalaya was awesome full of flavor and they boxed up my leftovers to take home.

My family and I love dining at California Pizza Kitchens.  They have the best salads and their Sedona Tortilla Soup is among our favorite soups served from an establishment. This is a very popular restaurant for Mall patrons and always seems seems to have a wait time, especially for dinner.  It would be nicer if they had a larger seating area to accommodate all the customers wanting to dine in.  This is probably one of the smallest branches I have ever been to. I'm a big salad person, so I always get one of their very appetizing, colorful salads.  So far I have tried their Original BBQ Chopped chicken salad, Waldorf Chicken Salad, California Cobb, Roasted Veggie, and Thai Crunch Salads along with a sample slice or two of their pizzas and a pasta dish, but I still remain a big fan of their salads, mainly the Thai Crunch Salad.  It's kind of funny that I come to a pizza kitchen and never have any interest in ordering one of their pizzas. The service here can be hit or miss, so I was having trouble deciding between giving this place 3 or 4 stars.  The food deserves a definite strong 4 stars, but the service is a bit lacking.  Many times I wasn't offered bread, so I had to request it and everything takes so long to come out from your drinks to your food.  And forget about any refills because they never come around for that.

We were in the Pearl Ridge area looking for a place to eat and ended up at California Pizza Kitchen. I went with my sister and her husband so we were able to share a pizza, pasta and salad. Always nice if you can do family style... try more things off their menu. The Pizza is thin crust, so it has that nice crispy crunch to it, which is always great to have. The pasta... hmm, if you are a pasta fan i wouldnt recommend it. I dont like my pasta over cooked, so this was not my favorite dish. They are known for their salad and you cannot go wrong here. The service was nice and they accommodated us my big stroller, which always makes a mama happy!

Went on Presidents' Day, it was definitely crowded , surprisingly we didn't had to wait that long. Service was excellent, my only disappointment was the food. It was about 1 in the afternoon and they were already out of fish tacos!  Bummer!!  Got the club sandwich instead, it was good but I would of rather have the tacos!!

Quite possibly the second worse dinning experience I have ever had. This CPK is ALWAYS busy.  I guess because it's so small and can't handle too many customers at once.  This was my first time going there and based on this experience, I will probably never ever go there again.  We had a pretty large group.  There were 11 of us, not too huge, but out of the ordinary.  So I expected a wait for a table.  They told us about an hour, but it was really like an hour and a half.  When we finally got in service was EXTREMELY slow.  Our waitress took our drink order and appetizer order fairly quickly, but only 2 of our group ordered appetizers.  She didn't come back until about 30 minutes later to take our dinner order.  Our food took forever to come out.  I guess because they were waiting for the whole parties order to be ready at the same time(?).  So all in all, it took about 3 hours for our whole dining experience.  I kept seeing parties coming in after us, getting their food before us, and leaving before us.   Also the restaurant is so small it's claustrophobic.  I swear I kept getting bumped into, at least 10 times.  A little annoying when you're trying to enjoy yourself.

Besides the wait time of over 40 minutes. I got to say CPK is trustworthy go to when hungry. The food is always consistent and service is usually great.  This past visit the waitress in training forgot to bring out one of our dishes. It wasn't til everyone nearly finished that she came by and realized that our dear friend was starving. The situation turned around quickly as they raced over the order, took the pizza off our tab and included FREE desert. Got to love a place who is willing to go above and beyond when making a mistake. For that reason a solid 4 star!!!!
Great place!  I'm obsessed with the wheat crust hawaiian barbecue chicken pizza!! So good! :)

When my girlfriend and I like to treat ourselves once in a while to a nice meal we decide to go to CPK. The atmosphere is wonderful. We always sit at the counter top and watch our pizza cook to perfection. I like that there is a big TV sitting on the wall so I can watch my OKC Thunder dominate the West.  We recommend the Thai chicken Pizza, Sicilian Pizza, Avocado Rolls, Lettuce Wraps and the Brownie Desert.  Also we noticed people leaving bad reviews on a waiter names Mike. It's true. He is not the greatest.

I took my family to what we thought would be a relaxing dinner. We went early since we know it can get busy and the wait can be long. We strolled in at around 5pm and there were plenty of open tables. The food is not the issue at CPK, it was how we were served. The server was ok, but everything we ordered came late and all at once. My beer, the kids meals, appitizers and main dishes. WTF!! This is only an indication that they want us out of there and pronto!! I know they are in business to make money, but they're not getting anymore of my cash. We mentioned this to the server but she really didn't give a shit! She probably just wanted to turn that table for extra cash. What a turn off. After we spoke with her, she conveniently was unavailable for us. Sorry CPK, you guys might have good food, but for the price and the way you treat customers, I'd be happier spending my $$$ at one of your competitors.

Took the family for Allyson' s birthday dinner,started off ,started off terrific,got a table within 5 minutes even though it was packed! Everrything went well until I was served my entree,I didn't have any bread,food server stated I had to specifically ask for it,anyway she stated she would bring it,10 minutes later the manager brought it.Ordered the icecream fudge for Allyson,the wait seemed like an eternity,and it was on its way of melting. It was gratis by the manager.... Recommendation: 3-4 more waithelp

Pearlridge CPK is my favorite location. Great staff, very attentive MOD, quick service and my favorite YOU CAN NOW CALL AND ADD YOUR NAME ON THE WAITLIST FOR A SPECIFIC TIME.  I have been waiting for CPK to take reservations and they are getting one step closer. So they cant promise that your table will be ready by the requested time but it's never been more than 5 minutes after the time I requested. LOVE IT. They now have a Pizza Dough rewards. For every $100 you spend dinning (take out included) you get $5 to use on your next visit and they throw in free offers once in a while. So far i've gotten a free small cravings plate and a free dessert.

I know you guys LOVE my rants about chain restaurants...so if you don't, then don't read LOL! So I ordered the Asparagus and Spinach Spaghettini from CPK Pearlridge. And as I go through my pasta, I find a chunk of SALMON in my pasta! Okay for you guys, but not for me (I can explain why if you ask). I am not about to waste this lunch, so I just dumped the carcass in the trash. I called CPK and the manager was very apologetic, and gave me a free pasta dish the next time I go! I love your customer service! 4.5 STARS for you, CPK Pearlridge!!!

can't beat the valentine day celebration for two for $30! appetizer, two entrees, and dessert.  spinach artichoke dip - arrived lukewarm chicken garlic fettucine -  as bf explained not as creamy as before bbq chicken pizza on honey wheat - crust has changed, came out almost cardboard consistency. i think a good dough is chewy with air pockets. butter cake alamode - cake was cold with a teeny scoop of ice cream overall an affordable price for a complete meal. rating this time was on the quality of the food. from what i heard they changed ownership/management/staff. the hostesses, waiters/waitresses and cooks all new. also i think the change from semi formal to casual uniforms were a bad choice. i like the all black w/ tie with name tag look compared to the bright polo shirt w/ jeans.

I love CPK.... I've never ate anything here that I didn't like.  They have a new Pizza Dough rewards program that you can sign up at the restaurant or on your iphone. You get a starter plate for free just signing up. For every $100 you spend on food you get $5 back. Not a bad deal when you know your going to spend it here.  We had the best waiter, Solomon. He was so personable and just great. I didn't even have to ask for things because he already knew what I wanted without asking. Love it!!  We ordered the Habanero Pizza which was really good and hot (like it should be).  We ordered the Mediterranean Focaccia which was really disappointing. It didn't have much flavor at all. We ordered the crispy Mac and Cheese for my daughter. (I ordered the wrong thing, I thought I was getting normal Mac and Cheese, but this was totally my fault.... scatterbrained!) I ordered the Chicken Milanese which is always my favorite. It's panko crusted with arugula and tomatoes and fresh Parmesan on top. It comes with 1 lemon to squeeze on top. I like using 2.  They have a great selection in beer and also have a few good wines as well. It's always a favorite place to stop. We will be back and will be asking for Solomon.

CPK is CPK to me! Always good food!  This is a smaller location than most. I came in on saturday around 11:45am. There was a 20 minute wait. I ordered the usual. White pizza for me & cheese for my daughter. No complaints. Waitress was sweet. Very personable. She made small talk with us. Them towards the end she became kind of scatter brain. We asked for a bag for our leftovers & she totally forgot. She only remembered when she saw is get up & leave. Too late.  But other than that, it was ok!

I've loved CPK since I was in high school!  Love almost all the pizza's, the lettuce wraps are so good and my favorite dish I never get tired of is the Asparagus, Spinach Spaghettini with Grilled Chicken!!! I have about 4 refills of the Strawberry Lemonade also, lol.

This place changed A LOT. Supposedly they change management and the whole environment of the place. The number one thing that threw me off was the uniforms of the servers. Blue jeans and blue button down shirts. It looked really off because the colors are all different. It just didn't look professional. I barely go to CPK because of the wait and sometimes the food is just okay, however my mom wanted to go today because she first tried this place when we were visiting California with her friends. So the prices are obviously more here than in the mainland. Anyway, it was my first time at CPK in almost over a year and I definitely did not like the change of the environment. The Food: My mom and I ordered the BBQ Chicken Pizza and the Thai Crunch Salad. First of all, our order took FOREVER. About 30 minutes and it wasn't just us, it seemed to be everyone around us. I don't remember service being THAT slow. BUT, the Thai Crunch Salad was pretty good. I like the edamame they add in there, and supposedly the mainland CPK's don't add edamame in their salads. The BBQ pizza was of course good, the bread was cooked nicely. A nice thing they did to kinda show their apology of waiting was they gave us bread and olive oil... but that stuff is always free. Overall: Food: 4/5 Service: 4/5 Environment: 3.5/5 I would probably recommend going to the Ala Moana one because its more spacious. I felt bad for my mom because the server was taking an order from the table next to us and his back/butt was so close to my moms face LOL She looked really uncomfortable.
Placed a phone order. Very thorough on the phone but when it was time for pick up, it was missing a few things. Little things in an order do make a difference!

The wife and kids really love California Pizza Kitchen!  The food is always great, the wait staff is usually on top of things, and the price for a family dinner out is reasonable.  At the Pearl Highlands location, it's the wait time and waiting area outside that SUCK!   This place is always busy, and there's just not enough wait area on the inside. Just outside the door is a ramp/walkway that's meant to be a shortcut for shoppers cutting across one end of the mall to the other.  Patrons for CPK stand or lean on the railings here until their buzzer thingies go off, then they enter the restaurant.  The wait is always 45-minutes or longer, and the amount of foot traffic going through that walkway makes it incredibly uncomfortable.  This needs fixing. Back on the inside, while the food is always top quality, a few years back, they changed their bread policy.  They don't freely offer it anymore, you must ask for it.  Some shoppers don't realize that they can still get bread if they simply ask, and that sometimes makes you feel like Jean Valjean in Les Miserables.  Embarrassing. They get four stars because of the service and food quality, but I actually prefer going to the Ala Moana Mall location because of its convenience and ambiance.

Who doesn't love CPK? The food is good and it's a very popular spot with it's menu of diverse and healthy options. However, I did not like the way my food was prepared during my most recent visit here just last week. I ordered the garlic cream fettuccini with chicken. Adding chicken was and EXTRA 3 dollars. When my pasta came, it literally had 4-5 very small diced chicken pieces in the pasta. When I started eating it, I couldn't even detect the sensation of chewing on a piece of chicken meat. I think the small pieces disintegrated into my sauce or something. My pasta totaled a cost of about 14 bucks. I feel like I did NOT get any value for my money. NOT AT ALL. But being pregnant and craving something rich and carby, I ate without complaining. Plus, our waitress was such a sweetheart, I really didn't want to be any trouble. Ah well.... You win some you loose some.... My boyfriend's food was great! He ordered the Italian Deli sandwich with a side of split pea/barley soup. Everything he has was awesome. Grrrr..... I ended up scavenging off his plate whatever he didn't eat.  This place is known for LONG wait times and service. So be aware of that if you are going during peak business hours, like noon time for lunch, during dinner hours.

My favorite restaurant - the best service, amazing food, and now winning my business back over and over with Pizza Dough Rewards. My favorite location is Pearlridge followed by Ala Moana and Waikiki. the service at Kahala was lackluster the last time I visited. I boycotted CPK for a year when they revamped their menu and took away the miso shrimp salad, but I've since discovered the Moroccan spiced chicken salad and that has more than made up for that earlier disappointment.

Checked in at 11:00 am for party of five women aged 67 at CPK Pearlridge.  Many tables of two and four seats were open because it had just opened for lunch at 10:30 am.  Received buzzer and was told a table would be readied for us.  Instead we sat waiting for close to 40 minutes while they seated more than 15 other parties (tables).  Instead of putting two tables together or adding a chair to a table of four,  they appeared to be waiting for the one table in the entire restaurant (exaggeration) that seated five to become available.  The  entire waiting line, including those outside, was cleared and seated TWICE over before we decided to go to the podium to ask why we were not being seated.  The response was they were waiting for a table to open up.  They ended up placing a chair on a table of four when they realized they had kept us waiting long enough.  Poor, poor planning and no foresight.  WARNING:  if there are more than 4 people in your party, DO NOT GO!  Or you should expect a wait of over 40 minutes and watch parties of four pass you by.  We should have walked out but one person in our party had been looking forward to the experience of eating there which is why we patiently waited 40 minutes and only inquired once about our status. We will definitely not make the mistake of going there again. Contrary to Marielle's review below, we were told they do not take reservations.

Reviewing this place a bit late. Came here on the fourth of July cause we both were craving some pasta. Arrived here around 3 p.m. and since it was a holiday I thought they might've been packed. They weren't but was getting there. Got seated at a table four four. Food is always good here. Service was alright... it took a while for us and our waitress to warm up to one another. Started off with my favorite, their lettuce wraps! Compared to visits before, I think they're offering less lettuce? The filling is still good on its own. Next we ordered pizza, mushroom. Between the two of us, that's a lot of food. Lastly ordered some spaghetti. By the time it came out, I was already getting full. I did help to eat it here and there.

Typical for a CPK. They have a lot of options but it's usually safest to stick to their signature dishes. Our server was very attentive and did a really good job with making sure we were taken care of throughout the meal.  I would recommend their quinoa salad. I ordered it so my mom could try quinoa for the first time, and it ended up being one of the best dishes of the meal.

I come here just to eat the fresh lettuce wraps. My favorite salad is the California Cob with the beets! Don't worry about the long line, it's worth the wait, but I recommend that you call California Pizza Kitchen  before going there and they can put your name on the wait list.

This place is always teeming with activity. There's always a line, which reaches records on Friday nights.  Me and my boyfriend come here once in a while when we feel a little fancy. We're both students so we tend to stick to Zippy's or plate lunch places for dinner. Parking here is easy and much more accessible than the Ala Moana Location.We don't have to walk through the mall to find it when we're starving.But if we do decide to shop and dine, its convenient location in the middle of the mall makes it possible.They give out buzzers so you are able to walk through the mall if you want. We enjoy this place because service is always great, the atmosphere is clean and festive-a great place to celebrate even little things like Friday Payday!I do wish there were more waiting benches since leaning against the railing does get uncomfortable, not to mention this makeshift waiting area does block up the sidewalk. The food here is amazing! We usually order the spinach artichoke chip and dip appetizer and pizza. In the past we've tried Pear and Gorgonzola thin crust, the Thai Chicken regular crust, the California Club, and the five cheese and Tomato pizzas.  We've also tried the Chicken Tequila Fettucine pasta.Out of the pizzas, the California Club seems to be our favorite, with the Five Cheese coming as a close second.Their pizzas are enough to fill you. I'm a petite person so I usually only eat half.  When ordering dessert we recommend the Belgian Chocolate Souffle Cake.It is ala mode and is rich and creamy and so full of deliciousness!!!

CPK is a safe and consistent place to grab dinner with friends or family. They're always busy and there's a reason for it. I think they have a really great business model.  The servers really know what they're doing and I can't think of a time I've had bad customer service from them. EVER. They bring bread and take orders for drinks immediately. They are polite and courteous and make sure to check up on you at least once after the food comes. What else could you ask for?  The food comes out pretty quickly, too. Despite those long lines, I don't think I've ever waited more than 20-25 minutes for food. I generally order their pizza, though. I think the title of the place is a pretty big indicator of where the good stuff is on the menu. I've tried their other dishes, like the salmon, but I'm not a big fan. I used to order the Greek, but once they scratched that off the menu, I've been getting their Chipotle Chicken Pizza. Yum! The only downside is that because it's always busy, expect to wait A LONG, LONG time for a seat. Especially on the weekends. I've been asked to wait 1-2 hrs before, so sign in early! They don't take reservations.  If you hate waiting, you can always order online or over the phone. They have a really cool CPK app that folks with smartphones can use. I use it to do take out for lunch sometimes. Just as a side note, I've had my order not go through using my iPhone and I've heard from the CPK manager that the app is sometimes glitchy on the iPhone.

Lettuce Wraps are super yummy! Haven't tried much of the other menu items because the ones I usually order are so yummy that I can't pass it up to try something else everytime I come here. The only downfall I think there is, is the the wait time can get super crazy!

Only 3.5 stars here? I just had a lunch my friend there and experienced pretty good time. I had Thai Crunch Salad (full size) and it is yummy as always. I am not a big fan of avocado, so I did not add. My friend had Lettuce Wraps, it was looked good, too. Service was very prompt and nice. Not sure the lady's name, but she checks on us in a good pace. (I don't like to be checked too often anyway) and very friendly too. I see some reviews on here says there are safe dishes and not. Maybe is that why the start keeps just in the middle?  Receiving greetings from other servers, kitchens and maitre d's when we re leaving a big plus too.

Spectacular experience!  Came in around 8pm on a Saturday night.  There was a 30 minute wait for a table, but the hostess let us know we could be served at the counter.   Our waitress, Nicole, was awesome!   Perfectly attentive but not overbearing, friendly, made eye contact, and knew her product!   The crowd was a blend of families and couples out for the evening, both of which fit in perfectly.  I highly recommend!

Went last month and had the chicken piccata. I believe it came with two pieces of chicken and a decent portion of pasta. Everything tasted good and by the end of it, I had enough to take home for a small dinner. This place filled up really fast, so if you plan to have lunch here, you should plan to come as soon as it opens.

Went here after hearing they had the best veggies for pizza ever.  Weird reason to go but why not? The service was decent seated fairly quickly, served quickly waiter was good. The pizza was very good but definitely not the best veggies.  We had the california veggie with green peppers and chicken added.  The Chicken tasted so good it made me wish we ordered a full chicken pizza.  There prices here were also amazing for what you get.  Good experience but not amazing.  Solid place for when you want something a little better than your average delivery... but it's not digiorno either.
I ordered the White Pizza and a couple different mojitos and they were all pretty incredible. I sat at the bar since I was on my own and the staff was very friendly. Overall a pretty great eat!

CPK has really stepped up  their game. Not like they weren't but they have exceeded my long time expectations of them. First of all they have a rewards card now. Everytime you go you can accrue points that you can use towards meals later, and you get freebies like small plates, and birthday desserts. Score! I am in love with their thin and crispy pizzas. The margherita and the Meat Cravers are so ono. I usually get the small plate wedge salad with Ranch dressing to start (only $5!). Boyfriend and I are addicted to the Butter Cake served with vanilla ice cream for dessert. Or if I'm having a healthy day I'll get a half size California cobb  with beets. Portions are huge, I have never once finished a meal here. Oh and they changed their bread! Its delicious crusty bread now with an herb olive oil dipping sauce. Fantastic!

Peking Duck pizza is still on the menu!!! I'm so happy! When you try to order take out online or with the call center, they don't have it because it's a Hawaii exclusive. You got to call directly to the restaurant to order it.

Overall I love this place.  The staff is always friendly and the food is USUALLY consistent. On this particular occasion I ordered the NEW Garlic Chicken pizza.  Unfortunately I was disappointed. I found myself eating mostly pizza crust. (and I ordered thin crust). Some slices only had 1 piece chicken on it and a little cheese.  The toppings were scarce.   I did however LOVE the Original BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad, which I always order, and a great glass of Rodney Strong Cab.
This is not actually for the restaurant itself, but for the link to the coupon.  DO NOT PRINT OR USE--EXCLUDES HAWAII!

We walked from the inside of the busy shopping mall of Pearl Ridge, exhausted, and fed up from being in the sights of corporate officials, I was hungry, very hungry. My lovely wife, whom has an excellent sense and taste in food told me we should try California Pizza Kitchen and the fact that it was right in front of my face staring down at me like a deliciously built empire of pizza and pasta bowls, watch out pizza hut.  We walked in and the atmosphere was loud with laughter, music, and a football game at once but hey it IS Sunday! It kind of annoyed me at first but I tried to bare it as I was very hungry. I scanned the menu that was given to me by the waitress who was very good to us that day (and I wish I remembered her name so I could include it but what ever) and I saw many things that looked good, but we got the guacamole egg rolls with a wild mushroom hand tossed pizza. Let me tell you my friends, these egg rolls lit up my life and made the California Pizza Kitchen my new home! I was impressed even with the two saucers of sauces they provided, after the seconds bite the noise and chaos of this place did not matter anymore I was consumed by what I was consuming and I haven't even got to our main dish yet!  The pizza was okay, it was a bit dry but we had the sauces so we dipped and ate. I was so full but I wish I had ordered MORE of those eggrolls. Loved it CPK!!! I am def coming back!
I had really good service here. The food was delicious! I would recommend this place.

My favorite thing about CPK are the desserts. The Butter cake with ice cream and the salted caramel pudding are sinful! My daughter absolutely loves the macaroni and cheese with edamame in it.   Items can be a bit pricey, but I like that they have a small bites menu and now flatbreads as well. The petite wedge and mushroom flatbread made for a delicious lunch.  Generally the servers are attentive and friendly so no complaints there. The managers almost always stop at your table to ask how your experience is which is nice.
Always good- great food- nice menu and so convenient to the mall- try the seasonal pumpkin cheesecake ;)
Quinoa salad was much to be desired. Thankfully they didn't charge me for it. :) The mango iced tea is good though.
-Great servers. -Very filling food for the price you pay. Favorite Dish from here would be the Veggie Salad w/ Salmon.

I'm in love with the Original BBQ chicken Chopped Salad with Avocados! This is so yummy!  I really think this restaurant has a lot going for it, friendly service, delicious food and good ambiance, but the one thing holding this from being a 5 star is the wait time for the food! I can't highlight that fault enough! Today I ordered the bbq chicken salad and my coworker ordered the lettuce wraps, very simple to make food items, but it still took 1 hour for us to get our food. the last time I came there were 4 of us and my grandpa ordered soup and i ordered a margharita pizza and my mom them ordered a mushroom and garlic or something like that pizza and it took over an hour. My grandpa is a man of very few words, but this is the first time I've ever seen him mad a restaurant. He kept saying "sheeeeesh, lets go home already" still a man of few words but very unhappy. I beg the Manager to hire more help in the kitchen or something to get the food out quicker a salad and chicken wrap is not something that should take an hour by any means!
Waited about two hours for very mediocre pizza. Go to Boston's north end pizza on kam highway, they'll give you real pizza! :)

Just came back and decided to write a review before I forget.  Ordered Sicilian Pizza tonight and it was OVERLY salty alongside there was barely any sausage. When we asked our waiter why it was so salty  he didn't say anything, just looked at us and walked right on to the next thing he was doing. Kinda rude to us.  We ordered half a Caesar salad and for us it was a unacceptable with regards to the portion and quality of it. There were barely any leaves or Parmesan shavings.  Overall quality of food, service and experience = won't be coming back.  Definitely prefer mom and pop shops where service, quality and food are typically more on point.

I normally go to this CPK because of the location. It's located in the pearl city / aiea area within pearlridge mall. If you go on busy afternoons or nights, be prepared to wait. They'll usually give you one of those buzzers that'll buzz when your table is ready. It still works and catches signal if you go inside the mall (don't worry, I see it all the time). Their food portions are pretty big, especially the salads. They come in either half or full sized. The menu changes sometimes, but it's usually better. CPK also serves their foods on new plates and it looks more fancy. They also serve bread with a new vinegar-like dipping sauce. The staff is usually friendly too. My only concern is the waits, both in and out of the restaurant. Other than that, this place is good!

I would not recommend this place if you are expecting awesome service and amazing food. For some reason this place is not as good as ala moana and pearl ridge locations. May be just my experience, but waikiki's food is just average and service is so-so. But the same dishes at other two locations taste way better and service is always ALWAYS great. They probably get tired and overwhelmed with tourists, but I don't think I'll ever be back

Best place to get a club sandwich!!! I always get it with the salad instead of their soup of the day. I also love their spinach and artichoke dip!!! Yum! Oh! And don't forget the BBQ chicken pizza! It's a must try. :)  Although the wait is ALWAYS long, the customer service will always make up for it.

Pearlridge's CPK location is like any other with its friendly service, extensive menu of pizzas and pastas, and long waits.   The CPK at Pearlridge is pretty notorious for its long lines.  On any given night (even random weekdays!) there are a few to many people waiting outside the restaurant for their name to be called!  Aware of their popularity, and subsequent crowds, this CPK seems to squish its tables closer together.  Good for getting more people in, bad if you are sitting next to 3 aunties  gossiping about all the other aunties...   Service has always been great, even outstanding at times!  Food is...a hit or miss.  Everyone has their CPK favorites and those never get old.  But when you try to branch out to try new things, you either find a new favorite or a reason to return to the original.  I have recently tried the Thai Chicken Pizza (7/10), Asparagus and Arugula Salad (8/10 - Large Portion for Small Plate!), and Crispy Mac n Cheese (2/10 - Just deep fried Mac n Cheese...)  I've learned my lesson: Just order the Thai Crunch Salad and go home happy!

Regardless of the location the food is always pretty good.  I'm not sure if this is because CPK is a chain restaurant or if the kitchen staff is always awesome. The only issue with CPK is that their service is usually really good or just mehhhh.  Today we went in for a late lunch at 1:30.  We were seated after a 20 minute wait and we were informed that gift cards were not being taken because their systems were down.  We waited FOREVER for our food.  I literally got full off of two plates of bread because it took so long.  My mom jokingly said she wanted to leave because the food was taking so long.  I understand that if the systems are down, things can be a little slower.  However, it's 2 in the afternoon and the restaurant was not that busy.  Then at the end of the meal I asked if she could take down my information for my pizza dough rewards and the said that was also down.  So basically the $50 we spent on lunch today doesn't apply to my points?  She said to bring the receipt next time and they might be able to apply it but she didn't seem confident in that.  I doubt anyone would even give me those points if I were to bring in the receipt.  OVER IT. Our server was really nice but the service in general was really slow, even though it didn't seem that busy.  And I was really unhappy that they didn't have a solution for the pizza dough rewards.  I've had better experiences at CPK (both here and the alamoana location) but lately it doesn't really seem to be cutting it for me.

January 2014: Come to Pearlridge on a Saturday or Sunday for lunch and this place is always packed.  I've been here many, many times and that's always the case! But why oh why do I continue to wait? The food's pretty good and the service is good. Two fundamental basics of having a food establishment. Thank goodness they now have those pagers that vibrate when your table is ready - it sucks standing outside. The pagers are good inside and the furthest you can go in is by Champs.  There was one point in my life where I would come here weekly with a friend of mine. It kinda was our place to hangout at. While that's no longer the case, I still feel a sense of comfort coming here - I really like the ambience of the place.  They've made a few good changes in my past few visits, starting with the bread. Gone is the nasty defrosted bread that came with the nearly frozen butter. They now serve toasted bread with olive oil. They also have an expanded menu, with small plates, more salad selections, and even tacos!   My faves: five cheese and fresh tomato pizza; Thai chicken pizza; four cheese ravioli and their Waldorf chicken salad. Oh and their raspberry iced tea and caramel pudding! My not so faves: flatbread small plates (too much bread); roasted artichoke and spinach pizza (just too much crust and not enough sauce makes this one very dry).

Yes its a chain, yes its typically always crowded and yes I ate there while in Hawaii.  As far as chain restaurants go I would rank it above average.  I am a fan of the Kung Pao spaghetti... A total fusion of comfort foods.  The thin crust oven baked pizza is ok overall  if you are going with something traditional like pepperoni and cheese.  The specialty pizzas can range from addictive to what was I thinking so it's more of a personal preference thing.  A few of my friends love the BBQ chicken pizza.  I'm lukewarm on it.  I prefer the habanero carnitas pizza which is a truly tasty and spicy beast.  The drawbacks at least at this location is that it is usually packed, especially during prime time.  So if you are famished, grab a snack from the food court while you wait which seems to be 45 mins plus.  With the crowds,  the service can get spotty.  While you never want to settle for mediocrity, it is in fact a chain restaurant albeit a slightly higher end one so you shouldn't be completely shocked.  I have been to others that aren't as busy and service has been perfectly fine.  I will be back again, try to miss peak times and exercise my inner Buddha if I don't in order to enjoy the dishes I crave.

This location is always busy so I used the call ahead feature to put or name on the list. As a group of moms with small kids, waiting can be challenging. We were seated right away because of that. We ordered 3 pizzas and a salad and it took almost 2hrs to get our food. Why 5 stars you might ask. I gave them 5 stars for the way they handled it. The manager came out and explained the kitchen was terribly backed up and offered us a discount plus some fruit bowls for our kids. It was still taking awhile so she added on vouchers for free meals for our next visits and free desserts this visit. Though the good took terribly long, they were on top of customer service, more than most places I've been. Food was as good as it always is. Food is pretty consistent between CPKs. Looking forward to going back and using my vouchers.

My family and i always go to this location especially because its so central or after a long day of shopping and you dont want to eat in the crowded food courts. I love the appetizers here as far as the spinach dip with pita bread and avocado egg   fave.i tried the jambalaya pasta and didnt care for it and my waiter Zaren was so awesome he offered to get me something else i did like because who wants to sit there and pay for something ($19) that you're not gonna eat.i thought it was pretty awesome of him to do that.i did stay safe and got alfredo with chicken and mushroom.i wish their pasta had more sauce to it because it is dry.I also love their pizzas (thai one especially) and you have to eat the butter   die for.Also on top of me not liking my jambalaya Zaren also took it off the bill( $20 tip for him). I give it a 4 star because sometimes the servers take long or my food.

CPK Pearlridge Center redeemed themselves. I frequently go to Pearlridge CPK after my doctor appointments. I went with my sister and we ordered the corn salsa dip and chips. The chips were stale. We told the waitress and she exchanged them for... other "stale" chips.  I had sent an email to let the restaurant know about their chips because the excuse we got was, "The chips are shipped in from the mainland and that is all we get." What, if the food is sub-standard you STILL serve it?!?! The manager sent me an email offering a free appetizer and entree. My sister and I went back and both the appetizer and entree were fresh and tasty. The fact that the manager tried to make up for our bad food experience and did say he talked to the food staff so that they're aware of the chips, makes me think that CPK does listen to their clients and really try to make things better. So hooray for CPK!

Huge letdown.  Its been ages since I've been here and it actually used to be better.  They changed the menu and  things are not as good, and even the salads are no longer paleo friendly.  Service was ok, but used to be fantastic.  Disappointed!
