Always busy, but the wait is worth it. Me & my Bf love to eat their spinach artichoke dip & chips, avocado rolls, & our fav Sicilian pizza!  For desserts Butter cake top with, vanilla ice cream ooh soo yummerz!  Cpk staffs, are super friendly & make u feel comfortably. ^-^

Now you're just somebody that I used to know. :( Oh CPK, I loved you once. A lot. I think I even went as far as calling you my favorite restaurant. But those days are so so so far gone.  I've been to CPK twice in the past two weeks. Because, in my head, CPK is where I've had some of my best meals. But every single time I go, it gets worse. And now, it's becoming more of a "if I have to" place to eat rather than a "I want to." Let's talk about what happened the last - last time I was there (about a week ago), I order the artichoke dip (a staple to any CPK experience). It comes out, it's good. Artichoke dip tastes good. But chips...so so stale. :( Sad times. Then, I decide that I want my roasted vegetable foccacia sandwich that I know and love, but realized that they no longer say that it's made with foccacia on the menu. So, I ask the server for clarification and she says "yes, it's foccacia I am SURE. You can have the garlic cheese or the herb onion." So of course, I get the garlic cheese (no brainer right?) When it comes out. 1st of all, it's french bread with parsley sprinkled on it. There's no way in hell this is foccacia. 2nd...where's the mound of roasted bell peppers and yumminess that used to be this sandwich? It's thin and lame. I bite the sandwich, and with every bite I am sure it is not foccacia (My friends, being nice people, said "well...maybe they bake it differently now"). Anyways, I eat it, and I tell the waitress when she FINALLY comes to check on us "I'm just letting you know, for your benefit, that this is NOT foccacia." and she said "Oh. but it IS." and I said "no, I know what this used to taste like and it's not, and it's ok, but I just wanted you to be aware because I don't want you telling another customer who specifically asks what bread it's on be lied to."  She asked if I wanted to speak to a manager, I said no. She then went away for awhile, came back, and then said...."oh, you know what it is, I always eat it with the garlic cheese bread. You should've ordered that type of foccacia it's the best." WHAT?! --- I was soooo irked because...I DID!  Anyways, she ended up telling her manager anyway who then apologized and said that our waitress was new and offered a free dessert. I declined the dessert because I didn't want anything out of this. I just wanted them to know that they are misrepresenting their product. It was more of an FYI for your own benefit thing.  I mean, even if she was a new waitress who "just came out of training", this lady swore up and down that it was foccacia and also swore that she ate it on cheese foccacia recently. So...idk. Get it together CPK. If your own employees who just got done training don't know what you're serving, how are the customers supposed to know what to expect from you? Fast forward to last night. My girlfriend decides to go to CPK and I agree, I mean, maybe it was just a weird bread problem the other night. We go, I order the white corn guac small plate. Had no taste. And from the last time I've had it, it seems to have gotten flooded with avocado with very little corn or beans at all. Sad times. I then go and order pasta. A staple. A go to. They can't screw this up right? WRONG. My ravioli was soooooo bland and tasteless. What happened to the cream sauce? Why does it taste like water? I don't understand! A friend of mine says that they make their pasta sauces in big batches now, and if the wrong person is serving and doesn't mix the sauce and just scoops it from the top, it's very possible that you get a bland, lame tasting pasta. I don't know if that's true, but it's really how it tasted. I was kinda wishing I had eaten somewhere else....anywhere else. Idk. CPK, you keep changing your menu. Your items, the way things are prepared. And it's just SADDDD. Because you used to be good and now I don't know what to expect from you. It's always been a mall restaurant. But now it's beginning to taste like a crappy bulk manufactured mall restaurant.  Sad times. I can't say I won't return because I probably will. It's in the mall and at least they have alcohol. But gosh darn it, I probably wont' enjoy it. Sad times CPK. Sad times.
Always a positive experience! The service is better at this CPK than any other location. Highly recommend!

We had take out from them and it was great pizza. They even gave us a side of bread with oil and vinegar to go. I ordered the pear and Gorgonzola pizza DELICIOUS! Great service and I was wishing we woulda ordered to dine in because what classy looking place. We are on our way to try it again.... I'll update review, but I think it will be another 5 stars.
CPK has the best oven baked pie on the island!!

It has a nice ambeance and its very clean I thought. I sat at the bar and the waitress was busy but she was attentive and very polite. My meal came in a good time considering they make it in front of you and it was delicious!!

Why I choose to endure a 30-40 minute wait at this place is beyond me.  The first time I ate here, I was amazed by the menu. All kinds of pizza and salads, and pasta too! It's not an Italian restaurant, it's CPK! Being an island girl all my life, I've always enjoyed American food and going to CPK made me think, "damn, so this is what they eat on the mainland!?" You must be thinking, what a dumb, naive, wannabe-from-the-mainland chick, right?  Anyway, I'm older and wiser now and know that there are better options the island has to offer, but CPK is a must for a couple staples on their menu.  First off: the artichoke dip. Best appetizer for a group of 4 or more, but even better when it's just you and a friend.. Less need to share :)  Their pizzas. You'd think you'd get a medium sized pizza from Pizza Hut with the price you're paying for, but the pizzas they serve here aren't typical. Less oily and more refreshing. Tickle your taste buds with the variety of pizzas they have in their menu. My faves: The California Club (because bacon and avocado are the loves of my life) and the Original BBQ Chicken.  And finally their salads. This place offers more than your classic garden and Caesar salads, they have a Thai crunch salad, Waldorf Chicken salad, and my fave the original BBQ chicken chopped salad. Now, i don't know the nutritional value of these salads, but a part of me thinks that these salads are not for the strict dieters. If my taste buds are rockin out in ecstasy, it's probably not as healthy as the name suggests.  I was thinking of giving it 3 stars, I'm cheap, and I don't think the menu prices are justified. A salad for more than $10? I might as well go to Aloha Salads and buy something I know is good for you. However, I can't think of a place that offers the same variety of menu options so for that reason, 4 stars it is.

One of my all time go to places when I eat out with friends and family ... Love love the service .. Waiters and waitress are all great at this location.. Soo far! And I love the food , appetizers , and dessert I give 4 stars because sometimes it's too stuffy in there and wait is long! Ouuuu and love thee pizza dough awards!!!  After a great day or night of shopping nice to unwind here at this location.

The price is reasonable for the quality of the food. The wait can be long but it's worth it depending on what you get. I don't like the bread and oil, I'd rather have the bread and butter. You can't forget dessert.

Service was good! We were there for over four hours....food fantastic and definitely a favorite on my list!   Forgot to add though CPK SUCKS MAJORLY on their rewards card program...I eat there often and since getting the reward card they have added NO PURCHASES for points and so I have earned NO REWARDS!!!!

My husband and I came here for an impromptu "date night".  Our wait was about 20 minutes but we didn't mind because we left the nagging kids at home.  As soon as we sat down we received EXCELLENT service from Meeka .  Although we were stuffed and had lots of leftovers, we still had room for the Butter Cake with ice cream. Yummmm!  We had no leftovers of our dessert!  When we complimented Meeka on her excellent service she mentioned that she might have been a bit delirious since she's been working for 11 hours so far today!

I went to CPK on a Friday night at 8:00 PM, and it was absolutely packed. The host was very friendly and informed me that I could wander pretty far in the mall and still be in range for the beeper thing, which was great! After waiting around for about an hour, my friend and I were feeling annoyed and cranky due the ridiculous wait as we were seated at our table. All of that vanished once we sat down! Our waiter, Jon, was immediately there and apologized for the long wait, and immediately gave us water and educated us on the wine menu and told us what the best pasta dishes were. We ordered immediately, (the cheese ravioli with mushrooms was to die for, as well as the dumpling appetizer!), and Jon was always there with perfect timing to keep our water glass full and clear dishes from our table. For dessert I had the butter cake (HOLY SWEET JESUS) and left the restaurant happy as a clam. The excellent service and the amazing food will definitely have me coming back! :]
Great customer service, happy and energetic employees. This dinning experience was excellent.

CPK lovers must avoid this location. Witnessed a waitress sneeze on her hand and rub her nose right before serving food to her customer! And on a separate occasion, roach ran across the cushion seats right before we were seated.

1st time at this location and I loved it!  We arrived for an early dinner and we were immediately seated and met by our waitress who quickly took our drink order.  We looked through the menu and i ended up getting the Hawaiian pizza and added serrano peppers thinking they were an equal substitution for jalapenos.......They were crazy HOT, I like spicy and these little miniature looking jalapenos were potent! The pizza was awesome and the addition of the peppers complimented it nicely.   My wife got the Roasted peach gorgonzola salad.  No complaints from her at all.  The waitress kept out soda full, saw that we had 3 children, one of which was getting a little cranky, and rushed all our food to us.  Even brought out our desserts quickly with our check. I liked this because it eliminated wait time, which in turn prevented our kids from further getting impatient.  Our 1.5 year old is great in restaurants but when she is tired only sleep will work, lol. I enjoyed this location and Id eat here again.

Seriously?!? This CPK is by far my FAVORITE! The staff and management here is ALWAYS incredibly nice and they genuinely care about their customers. And to top it off.. The food is AMAZING! I always order the California club pizza and it's NEVER a disappointment. Good is always the perfect temp and served so beautifully. Can't wait to go back!

LOVE this place. Especially for our waitress ALICE! She was very kind, very patient and always checked on us constantly either for more water or just if we needed anything else! She had great customer service and I'm glad we got to have her wait on our table. Besides our waitress, THE FOOD IS BOMB! I ordered the Chicken Alfredo and LOVED how they could fulfill my request by making the sauce THICK! I also ordered the FRESH STRAWBERRY MANGO COOLER and fell in love with that drink!  I would DEFINITELY go there again!

What can I say?? MUST TRY!!! MUST HAVE!! As soon as you enter you get greeted by the hostes.  They ask for your information and give you a time limit.  Like any other popular place arrive early.  We were fortunate to get in and get out.  The menu is all decisions!!!

First time ever being here, & I always heard a good amount of both negative & positive ends of people's experience with this place - BUT for my first time being here, I was absolutely blown away & loved everything I placed my lips on lol  My wife had lunch with one of her best friends the day before & wanted to take me there because I have always walked passed it when shopping at Pearl Ridge and wondered how the food were, I mean in my head I thought "whats so great about CPK?" well when my wife took me on a "date night" I was just about to find out why CPK has been at this location for awhile.  Went on a Wednesday night with thee wife, and there were a couple of crowds in front of us, when we got to check in, the hostess informed my wife that it would be a 30-45 min wait (and yes I could read her lips tell my wife this info, but knowing my wife if she wants to eat somewhere that I have not ate at yet and she absolutely loves it, she will not tell me about no wait time, due to the mere fact I am super impatient, especially when I am hungry lol) so as she came out of the door, she smiled and told me it would be 25-30min tops (HA YEAH RIGHT!) lucky I was still content with my lunch date I had with her at Buffalo Wild Wings, so I did not complain about her doing a little "white lie" on the estimated time given (lol) they give you a little "buzzer" to inform you when a seat is available so we ended up walking around inside of Pearl Ridge to kill time, we probably spent 20 min in there and decided to go check on the seating and we luckily got there on time! The hostess was friendly saying that we were the next people to be seated, and then within 2 min, our buzzer went off while she waved us down (so it was perfect timing!).  Seating area, was okay, a bit small for my taste, plus it was smudge right by the glass case by the door area, so it was not my favorite spot, but no complaints just was excited to see what was on the menu! So as I checked in on Yelp, I seen that if we download they're app, you receive a free "small plate" as well collect "dough points" when eating at CPK (which is awesome! anything free at any eatery place always makes me happy lol) so I checked in and you are suppose to give your waitress/waiter a code that is given so that can place your points and whatnot, I told her that this was my first time experiencing CPK and she said automatically informed me  that if it was my first time, I get a free "small plate" regardless, so might as well save the one on my app (YAY! I was more excited! knowing that I could come back and eat again haha) but besides all the great freebies, lets get to the main part the FOOD!  Drink: Strawberry Ice tea - not sweet at all, with a hint of strawberry, this tea is my absolute favorite! & its free refills! awesome awesome beverage!!! Appetizers:  Tuscan Hummus ($7.69)  -   have a Hummus obsession, so ofcourse I had to order it! Nothing really special about the hummus except they have a couple of tomatoes diced up in there, and I love love they're pita bread! soft, and fresh! definitely the best pita tasted on an appetizer!  Lettuce Wraps (Chicken $10.49) -  my wife swears by this appetizer! she absolutely loves this & recommends it to anyone! they have 3 options of either chicken, shrimp or both! its delicious with Fresh Shiitake mushrooms, water chestnuts and scallions tossed in they're spicy ginger soy sauce (yummy!)  Free Small Plate  - Shaved Mushroom and Spinach ($6.69)  was toasty and delicious! it had Cremini mushrooms, sautéed spinach, and California Olive Ranch extra virgin olive oil with Romano and Parmesan! a definite must try! ^-^ Main Dishes: Jambalaya Fettuccine ($18.19) worth the price to me!  - A CPK favorite as well as my new favorite Pasta! It has a little spice kick (to my taste) it was as if I jumped in a Jambalaya bowl of heaven!!!! DELICIOUS! Everyone who comes here should at least try this!!!! Its Blackened chicken and shrimp, crawfish, Andouille sausage and Tasso ham in spicy Cajun sauce! (had some leftovers for this morning and devoured it in happiness, and was sad that it was gone within 2 min! ): wahh!)  Garlic Cream Fettuccine ($12.19)  (with chicken $2.59) - my wife's plate  She absolutely loved it, she wanted to note that it was creamy and had great equal parts of sauce, chicken and pasta! its basically the ultimate roasted garlic Parmesan cream sauce, and you can add chicken, shrimp or both and sauteed mushrooms (all with additional costs) I tasted it and it was pretty good, Im not a fan of heavy creamy sauces and I have heavy "spaghetti marinara sauce" but my wife's plate was not so bad (in my words b/c she said it was BOMB DIGGADY lol)  Desert:  OKAY, so the whole reason for eating here, was due to the fact that my wife wont shut up about the awesome, delicious, MELT IN YOUR MOUTH, heavenly BUTTER CAKE! I cant explain just ORDER IT! you will thank me! I promise you!  HAPPY EATS YELPERS!

Reason for my 2 stars : tonight my plate was a little sloppy.  I got the chicken tequila fettuccine,  except I asked the waiter if I could sub out the chicken for mushrooms instead. He said it was no problem.  My plate comes back with shrimp,  because he didn't hear me quite well.  I didn't mind too much, I just didn't want him to charge me for it (which he did), and I came with someone who could eat the shrimp.   Then I found pieces of chicken, and different types of noodles all mixed in with my fettuccine..... :/

Came here last night with my girlfriend. She ordered the fettuccine Alfredo with shrimp & extra sauce, and she enjoyed it. I ordered the Jambalaya Fettuccine, nice little kick of spiciness and very delicious. Then ending our meal sharing the amazing butter cake with ice cream! Overall for the food we give it a 3.5/5. However, what really made our visit awesome was our waiter! I believe his name was Kirtus? He was very attentive and kind. He checked up on us constantly; Cleared our table quickly, refilled our drinks and overall was the best waiter I've ever had at CPK. Keep up the great service!

Good service, by bri with short blonde hair! Excellent pizza, my boyfriend always gets a new pizza we never eat the same things. Trying something new is our thing. We always sit at the bar because it's more peaceful and if you need refills they are faster. Nothing but good experiences everyone and there's no longer then ten minutes for your food depends when you go though.

Ate here a few weeks ago, Food a high 4 star (Quality, flavor and prep) which is to be expected from a CPK. Timing on the food was fast as well. Operationally, BOH, is still at a high level.  Front of the house is slightly different from what you would expect. First off, I am not a fan of the uniform change. Definitely a downgrade and leaves you with a different feel from the past. Also, servers have no sense of urgency, even the busser was more interested in checking out the females walking around. Our server was nice enough but took a long time to get drinks and we had to ask a few times. My coffee, which I ordered to begin my meal came right as I was finishing. No apologies.  The experience was just ok. Food very good..... Service way below CPK standards. The manager (Older female) was very friendly and sincere. Wouldn't go out of my way to go back but still a big fan of the franchise.

While the food was good, we had to wait 40+ minutes for our order. Our server had the manager check to see why it was taking so long. When the manager finally brought the food to our table, there was no apology for the unacceptable wait time, nor an explanation offered regarding why it took so long. We weren't charged for one of our soft drinks but you would think they would have at least discounted the meal. The server was nice and unlike the manager, apologized for the wait but it did not make up for having to deal with a tired, hungry and grouchy three year old.

Went to CPK with a friend on a Thursday around 4:30PM. The place wasn't very packed since it wasn't a hour or two until dinner time.  The hostess seated us where most of the customers were sitting. The other half of the restaurant wasn't as crowded. I'm guessing the side we were sitting on was for families, since I noticed families with children on one side and adults on the other.  Our server was very attentive. He checked on us many times and came by to refill our waters. That was a plus. The food here is big on flavor. I got to sample the Chinese Chicken Salad which was very flavorful and a pretty big portion for the "half price" of the salad. Definitely recommend the Butter Cake for dessert. It's a very delicious cake, I've been going to CPK once a week just because of it. You should do as the menu says and "just try it".

I hadn't been in a CPK for a long time so I decided to take my aunty out to launch here and we weren't disappointed!  Since this is a Hawaiian CPK we went for the hand-tossed Hawaiian BBQ Chicken and OMG it was delicious!  There pizza is soooo much better than any Pizza Hut or the like.  Tip:  they make yummy Mojitos that go really well with their pizzas!  Can't wait to come back here again!

I must have gone here on a good day because every time I am at Pearlridge and pass by there is always a line. No one must have been craving pasta or pizza that day. I have always been told that the wait for that location is ridiculous so one star for that. We were seated right away and I knew what I wanted, Asparagus Spaghettini with chicken breast and add on sun-dried tomatoes. I have had better. My asparagus and spinach weren't as fresh as I hoped and my noodles were dry. We also tried the White Corn Guacamole and Chips. Small plates and appetizers never really disappoint at CPK. Maybe I should come back and just have a salad and an appetizer. Other than that, service was alright until we had to wait another twenty minutes for our check.

When I want a good salad and flatbread I come here. The atmosphere is causal and the service is excellent. I come by myself or with a group no matter what occasion I love every experience. What I would recommend is the Waldolf Salad the combination of chicken, greens, grapes, candied walnuts celery are perfect. The homemade Dijon vinegarette compliments the salad well. The pizzas, flatbread and pasta all are awesome. Save room for dessert you will be pleasantly surprise on the selection.

Went for dinner on Wed 6/11/14.  There was no wait.  Server came over rather quickly. I had the chicken lettuce cups.  OMG  absolutely out of this world.  I had the Caesar salad with this but it was just your run of the mill salad.  The Waldorf salad that my daughter had was delicious.  The Dijon dressing is homemade and well worth the visit.

This CPK is usually always busy even on weekdays. I come here often with my friends to catch up on life and to hangout. Considering this is a chain restaurant, I gotta say this CPK provides an excellent service. The servers are all good. More importantly, I love their food. Tonight's menu was roasted veggie salad, white pizza with bacon and small corn guacamole and chips. And of course, some happy drinks. This isn't a place to hangout too long because people are waiting to be seated. So me and my friend moved on to Starbucks.

CPK is too expensive for what you get.  The food is average. I don't know, but to me the pizzas are weird.  lol.
Cpk here was pretty good. I enjoyed sitting on the patio outside. The service was great and our waitress gave us some good ideas of where we should go on the island. Overall a good experience.

This CPK got super busy right after we were seated, so we got lucky with our timing.  The service was attentive.  The food was average for a CPK.  The pizza itself was slightly burned... which seems to be typical of the last few times I've ordered the Tostada pizza.  It was better on the thinker crust.  We like there bread, and our group got several rounds of the stuff.  The only real issue with this CPK is noise.  It is very load and hard to hear one another talk.  Maybe it's the walls or the flooring, whatever, it has no ability to absorb sound.  So, don't count on having great conversation here.

Great eatery.  My wife and I were seated right away and had a wonderful evening out for once.  I'm not sure it can seat large crowds but they seem to be able to seat up to six without issue.

Pretty new to this place, but oh how delicious it is! Always get top notch service and won a 50% off coupon today!! So yea I will deff come back for the food. Get the avocado egg rolls for an appetizer.

I came here for girl time with my friend since we had that contest card to use for CPK and it was going to expire the next day. I haven't eaten here in ages either, but not because the food sucks...more so that it is always crowded and they don't take reservations. We miraculously got seated right away during lunch hour on a Saturday even though there was a line.  I always order the same thing - Kung Pao Spaghetti with shrimp. As usual it was yummy. Love the seasonings, peppers and pasta. Drinks came out fast, and was often refilled without asking. My friend got the Thai Chicken Pizza and she said it was good as usual too. Service was great, and we didn't feel rushed out even though it was crowded as heck. Parking isn't bad at all if you park in the parking garage adjacent to it. There were lots of spots on the second floor. Best part was our contest card thingy gave us 20% off our bill.

This location is over 20 years old and you can tell the menu has changed over the centuries... If you're a frequent customer - best time to go is during their CPK Yellow card giveaways! You can score % off your bill, free desserts or money! Only for a brief time in June and July.  I remember my first pizza, it was like eating Beef Broccoli on a pizza.  Although the complementary bread has changed through the years, it's always been fresh and warm when brought to the table.  I like that they have new salads, pizzas, and desserts that work with the season.   The food is always great, but what sets this location from the other locations is the service. If you have a great waiter or waitress, then you'll have a great experience and want to return again.  Things to try at your next visit-  Thai Crunch Salad - this has a nice oriental dressing (not to runny), crunchy rice chips and wonton chips, soybeans, peanuts, bok choi, and lettuce. A lot of ingredients that blend well together and won't make you full.  Bianco Flatbread - this is a must if you want to skip on the complementary bread. Add the White Truffle oil ($1.50 more) and you'll thank me later! If you love eating good melted cheese and bread...this ones for you! I'm even thinking about taking this to go next time and drizzle honey butter.  Jamaican Jerk Chicken - at first I thought this was gonna be a lame chicken pizza... Well, it was sort of... All you have to do if you're a 'Hot Mouth' like me and love spicy food -  ask for the Habanero Salsa. Yes, you may be thinking, you're crazy! Haha, well, the salsa at the first bite gives a cool fruity taste you wouldn't expect that hits your tongue with pineapple and mango with a light tomato... Then with your second bite, that's when the salsa reveals itself as a villain and scorches your tongue...and when the slice is all over, you want to do it again, because you miss that sizzling sensation on your tongue!  Butter Cake and Salted Caramel Pudding - these two desserts will always find extra space and cracks in my stomach! I can only describe these two desserts as if you want to share - you'll only get 4 nice spoonfuls of each goodness. If you want to indulge - have your own! Not to sweet on the taste buds and totally worth saving some room for!  Enjoy your next visit!

CPK was always considered a safe destination when it came to larger family dinners. During high school, I remember going to CPK for my cousins' birthdays or to celebrate special occasions, so I've discovered a few tried-and-true favorites throughout the years.   Recently, though, it seems like CPK has taken a turn to become more gourmet. It's still family friendly, but I feel like the ambiance isn't the same as it was when I was in high school. Some of the casual comfort may be gone in subtle ways--the eatery now also features a small bites/tapas menu, and the slices of complimentary bread remind me of the type served at Romano's Macaroni Grill (rustic, artisanal bread served with olive oil for dipping)--but delicious cuisine still remains.   Here are some of my must-haves when it comes to dining at CPK. I'm glad that, regardless of the various menu changes over the years, you can still find some of my favorite dishes:   "Spinach and Artichoke Dip": I've tried the "Spinach and Artichoke Dip" at many different places, but I still think that CPK's version of this shareable appetizer is one of the best. The dish is served with a generous amount of colorful chips and the mix is extremely cheesy (just the way I like it). There's always a mad dash to scoop as many chips-and-dip as possible whenever this appetizer comes to our table. "Crispy Mac 'N' Cheese": This shareable "small plates" dish consists of four, bite-sized mac 'n cheese balls that's lightly fried with panko and served on creamy cheese sauce. This is one of the newer additions to the CPK menu, and though it's not as cheesy as my favorite "Deep Fried Mac 'n Cheese Balls" from The Cheesecake Factory, it's still an enjoyable bite-sized snack you can nibble on while waiting for your entrée. It's worth trying if you haven't ordered it before.    "Dakota Smashed Pea + Barley Soup": While I don't like peas, I am a diehard fan of CPK's "Dakota Smashed Pea + Barley Soup." This soup is a winner in my eyes because of the barley it includes. This hearty split pea soup--filled with barley, carrots, onions and savory herbs; topped with scallions--is great for an appetizer. "Two in a Bowl": Though I don't like my foods to mix, this "Two in a Bowl" soup dish surprisingly keeps the two featured soups--"Sedona Tortilla Soup" and "Dakota Smashed Pea + Barley Soup"--pretty well separated, as if an invisible line were drawn down the middle of the bowl! I enjoy both soups and it's nice to get the contrast in the same bowl--the mellower "healthier" split pea soup and the mild kick of the "Sedona Tortilla," which features vine-ripened tomatoes, tomatillos, corn, mild green chilies, Southwestern spices and tortilla strip garnishes. This is a good pick for lunch or if you're wanting a lighter dinner.    "White Pizza": Throughout the years, I've tried several different types of pizzas from CPK, and the "White Pizza" still remains as my favorite one. I always opt for this choice with applewood smoked bacon. Because I'm not particularly fond of tomato sauce, this pizza is perfect. It includes spinach, cheese and garlic (bacon is a slight additional fee). I love the mix of cheese flavors on this pizza, and I usually finish about half the pizza (3-4 slices) and try to take the leftovers home.   "Grilled Chicken Caesar": This sandwich features shaved Parmesan, lettuce and tomatoes (I order mine without tomatoes) on your choice of bread (I go with grilled focaccia). But the best part about these sandwich choices is that they come with your choice of a cup of soup or Caesar salad -- and of course, I opt for the "Dakota Smashed Pea + Barley Soup."   "Red Velvet Cake": I feel that "Red Velvet Cake" can be a hit or miss dessert at some restaurants, but at CPK, it's a hit. This dessert--though I believe the size has shrunk over the years--features several layers of moist red velvet cake and vanilla bean frosting, topped with elegant white chocolate curls. This dessert is delicious because of the moist cake, and though I still prefer cream cheese frosting on my red velvet, this combo is worth trying if you've never had CPK's version of "Red Velvet" before.

OMGosh all I did was mention my food tasted of meat ! I am not a happy bunny right now ...... I have contacted head office - and waiting to see their response - its not about the food - everyone makes mistakes - but the GENERAL MANAGER is an embarrassment to the company !

Recently had lunch here with a few friends, one of them who was on a restricted diet due to her daughter's allergies (breast feeding related).  She found the CPK allergy restriction menu online and also asked the hostess for their own allergy list.  They were so helpful!  The manager even came to our table and made sure everything she ordered was "diet friendly". Everything was on point as usual, and service has improved!  Got my usual BBQ chicken chopped salad, presentation is a bit different, but tastes the same.  Will definitely be back again!

Within these past few months I've found myself coming to this location more frequently than normal. On the several visits, I was never disappointed.  If you're a newbie to CPK, here's some recommendations.  Appetizer wise, I've only tried the lettuce wraps. In all honesty, it's a bit pricey for the amount given (~$11-12).  Try it with both the chicken & shrimp! It's really tasty and flavorful.  It's also a mix that goes well together. (Kudos to my friend for introducing it to me) ;)  If you're legal & looking for drinks, I've tried both of their sangria's. The mango one is my favorite of the two, although the red sangria is good if you're more of a wine type of gal. If you opt for something fruity, definitely try the mango!  I really love the California Cobb pizza. Another friend of mine ordered it one day and since I've ordered it twice on different occasions. Portion wise it's big.. I recommend you sharing it with someone else.  It's a pizza with an underlying layer of bacon, chicken, meats & topped on the top is lettuce and avocados.  I love it because it's such a good balance of meats/veggies.  A couple of friends I introduced it to didn't like it much because they're not into veggies. Another favorite dish of mine is Jambalaya Fettuccine which is a savory (to me it's not that spicy) pasta with cajun sauce, chicken, sausage, shrimp, crawfish & ham bits which altogether is a must try!  If you still have room for dessert (yes, please save your appetite! you should take home leftovers and try dessert) a really good one is the butter cake with vanilla ice cream! It's heavenly. It's a very thick, not too sweet butter cake with ice cream and whipped cream. When you eat it, the warmth of the cake and the ice cream compliment each other so well you, you definitely won't be disappointed.

The service was really good. Our waiter was kind and genuine. The food was good as always. The only concern I have is the bathroom space. The first stall I went into was extremely small. I felt very clamped inside. But other than that it's all good.

Used to love this place back when the bread was good but have noticed its steady decline in quality and service. After my most reent visit I will not be returning.  Which I really hate because it is one of the only places in Aiea that you can order online!  I really don"t know why more places don"t get with it and make this an option at their storefronts? No more ringing phones bothering production, no more botched order from the noisy clatter that makes it impossible to hear or order...geez any cell phone with text messaging would do! Anyways back to the review. So I placed our order online and cringed at the $70+ price for dinner for the three of us; 3 pasta dishes, a half salad ad the cheese and mushroom bread - cuz that sourdough boloney they serve now just sucks *ss! No drinks & no desserts. Another thing I'll miss is the speediness in which the order is ready -30min! So we arrive there a few minutes after the designated time. I run in while my son parks in the loading area and I head straight for the pick up phone order part of the bar, smiling awaiting my order. So as I stand there, I try to make eye contact with one of the two "chefs"(?)that are standing there laughing, chit chatting and scraping crud fro the corners of their workstation, to no avail. Then I try to make eye contact with a third employee, the bartender I presume, who is also chatting away with fellow employees, all which pay me no mind. So after about 4 minutes of being professionally ignored, I give a big, "HELLLOOOOO?!?!?" which actually almost stuns them momentarily- like I was so rudely disturbing their shenanogans and they go back to their chatting. WTF? I think to myself and blurt out, "Cu*ts!" Luckily that goes unheard as well.Astonished, I just stand there a few more minutes tapping my cards on the counter. Finally, I throw my hands up and yell "excuse me??" then point at myself with both hands aand they all almost snap out of it long enough to point to some guy frantically scurrying in from the back whom, of course just scurries past me without any regaur whatsoever. He tidies up his awaiting outgoing orders, friffss their crappy bags of bread up and the "chef" closes to us gives him a little elbow and nudges him towards me. "Oh" he says, and I say "yeah order for ..... and he kindly obliges and bags my order and throws in 5-6 sets of cuttlery and two bags of their gross bread. He has me sign my bf's name on the charge receipt nextto the big fat zero I add as the tip. The food sucked, I don't know if I will waste my time bothering the management unless they are going to refund my money since I will never eat there again and most times they just comp you a drink or something that you have no real way of getting anyways. It is a big rip off and I could not recommend it to anyone anymore.

I love CPK food.  The problem is the portions are going down whole the prices are going up.  I love the BBQ chicken chopped salad they have but it's a $15 salad.  They offer a half size for around $11 but it's very small and is more like an appetizer.   I also love their kum pao spaghetti with shrimp added.  The little chilis make it spicy and I eat it with the complimentary bread you get with your meal.  They also have a mini wedge salad for around $5 but I will warn you that it's only about 4 pieces of tiny cut  lettuce.   My kids usually order pizza and they say it's okay.  But they love pizza from any restaurant.   Desserts:  Tiramisu is okay and you get a good size portion.   The butter cake with ice cream is very yummy!  The salted caramel dessert was too sweet, the first few bites were good but then my tummy started to hurt.  Service is ok.  Sometime you get a real attentive waiter/waitress and sometimes you get one who only takes your order and then drops off a check later. I love cpk but the prices here make me and my wallet shed tears.   This is not an uber fancy restaurant that can command high prices but they do it anyway.
PRICE:  $$ AMBIANCE:  casual, noisy LOCATION:  Pearlridge Center - Downtown MEALS:  good  (Artichoke & Spinach Dip, Chinese Chicken Salad, Fish Tacos) SERVICE:  friendly, fast
Love CPK always excellent service and great food.   Even if it's crowded they still get the job done.
Servers are always genuinely polite and the food of course never seems to disappoint me. The chicken piccata is my favorite.

Pretty decent food. Excellent service. The small plate crispy Mac and cheese was bad for you, but delicious. The lettuce wraps had good flavour. The California pizza is basically a cold salad on top of pizza dough. I liked it, but the BF did not.

We came here on Veteran's Day because my husband is a Vet. Every year, they give Vet's free meals. I made sure that we came early because I knew the line would be long. I checked Yelp and it said that they opened at 11am. We got there at 10:40am and the restaurant was almost full with 2 open tables left. They opened at 10:30am. We get seated and put in our order. For the appetizer, we ordered the guacamole with corn dip that came with a side of chips. It was actually better than I thought but I still prefer the traditional way better. My husband ordered from the Vet's menu and I ordered from the regular menu. He got the thai crunch salad with extra dressing and the thing is huge. The salad comes with dressing on the side and you mix it in yourself. It was so good, one of the best salads ever. I ordered the hawaiian bbq chicken pizza so that my husband and I could share since he doesn't eat red meat. When the pizza came out, it was the hawaiian pizza with the ham. I called the server over and explained the situation to him. He apologized and put in a new order for the correct pizza which took another 20 minutes. He said that he could pack up the wrong pizza for me and that I could take it home for no charge, which was nice of him. The pizzas to me were just ok. It wasn't good and it wasn't bad. It's preference. I like my pizza crispy but they don't make their pizzas crispy. The crust is just a little hard and chewy. Service gets 5 stars. They were running around like chicken without heads but the water cups were never empty. At least 3 servers came by and asked me how everything was.
Always a great time, the food is always on point. Service is pretty good and friendly. A good fav time and time again.
They serve very good food. Definitely try their spinach artichoke dip and veggie sandwich.  There are usually long wait times, but that is a testament to their good food and location.
Take out is so busy here but they manage to get orders out in such a timely manner. This is the only place I feel obliged to tip the people working a takeout counter.

Total disappointment.... Called at 3:00 to make a reservation.  Of course no reservation. But you can call ahead ... Like an hour or something.. Ok now to the real deal the food! CPK's chopped salad....ok so all my lettuce was white, no bbq sauce mixed in the salad. Maybe 4 small pieces of chicken. epic fail.....  Pizza- mushroom, sausage and pepperoni. Good pizza cooked well. Tasted ok.  Service was really good, they were busy as hell and the waitress did well. We tipped her accordingly. Good job!   The manager did credit my bill. Didn't have to but they did.  Overall 3. Because I know they can do better.

I absolutely adore California Pizza Kitchen. Their staff is always delightful and pleasant and the food is amazing. I have never before craved a salad the way I do their Waldorf chicken. Everything on their menu is delicious. Always a favorite for me!

I really like CPK. They're always busy, and don't allow reservations. However, you can call ahead as long as you're "on your way." I've never had to wait more than a few minutes.  Their mix of different types of pizza (that you wouldn't normally expect) are what makes this place different. The only bad part about eating at CPK is deciding which pizza to order. Their salads are good too. Finally, the wait staff is attentive and friendly. If you're looking for some good 'za and you're in the Aiea area, check out CPK. Just make sure you call ahead and let them know you're coming.

Haven't been to CPK for over 5 year's and tonight made me realize why.  Food is mediocre, overly priced and lacks taste. I did order their Asian Plum Martini and that was the only thing that was amazing !! Lol

01.19.15 - Be prepared for a wait anytime you patron any California Pizza Kitchen (unless of course you are there exactly when they open).  You can call ahead to put your name on the list if you are on your way there.  When you "check in" they give you a pager, which you need to sit around and wait to buzz before you can be seated.  The range of the pager is not very far either, so you are really subjected to just sitting around the area and waiting.  I believe the hostess said that the range can only go as far as MAYBE Hallmark (which is only around the corner).   Seriously...was anyone else as sad as I was when they took off the Sundried Tomato Fusili dish from their pasta menu?!?!?!  However, they have totally redeemed themselves by allowing me to be able to order this yummy dish by finding a loophole.  I just order the Asparagus and Spinach pasta dish that is already on the menu and ask them to substitute the vegetables with broccoli and sundried tomatoes...as well as substitute the pasta for fusili.  The dish already has the garlic, sundried oil, and cheese.  Voila!  We are back in business!   Are you a Pizza Dough Rewards member?  I hope you are!  They give awesome rewards every once in a while to get FREE food!  Totally worth it on your birthday because they give you a free dessert to be redeemed anytime in the month of your birthday!  I am extremely picky when it comes to desserts...well, I take that back....I am extremely picky when it comes to anything in general...lol!  So when I tell you that their red velvet is simply to die for...I mean it!  They have the BEST red velvet cake!  It also has white chocolate shavings on the outside....MMMMM!  Plus, it's HUGE!  So even though you won't want to, you'll need to share it with someone.  Don't forget the side of vanilla ice cream...doesn't come free with your "reward," but totally worth adding on.   Bring back the Sundried Tomato Fusili dish and you'll get your fifth star CPK!  Why do you need to make it so difficult for me to order such a delicious meal?  Haha...thank you for making my birthday the yummiest ever, though.  I really appreciate you appreciating your customers!

I haven't been to California Pizza Kitchen in a long while, but tonight decided I would eat here with my crew.  Service: Our waitress was Very nice, although she did seem a bit flustered and always rushing, she was on point with the refills of our drinks until we were about finished, she even said she would bring us another round but never did. We were just about over it already. When we were eating we asked for extra Caesar dressing and had to remind her 2 times for her to bring it. I also didn't like where we were seated, we were seated right next to the register thing towards the back near the kitchen where they log everything into the computer. To me it just seemed like we didn't have privacy, with people standing above our table the whole time.  Food: We ordered the original bbq chicken pizza, it was good the bacon was better and made the pizza 10x better. Our Caesar salad was dry that's why we asked for the extra dressing. The other pizza my friends seemed to like it. And the Thai rolls were also pretty good. Wish they refilled us on the bread though! Lol  Would i come back? Maybe all depends if I feel like eating the pizza, next time around if I do I'll get the hawaiian pizza it was always my favorite. I'll probably try another location.
Yuuup, they still have flies and other bugs crawling around. I also got two really hard things in my food while eating, really not impressed.
Love their pizza! My favorite is the Sicilian. Always have a fast and attentive server. Lemonade is very good!

I went here last night with the beau- we returned after just a week! They have these flatbreads that are delicious- our favorite 'bianco' that has truffle cream, mozzarella, gorgonzola and Sage. Their mojito was Soooo good! I also ordered. A 9oz serving of clos du Bois, the mushroom pizza, thai chicken pizza and the salted caramel pudding!! That pudding was the best! Crumbled chocolate cookies at the bottom, salted caramel pudding in the middle, topped with housemade whipped cream and caramel!! Yummy!! Definitely gonna try that again! the only bummer about this place is that it's loud, tight spaced and there's always a wait!!

First yelp review yay!! Hello friends... We came here last Saturday 2/7/15 for date movie night with the boyfriend. I got a $20 gift card from our Christmas company party for CPK (California Pizza Kitchen) - my boyfriend was raving about their Caesar salad which I haven't tried, I usally get the regs - the chicken shrimp alfredo! But we went ahead and order the full size salad which was around $15-17, totally worth it! Omg so goooood... then we shared a Kung pao spaghetti, it was one of there popular items - but wasn't that excited over it. Ended dinner with there oh so yummy Butter Cake with ice cream , still one of my faves. So overall, was a good dinner, without the gift card total dinner cost about $48-50 for both of us...  TRY THEIR SALAD, if you're a salad person - you'll love it!! Good luck! -myriel

ALOHA2GO Friendly!! If you are new to Hawaii, may I suggest the coolest thing ever!  We did two things tonight, tried California Pizza Kitchen, and Aloha2go to deliver it. Both are outstanding. The time was supposed to be 1 hour and 20 minutes and it was 55 minutes delivered.  The food was very good and fresh.  Portions are a bit small for me, but when it's good you can get away with that.  Won't stop me from ordering it in the future.  We had the shrimp fettucine, mac and cheese baked and pepperoni pizza, everyone in the family said it was great. Thanks to both Aloha2go and California Pizza Kitchen!

Went there with my sister and her family.. My brother in laws Italian sandwich was dry and tasteless.. The children's macroni is gross. My sister got a pizza and it tasted like cardboard the redeeming factor wasmy quinoa arugula salad.. It was bomb!!! Wine selection poor ... It's not a place I would crave...

Dave is our server. He is new but super friendly and funny...the food is good.  Services at this location is awesome. Server kept on checking on you. One serve brought extra plate without being asked.  Manager came and asked if we are good.  Such a good morning  We order the spring roll Baja and Thai, salmon, salad and yummylicious mango banana smoothie.

This place is always packed so me and my husband decided to find out why.. I really don't get it. Overpriced pizza? My pizza was super bland and a little cold I had to put so much cheese and pepper to give it taste lol it just really wasn't good. Also we noticed everyone around us had bread and we were never given bread so we asked our waitress and she was like oh... You want bread..? And later we noticed the people next to us got bread almost immediately. Wonder if they were out of bread or if the waitress just didn't care to give it to us.
This place sucks. The wait for a table is ridiculous. Only thing that saves it are they do only a small few item on their menu perfectly. Just order for pick up. Save yourself the headache and tip.

Love CPK! Their waitstaff here are super friendly! Love love their pizza and pasta and salads! Everything here is delish! My faves are kung pao pasta, artichoke dip and Margherita pizza! This location can get quite busy on weekends but seems like the turnaround isn't so bad. Also counter seats are first find first served and if available can just go and seat yourself. Great place for group dinners or if you're in mood for some pizza, pasta and salads!

Normally, I don't have any issues with CPK.  I love their jambalaya fetuccini dish.  We ordered a Jamaican jerk chicken pizza and I swear to you, there was only 6 (I counted) small pieces of chicken on the pizza.  Soo few that two slices did not even have a piece of chicken on it.  I brought this to the attention of the waitress to see for herself.  She tried to explain that there is a ration of chicken for each pizza in which I replied "this is not my first time here nor the first time I ordered this pizza."   I told her if the rations had decreased, then i am willing to pay more for more chicken.  Afterall, its not her fault if the rations decreased.  She went and got the manager and he told them to just make another one with more chicken and tried to explain to us that they were running low on chicken. ???   He told us that we can take the 1st pizza home for free and they will make another one. Since we were sitting at the bar, we had a  front row seat of the chef at work. I guess since we asked for more chicken that didn't go over well with the pizza maker because he drenched the chicken in cayenne pepper so much it was dark brown. We watched his female co-worker come from the side soaking the chicken and throw the chicken on the pizza he was preparing.  When it was served to us, my girlfriend took one bite and was almost in tears.  My first instinct was to throw the pizza  across the bar at him but I let her do the talking to the manager again.  His excuse, she was new and went overboard with the pepper.  I wanted to make him eat a slice so he can feel what his subordinates just put my girlfriend through.   I was very angry and disappointed.  When i reach that state of mind, I learned to leave to avoid incident. I gathered our belongings and paid the check with tip for the waitress (it was not her fault) and took our 6 piece chicken pizza home.   This happened Tuesday night, 3 Mar 15 around 8pm.  The general mgr can do the math and pinpoint exactly who the culprits are.  Nicole was our server at table 8/1 receipt number 110043.   Hopefully this will be a single incident.

I am from the east coast and moved to Aiea, Hawaii a few months ago. I live right by this CPK and I love it. Whether dining in or carrying out, the service is always exceptional and the food is amazing. Love this place!!! The classic bbq chicken pizza can't be beat! Try the hummus too, my other fav!
Food was great but our waiter (Shawn) was not!! Brought us water, took our order and didnt come back once until we needed our check.
The wait can often be long, my suggestion is to come on off peak times. Perfect late lunch or early dinner. Their thin crust pizza supports my low carb desire.

I have been here several times. I love how the wait usually goes fast! Being a mom, I appreciate how fast the food comes out! I've never had a bad server yet! My kids like being able to watch the "train" at the mall while eating. The only thing I haven't enjoyed is the desserts. The chocolate cake is too rich and the tiramisu isn't the best. But I love that they don't have French fries. My kids hate it but I love it!;)

Since the CPK is near our house we go often.  The food is fresh and healthy and delicious.  Since I am a vegan I have to "change up" some of the food to suit me and straight up avoid most.   They do not have any actual vegan dish on the menu but I can eat the Thai Chicken Crunch (my hub eats the chicken) The large dish is plenty to share.  Which is good because their prices are on the higher side.  Which brings me to one of my complaints.  The drinks are sky high! Like they are on the beach at Waikiki! $9.55 for a very small, ice loaded mojito. Ridiculous!  It had about 3 good swallows in it.  Never again!  The other complaint I have is the music.  It is so loud you cannot hear what your dinner companions are even saying.  If the food was not over the top delish, we would never go there.  They offer something called Pizza dough which is an app and we use it.  When you get there and order you give the waitress your Pizza dough number and she puts it into their system and after so many pizza dough points you get a reward.  Good luck getting them to actually do it!

California Pizza kitchen has four locations on the island of Oahu, pearl ridge, Kahala Mall, Ala Moana, and Waikiki. The last time I heard the Waikiki one is the only one that takes reservations. So be there early because it does get crowded and the wait can be very long. I went to the Pearl ridge CPK with a few friends. They are very accommodating when not everyone is there yet, they seat you and come back to check if you want to start or not.  I always go to CPK and get the Thai crunch salad! It has lots of different 'Thai' ingredients in it and heavy on the dressing (if your not into dressing ask for it on the side). If you want bread you need to ask and if you want it with balsamic then you can ask, if not it will just come with the oil.  Our food came out quick and our server was amazing! We went for a friends birthday and they brought out a ice cream dish! We sat down for about three hours and they didn't try to kick us out which was awesome! But we did go on a Sunday and it wasn't too crowded. Definitely recommend CPK and you can park in the mall and even shop before or after!

CPK has been a family favorite of ours for years.   The food is consistently good and I've never had something here that I didn't like. This location as ALWAYS crowded so we normally just get ours to go to avoid the wait.

CPK is pretty much a go-to place for those days I don't know what to eat. This location gets four stars because of their service! I've never had a bad waiter or waitress here as opposed to when I visit the other locations.
Ate here last night and our server was awesome! Her name was steffany. She kept our ways filed and our food came out quickly :) The food was awesome like always.

First, the service is very good. However, the food quality is inconsistent. My wife ordered the fettuccine with shrimp and mushrooms, and she loved it. My daughter and I ordered the Mac and cheese. I ordered the Mac and cheese with chicken. I know it's usually a children's menu item, but in the past I would taste my daughter's food, and loved it. So it's become my favorite item because it was so cheesy. However, on this visit, it was dry and mainly tasteless. I asked my daughter how was hers, and she said the same. The butter cake with ice cream was good,

4/28/2015 - we are regulars at CPK in Pearlridge.  Normally, the service and quality of food is superb.  Last night was a very bad visit.  I had ordered a half order of Caesar salad.  After taking out 4-5 brown lettuce pieces, I decided to ask the waitress to exchange it, and bring me another one, hoping that the lettuce batch would be better.  The second serving of salad was just as bad as the first.  I notified the manager, who offered to 'take care of us.'  I would not have served the salad to my daughter; it was terrible.  After the salad incident, my daughter had ordered a kids' 99 cent sundae.  After taking a couple of bites, she found a piece of glass in her ice cream (!!!).  She would have taken it out and continued to eat the sundae, but I stopped her.  I had asked the server to bring us another one.  The second sundae was okay.  The Manager again came by to apologize.  With this incident, what ran through my mind was that we were so lucky that my daughter had not swallowed the piece of glass; if it had been a younger child, he or she would have swallowed it.  We were happy with the Managers' apologies, and she credited us with the salad and sundae,...but wouldn't a decent establishment have credited us for the whole tab?  For that reason, I a writing this review....hopefully it was all due to the 'full moon', as the Manager had expressed, but I really would have credited the party with the whole tab (less then $30).  Hopefully, this is a 'one-time' visit, and the lettuce and glass will improve in the future.  We love CPK :-(

For being a mainland chain restaurant, I rather like their food. The only think I hate is that it's always crowded and the waits are really long. I don't like waiting in line for anything, especially food when I'm hungry because then I became HANGRY real quick. So as much as I like CPK, if I see a really long line, then I'll just leave and go someplace else.  I almost always have the bbq chicken salad and one of the the pizzas. Yes it's a little bit on the pricey side for the amount of food you get, but the taste outweighs that for me.  The service has always been good for me when dining there and I think it has something to do with the quality of management. The wait staff can be compared to some of the upscale restaurants around town. Very professional and friendly.

First time to the Pearl Ridge CPK  in quite a while. And yes, I dined here sometime in February..And now it's MAY.  Now granted, CPK is great at any location and one of my favorite places to go.  I am giving this location 4 stars due to the service that I received on this visit.  And now I'm mad at myself for forgetting my server's name. I always eat the same thing at CPK: margherita pizza, mac & cheese bites, and bbq chicken salad (cheese on the side cause my best CPK partner is dairy free).  On this particular occasion, with said CPK partner, I told her I was going to  get something totally different. I did mention to our server what my "go-to" items are so I told him, "do not let me order those items, I want to try something new".  He supported my adventurous nature and said he will make sure I don't order my norm.  So I bravely ordered the Jamacain Jerk Chicken pizza.  I am not sure why I wanted cajun spices...I will attribute it to the fact that I had ordered wine while waiting for my cousin so I must not have been thinking clearly. hee hee. The pizza was actually quite good, a nice change from my norm.  Our server stopped by to make sure that everything tasted good and even offered to change my order if I hated the pizza. which I didn't. I mean, I hardly meet a pizza that I don't like!  After finishing, I ended up forcig myself to save a few pieces of pizza to take home but the fat kid in me really wanted to eat it all. Will power.  I think my thought for saving a few pieces was the fact that I was off the next day and guess what?  DUH, had the extra pieces for lunch! I really enjoyed the ambiance on this visit; not too noisy or feeling rushed (like sometimes happens in other locations). Like I mentioned, our server was great. He had wonderful conversation skills and had a way of making the evening feeling complete.  Hopefully I can come back soon!

CPK food is delicious. The practices at the Pearlridge location, however, are DISGUSTING, UNSANITARY, and a COMPLETE HEALTH HAZARD. This review is strictly for the Pearlridge location. My company catered food for a big meeting, and I had one of the salads, and a bit of pasta. I found a strand of hair in the pasta, and stopped eating it. I didn't say anything, because I thought it was hair from another person next to me (my hair was up in a bun, so it couldn't have been mine). The salad I had was COVERED the entire time it was at the meeting, because it came in one of their little takeout boxes. I ate my salad, thinking it tasted a little too sour/salty, but didn't think much about it. Then I stumbled upon a DEAD FLY in the salad.  Nope. Sorry. Only come here if you're ok with ingesting potential parasites.

This location is ok.  I come here from time to time but I find that the everything overall is just ok.  It is conveniently located at the Pearlridge Shopping Center downtown side.  I came here several times in the past during all three times during the day.  Night time is usually busy especially during the weekends.  The wait time could go from 20-40 minutes depending on how busy it is and stuff.  It could get even busier if it is a holiday/semi-holiday or something like Mother's Day.  I would say that there is a decent amount of table and seating areas around the area.  The staff and customer service is ok.  Sometimes if there is a wait, you have to wait alongside the walkway area which could be disturbing because of ongoing traffic of people traveling through the mall.  The prices are decent too.  Some of my favorites are definitely most of the pastas like the kung pao spaghetti and spinach/artichoke pasta.  For pupus, the spinach and artichoke dip and avocado rolls are the beast.  The vibe and atmosphere is ok.  Sometimes in the daytime, there are flies and bugs flying by which is kinda distracting and not really comfortable.  One time, my mother found a dried piece of spinach on a new set of utensils.  Super gross.  In regards to taking out, sometimes even the wait could take a while.  Other than that, I am not really hating on CPK, I am just merely giving out some experiences and stuff.

Came back again tonight to see if This location got any better. Had an ok experience the last time I was here.  This time was WORSE. Our server Ryan seemed very uninterested in helping us with our orders and needs. We got seated in the back by the restrooms in a corner table. A few minutes after we were seated, the lights were turned off or as they put it "dimmed". Let's just say that I could barely read my menu in the shadows of the "dimmed lights". I asked Ryan to help us out and adjust the lights to what they originally were when we were seated. He walked away and nothing was done. I stopped the manager and asked her to adjust the lights above our table. She came back and said "there you go. I turned them up a little. Is that ok?" Nothing had changed. She must've turned / adjusted the wrong light switch panel cause the dimmed lights above seemed the same.  I will not be returning to this location. The first experience, service was ok and needed improvement. This visit, it seemed like the managers and service could care less about our experience.

Food was good! Ordered to much food. The white pizza with bacon was killer. Spinach dip with chips nothing to special about it. Something I can get at Costco. Server was Abby, she was very good, took good care of us,

Great customer service. I usually dine in and I've gotten excellent service each time I did. The food is always good and fast. The wait isn't too long for such a popular spot to eat. Today I ordered take out and when I arrived to pick my order up the server was helping another customer and was very genuine on helping her out. When it was my turn he helped me and made sure I had everything I needed. Upon leaving each worker there thanked me and told me to enjoy my take out. Really great customer service.

Great service.  On the other hand, silverware and table area wet with lots of food on the floor under the table.  Also, the noise was very high during this visit...making it difficult to have a conversation with my friends.

Ordered online and when I got there they never received the order. Had to ask the take out person for water while waiting for the order, when received they forgot the utensils and bread we added to order and also forgot part of the order that was already done. They did rush the order that they missed but overall will not go back again and would not recommend.

Our server was Marcia and she was extremely nice and attentive. She gave us the choice of having bread or not which was awesome and rare at most restaurants. The chef made his rounds around the dining room and asked us of we're enjoying our food. All in all one of the best dining experiences I've had at a chain restaurant. I appreciate kind and attentive service and high volume restaurants like this should be applauded when they offer great service.

Our favorite stop for my daughter and I! Food is always good. For the most part service has been great! There have been just a couple visits where the bartender I think forgot we were there cuz only paid attention to one side of the bar - but she realized it and apologized. Another time it was a waiter who kept forgetting our refills - but he was still awesome.

These guys are huge supporters of the local community. My friend mentors a little brother through the Big Brothers Big Sisters program. We heard there was a discount if we went to California Pizza Kitchen at Pearlridge, so we went to check it out. We assumed it would be a very modest discount, maybe a personal pizza or something. After sitting down, we received some of the most amazing service I've ever experienced in a restaurant. Bright, friendly faces, sparkling personalities, and an absolute can do attitude. We ordered a ton of food, expecting to cover most of the expenses, however we were shocked when we saw how large the discount was. We almost felt criminal and tried to offset the savings with a large tip. By being such a local community supporter, CPK Pearlridge has won my support, and we will gladly visit again (and pay full price ;-). Thank you guys. Little brother had a great time too.
Good food and good place to hang with the fam bam.  My boys like it and I like the lettuce wrap.  Brandon our waiter was a good guys very friendly and very on it especially for father's day.

Today's service was terrible. The host didn't even greet us, we sat on the chairs waiting to be acknowledged for 5 minutes. The server didn't even get us forks or napkins. My mom had to walk up to the bar to get some. Its the middle week, and lunch. I would hate to know what it's like on a Friday night.

We love CPK as there is something for everyone in the family and the food is always consistent. Wine and Beer are also reasonably priced (more so than the cocktails) for those that want a nice tasty beverage with their meal. Food:  Salads always fresh, pasta done right, and innovative pizzas. I normally order the thin crust of whatever pizza we're ordering as I'm a fan of a crispy crust. The sandwiches are also tasty and the fish tacos are pretty good. The big plus for us is all CPK establishments maintain a consistent quality and you can trust your meal will meet your expectations if you've ordered it before. Service: Servers are normally great. Friendly, knowledgeable, and efficient. I've had only at very few isolated issues with service over the past few years but that would definitely be the exception and management is quick to remedy any situation. They always accommodate special requests with a smile and make  good recommendations.  Atmosphere: Normally bustling and wait times can extend to one hour plus during peaking dinner hours. Even when the house is packed, the restaurant doesn't feel overly crowded or noisy. If the wait is long and there are just two of you, try and get a seat at the bar.  The bar is actually one of my favorite seats in the house as you get to watch them make the pizzas and the bartenders are great! Value: Good value for what you receive which is a consistently good dining experience with fresh ingredients. The draft and bottled beers are very reasonably priced and I love that they have an option for a 9 ounce wine pour. Sometimes you want a little more than a glass of wine but not two glasses, the 9  oz pour is a great idea.

I have never had a bad experience here. I don't get all the bad reviews? The wait was long. But, I've had longer waits. We waited for thirty min. But, the good thing about this location is you are next to a mall. So you can walk around while you wait for the buzzer to buzz You. Today it seemed extra busy but, all of the employees were still in great moods. All of the food that came out looked so awesome. Our waitress was Anastasia. I thought that she was probably the best waitress I've ever had in my life. She needs a raise. Probably a promotion too. Seriously. Just make her the owner already. She's that awesome. Made our experience so great that I'm coming here next weekend too and, bringing my friends Lol. Ok anyway about the food. Everything we ordered was fresh and so good. I ordered my favorite pizza. The habenero carnitas. Which was once again made on point. I need that receipe in my life. The presentation was very impressive too. Now I actually want to go shopping for New dishes :) There drinks are so scrumptious. My husband had the agave mojito. I took a few sips and it's one of those drinks where you just instantly feel all warm. So I got a warm and fuzzy feeling BUT it was also sweet so it just made it a great drink to me. That is exactly why I am coming next weekend :) The good food, great service AND those yummy warm fuzzy drinks.

One of my favorites. CPK is my go to dinner for their Chicken Piccata, which I love so much and during this visit, it was specifically tasty, however, our server, Josh, was not pleasant at all. He was not attentive or enthusiastic and seemed to be dreading our presence. I love CPK and most of their servers are some of the best I've ever seen, but this experience was not a good one thanks to the server. Currently sitting in CPK and Josh simply dropped the check on our table.

All around this place has lowered its quality since couple years ago. For instance, their napkins are now paper instead of white towelettes, their food is less tasty and innovative, even their "fruit" drinks are just made from syrup and not real fruit, and lastly their service is way disorganized.  We got to our table and a total of three  servers came to us before our real server! One took our drink and appetizer order, a second one merely asked if we had been served yet, and the third server delivered our drinks until we then met our actual server who was a bit socially awkward....  We ordered the spinach artichoke dip that we've always ordered- and it wasn't the same creamy fine chopped spinach as before.  The children's pepperoni pizza was way too greasy and spicy!  Our Hawaiian pizza doesn't stand a chance against our homemade pizza. And all pizzas had way too much crust and not enough stuff on top.  Another bust place to eat on O'ahu I'm afraid.

Review for my visit on 07/12/15 My family came in at 10:50am on Sunday and were promptly seated. I ordered my daughter's food first and it came out at a reasonable time. My husband and I ordered pizzas and our wait time was more than 30 minutes. The nice waitress explained that my husband's pizza burned and that they made another pizza for him. I appreciated that they explain why the wait was long and I'm glad they didn't serve a burnt pizza to my husband. HOWEVER, when our pizzas did come out, it was my California Club Pizza that was a disappointment. I took a bite of my pizza and tasted a plain burnt pizza. I remember this pizza as a fresh tasting pizza and it was far from that. I continued to eat the pizza so I could figure out what was wrong with it. Then I thought, there wasn't enough dressing on the salad maybe that's way it wasn't tasty. I looked underneath the salad to see burnt bacon on the pizza. :( The edges of the pizza was slightly burnt as well. I compared the picture I took of my pizza and the other California Club pizza pictures on Yelp and my pizza was burnt, the salad not crispy and fresh looking and you couldn't see on my picture if there was dressing on the salad. You can clearly see dressing on the other pictures. It did NOT look like how it was suppose to be. I understand the wait for my husband's pizza but if the other pizza was not up to par they should not have served the pizza or they should have made another pizza at the same time my husband's pizza was made a second time.  I appreciated that someone came by to apologize and they took out the pizza from the bill. But nonetheless I am still a disappointed customer. I loved ordering the California Club Pizza. It was my favorite pizza from here and now I'm afraid to come back and be disappointed again.

We are pretty big fans of California Pizza Kitchen.  If you don't get there at the right time, do expect a wait.  The nice thing is, they give a buzzer and have a pretty good range to still shop at the mall while you wait to be buzzed. We eat a variety of things.  Our families usuals consist of chicken piccata, macaroni and cheese, Caramelized peach salad, and the ravioli.  All come out on point, and if it's not, don't hesitate to let your server and manager know, they correct it.  I like there service stride here, the go the extra mile for the customer. A bonus is getting an ice cream Sunday with an kids meal for just $.99!!

Love this place. Always consistent with friendly service. Giving them 4 stars only because they can work a little harder to keep the place tidy. Recently tried the White Pizza & added on the Applewood Bacon as recommended by our waitress & it was outta this world! My husband & I also love their Jambalaya Fettuccine. Another personal fave of mine is their BBQ Chicken Salad. So fresh & a great way to start your meal along with your complimentary bread. Don't forget to top it off with the Butter Cake with Vanilla Ice Cream!

I went here with my sister and had an amazing lunch. The staff were awesome and super nice, and our waitress was so sweet. The kitchen seemed to be backed up? Honestly I didn't really notice because they gave us toasted sourdough with delicious olive oil with herbs to dip it in. When we got our pizza, ( we decided to share a white pizza) the smell was soooo good! After waiting a bit for it to cool off we took a bite. HOLY WOW. The ricotta cheese must be made with whole milk, not the skim stuff they sell at groceries, because it was delicious and melty. And the roasted garlic bits- I. Love. Garlic. My sister suggests dipping the crust in the olive oil if it's still on the table. Oh, and try the strawberry tea if you want something not too sweet and refreshing. For dessert we had the soufflé with ice cream. Since neither of us had ever even seen a soufflé, we decided to try it. It was pretty good, but next time we'll try the caramel pudding.

Totally love this place but I must I was disappointed about my service yesterday.  My server was "shitty".  Had to ask her for bread.  She forgot a few things we asked of her.   She wasn't personable.  She is completely not a people person. The lettuce was old because it was browning.   Ugh I hate giving bad reviews to a place a completely love but that's just facts for other people to know! Boo for yesterday's experience.

The wait to get into the restaurant is constantly at 20mins. And once you get in they take forever to even take your order. And once you get your order in they take even longer to get you your order. I would rather seriously go to another CPK in town. This one always takes so goddamn long. Like I've had to wait over 30mins for them to bring me my order.
Quick lunch at CPK.  Food server was friendly and efficient. Food came out quickly and exactly as ordered. Delicious and fast. Will be back soon.

I don't go to CPK enough for sure.  First for the bad: spinach dip was tasty but chips were a little stale.  I tell my wife every time she orders white sauce pasta anywhere that its hit or miss, and it was miss.  She ordered the white sauce something with chicken, not much flavor.  Now for the good:  I had the jerk chicken pizza and it was awesome!  A bit of a stretch for me to order a pizza without red sauce, but this thing was heavenly!  Just put it this way, I could've finished it, but I think I purposely didn't so that I could finish it as soon as i got home.  As for service A plus!  Hostess, server, manager all excellent!  Will definitely go back, soon I hope.
Sign up for their CPK App to earn points and offers. My favorite pizza is their BBQ Chicken with Bacon (no onions). Their style of chicken in their lettuce wraps have changed so be aware.

You know what makes a restaurant five stars? Excellent food AND excellent service!! Just had a wonderful experience at the Pearlridge location with server Anastasia! She provided excellent customer service by going above and beyond! Not only did she check on us numerous times making certain our drinks were filled, she made sure we were thoroughly satisfied with our food choices. We enjoyed the avocado rolls, a must have for each visit, and the carnita tacos and Chinese chicken salad, to make a few. Yum and yum!  Again, delicious food and superb service made for a wonderful dinner!

When I'm in love with a dish that only a certain restaurant can prepare it the way i like it, I would continuously go back when i have the cravings for it even if the service is bad. I always order shrimp garlic cream fettucini and thai crunch salad and hubby always gets pizza. service is sometimes good and bad but i always love coming here for the same things.

There are up and downs to this location. The food is good, just the service. Plus they came out with a point system which is similar to a foodland Maika'i card. When you sign up for it, you get one of the small dishes free! We got the mushroom spinach flatbread free, I ordered a full cobb salad, and my friend ordered a alfredo.
