Only thing about the service is they forgot to give us utensils and napkins. They began to serve our food and only noticed they forgot the utensils thinking we are gonna eat it by hand or something. But either way, I still love this place. I just think the Ala moana location is much more worth it!

Came here for lunch after shopping for dresses. I called in advance and put my name in and luckily didn't have to wait that long for a table. The estimated wait time the hostess have me was pretty accurate at 25 minutes. The waiter was very friendly and courteous. Unfortunately where we were seated was across from the pizza oven so it was a bit humid, our table was so close to the tables next to us on either side that the waiter kept bumping even the littlest things on the sides of the table.  The wait for the table was relatively okay but the wait for our food was kind of long. Luckily the waiter gave us bread and our appetizers first. The main entree was okay. I tried the Caramelized Peach Salad and the lettuce looked wilted and the chunks of cheese were actually mushy; I think it's supposed to be crumbly feta or blue cheese, either way, it wasn't crumbly, it more like paste...  My sisters food didn't look very nice, it didn't seem plated nicely. I suppose it was because they were rushing to fulfill orders. Overall, it was a good time with my friends and sister just talking. However, external matters brought it down.

So we come here for lunch at 10:30 when they open and of course the first customers and the whole restaurant is empty! After  1 hr I realize our food is still not out, and we ordered only soup salad and pizza. I went up to the hostess Shan to ask for our order. And here we go again, her answer oh, because we waiting for the pasta! I tell her we didn't order pasta! Then she says oh because we have a catering order so we are backed up! Excuse me we are the very first customer who entered and we still didn't get our food and everyone else has there food! Now the manager Sean comes to talk to us regarding our order! I'm not going into details but he needs more management training! He literally tried justifying why are food didn't come out yet and blamed the salmon what a joke! As a manager your not suppose to try and find excuses but to accommodate our request and find out what's going on! Apparently the system doesn't work and I am so unhappy right now that I can't even eat my food. I don't care about crediting some of the cost on the bill just get it right! So for all you Yelpers I highly recommend not to order the salmon because it will take 45 min verses 15 min. If I could rate today's experience with no stars I would but have to add that one star.

Food-- great selection and tasted very good. Prices are reasonable too. Service-- quick and attentive. Ambience-- fun but a bit close to each other. Overall great, right?! It was great until I took a bite out of my dessert and spit a bolt out of my mouth. Shocking and in awe I showed them. Although they reimbursed me a portion of the bill, I am hesitant to return. I'm glad I didn't choke on it.

Shawn was our Waithelp he was always there when we needed extra bread or water. He also knew the menu and made me feel comfortable to try my meal! Thanks a bunch Shawn.  Trisha on the other hand, really worked the floor making sure everything was to our liking! She greeted each table with an "aloha" smile and introduce herself and took the time to know each customer. She left each table letting us know they are thankful having us and hope we become "Regular". She made us feel like "Ohana". She gave us a good impression of this restaurant!! I will definitely return with my family!! Mahalo CPK!!!

Ordered take away from here the other day and was so impressed with the service. Online ordering was a cinch. Got to CPK a couple minutes after it was scheduled to be ready. Pick up is at the bar. Cassie who handled my order was a breath of fresh air. She was thorough, efficient, and personable. For all the mediocre to downright bad customer service experiences out there, this made up for it! She showed me everything I ordered while repeating back the order to make sure it was right-- Chili's, you should take note here... My only complaint is that the artichokes on the pizza I ordered were way too big and instead of being nice and juicy, they were dried out. So that's the reason for one less star. Normally I love everything I order from CPK. Decided to try their salmon. While the cook on it was great, I wasn't crazy about the flavor. It had a smoke & spice - kinda tex mex- flavor to it. I was hoping for a simple grill with lemon, pepper and oil. But that's just my preference and not taking away from the rating. Definitely will be back and huge kudos to Cassie!

Came here for dinner after having a study & homework session at Starbucks. Luckily there was no long wait and we were seated immediately. Unfortunately, we had a junk female waiter who practically avoided us the whole time. She kept saying that she'll get us our cup of water and bread the whole time but kept forgetting until the 3rd time that we had to remind her. She forgot to give us our small plates and also forgot to give us our utensils for our food and to eat with. Like wtf are we supposed to eat with???? Our hands? She didn't even refill our cups and didn't bother to ask at all if we needed anything else. It was annoying. I could tell she was very inattentive because we tried getting her attention for quite a while but she barely noticed us. She completely forgot about us right after she served our food. It's a good thing there was another waiter who gave us more than a second of his time to accommodate to our needs even if he was busy serving others. I believe his name was Sebastian! I couldn't even remember the name of our original server but who cares. She sucks!

Such hype here, this place is overrated and dang pricey.  Ok so when I do come I always order a pizza and a salad, it's a given right?  This place is ok, hate waiting in line.  If I do come here- I consider it a "treat" -not everyday eating and dining.  I come here maybe 3 times per year...good enough.

Worst CPK I've ever been to!  Ordered roasted veg salad...awful mushy veggies. Sent that back...got the guaranteed stand-by....the BBQ chicken salad. Also terrible. Chicken was obviously thawed out frozen pre-cooked chicken. The whole thing tasted bad...Didn't eat it. Good thing I had bread while I waited for my salad after my husband got his pizza. How does a salad take longer to prepare than a pizza?  Note to self. ...Do not go to this CPK again!

We come here a lot. The pizza dough rewards are good. You earn points, get cash off rewards & free desserts sometimes. Use the call ahead option since they're always busy. Call CPK direct, ask to be added to the call ahead list then let them know about what time you'll get there. Their bread is SO GOOD! They serve it hot and wow, it's a wonderful improvement over the other bread. I'm no longer a fan of their pizza crust since they changed it a few years ago so I'll order pasta or salad. I wish I had room for dessert, but I rarely do. A few times the Server let us order the kid's brownie sundae. It's really good! Malinda took great care of us! Super sweet, super nice. Kept the mango iced tea & cranberry cooler glasses full. The only negative comment is that it's way too noisy in there. It's very difficult to carry on a conversation. Aloha!

Been awhile since I've been here. Came here for lunch with my other half. It was busy on a rainy day too. My experience was here was above average but not to the point where I could give 5 stars. Only one thing that I was upset is the drink that I ordered. Never mess with my first drink cause it had a lot of ice in it. I drank it in a minute or two. Wasn't satisfying. So I ordered beer instead. Anyways what caught be by surprise is that my other halfs pizza crust was burnt but they did say we'll make a new one for u to take home. I was like blown away where of course they would go out of there way to make a new one. Now that's customer service. I'm pleased with the service and especially with the server that we had. Kellie was awesome. Thank you!!!

They were able to accommodate huge parties when I've been before and service and food was still great! Love the sicilian thin crust pizza and avocado spring roll appetizer. The Hawaiian BBQ + bacon is also my fave. Don't care for the pastas its ehh alright. But one thing you definitely can't leave here without ordering is the warm and heavenly butter cake!

I love CPK, we eat there 2-3 times a month. The 1 star is for the takeout side. Last night I ordered the BBQ CHICKEN chopped salad for lunch the next day. I was looking forward to lunch today because the salad is my favorite thing at CPK. I open up my salad and guess what...there's no chicken in my BBQ CHICKEN chopped salad. It wouldn't be a big deal if this was the first and only time it happened but nope...unfortunately it has happened before. 11 days ago (I still have the email confirmation in my inbox) I placed a takeout order for the Asparagus + Spinach Spaghettini. I paid the extra $5 for grilled chicken. My husband brings home the food and guess what...NO CHICKEN. WTF CPK. My fault for sending a husband that doesn't know the order, but my order should have been correct in the first place.

Our waitress was amazing and so friendly. The food was awesome! Their shrimp scampi pizza is great! It has a nice spice to it too. We came with a group of 8 people and all of our food came at exactly the same time so we avoided the awkward table stare when one person finishes their food before the others lol. I've eaten at CPK many times before but the servers at this location are so friendly and attentive!

CPK surprises me fir being a franchise they do it well! We wanted to let off some steam from the week and where better to do that than CPK at Pearlridge mall! Atmosphere: Clean and very high ceilings with an open kitchen. You feel very welcomed when you walk in. The wait was long given that it was a weekend but so worth it. Service: We waited about an hour for a table. They have beepers so it was very convenient. The waitress was so friendly and full of suggestions. I followed her every suggestion and left satisfied. Food: We ordered the entire menu. Started off with chips and salsa and flatbread. For drinks I had the lilikoi and appleberry sangrias. Tried the california club pizza and I am so glad. The chicken, bacon combo with the slice of avocado on every slice was amazing!!! Intangibles: Make reservations in advance. Trust me!!!

My boyfriend and I love this place! Everytime we come (which is very often) we have the best experience with their food and customer service! Everyone is always friendly and the food is always amazing! We love their butter cake for desert also!

Ordered something while dining and wasn't what I expected and right away they fixed my order and they made me something better. So glad that they resolved my issue but as always dining at cpk is always awesome worth the long line wait. And love the staff friendly and awesome environment!

10.12.15 party of 4 seated within 15 min and server was decently quick and efficient. Offered drink refills and came back w extra napkins, containers, etc. However, spinach artichoke dip was very garlic heavy and the chips were stale. Margarita pizza under cooked. Asparagus & spinach spaghettini bland. Bread was SLOW to arrive and server made excuse about kitchen being slow. Soda was flat.  Boo CPK. Will be demoted in our family dinner line up.
Props to our waiter Dale. Friendly, efficient, and he made sure we were taken care of without being too overbearing.  Mahalo Dale!
Love this place and love the food! I'm a huge Alfredo kind of girl and it is on point here!! I will keep coming back for their amazing foods and top customer service!

The service there was great, once we was seated the waitress asked us what we wanted to drink. She got it right away for us, and we ordered our food. Our food came in 20 min, it wasn't that long.  During our dinner my friend ordered a shake and he noticed it wasn't blended well so we called over the waitress and she was really nice about it and she brought us a new one. When my friend was half way done with it he sipped up and piece of glass. We poured the whole drink out on a plate and we found chunks of glass and we was pretty upset.  Luckily my friend was okay, and the manager at the restaurant said her sorry and paid for our dinner. Atleast was manager was concerned about my friend and she paid for our whole dinner.  Other than that, the food was really great. I had pepperoni pizza and the crust was thin crunchy just how how I like it. I would come to CPK again (:

I cannot get enough of this place! Me and my coworkers come here too often haha. Customer service here is always awesome, food is great, and I love the atmosphere of the restaurant. The BBQ chicken salad, chicken piccata, and salted caramel pudding are my fave! Oh and the avocado egg rolls.

Birthday dinner ruined. We used the mobile check in and was told we had 179 minutes to get there to check in at CPK. Yes, almost three hours! We received a confirmation code ensuring our spot. We got there in less than an hour. The hostess told us that the mobile app was used only to collect points and not used to check in. Yet the Ala Moana restaurant allowed people to go through the same process and was given seats upon their arrival. We were given a pager and was told that we had to wait 45 minutes for a table. We just left utterly disappointed. Yes, Happy Birthday to me!

Went here for lunch the other day. It was PACKED. but we got seated pretty fast. It took what seemed like FOREVER to get our drinks. The waitress was sweet and even apologized for the wait. The food was delicious. I ordered the mushroom pizza. Yummy.  I always order the red sangria. It's delicious.  My boyfriend ordered the Hawaiian pizza and it was super yummy too. This is always a great place to go!!!

Whenever I get seated at the bald waiter's section I have to ask to be moved to another table, I just can't stand his sweat dripping on his forehead then wiping it and not washing his hands. Plus, have you ever seen the workers making pizza and those workers that are making that appetizers-  that are grabbing the lettuces- they don't wear GLOVES.  Plus the waitress and waiter's when bringing the food to the table-they talk over the food with spit coming out of there mouth, why can't they just sit it down on the table without calling out the name of the food............

New Review: Came close and gave one star as the hostess upset me originally but I'm easily appeased with a smile and apology.  Our waiter Mike was super friendly and quick.  They sang to my son and it made his 8th memorable Original Review (with 4stars): Arrival: Hostess not that friendly, could not hear my name, and spelled it wrong. She said it would take 15 and it was less Seated: Waitress Nicole came right away, took the drink and appetizer order. The drinks came right after we ordered and appetizer came about 5-10 minutes after ordering. The waitress was super attentive even with at least 4 tables and a full house.  Food: Overall, it was good. Noodles were sparse and a little under cooked but still tasted good. Everyone enjoyed their meal.  Would recommend!!

Had lunch here after catching a matinee. My Cobb salad had more chicken than the tequila chicken fettuccine. I was very disappointed. The full size portion was more like a mini. The fettuccine was short of al dente. I had to put extra effort to chew through the pasta. Al dente was only a minute or two away. I was not in a hurry. How did this happen? ... I think the B team was in the kitchen during the day.  I hope their A team exists for the night shift. For this CPK, the customer service was great. The meal could've been better. Sadly, the pasta fell short in quality and quantity.

I'm a CPK fan thru and thru.  This location has been our go to lunch spot when we have time to drive over from work.  Service....Recently I've been extra super impressed with the service here. The staff is really going above and beyond to make sure things are right and when they aren't perfect, they get fixed with apologies and remakes and sometimes free desserts. I understand that CPK has always been a service driven restaurant but this one seems to be going the extra mile.  Food wise....the food is the same as all CPKs and that's no slight. I love CPK food. All of it. Spinach artichoke dip, pizza, salad, and dessert....look out waistline. It's such a treat!  There is never a disappointing time here. Special Occasion or not... I'll be back!

Great spot for lunch with friends, family or clients!  Salads, pizzas and pastas are always fulfilling and the desserts are divine.  The staff are knowledgeable and friendly.  The management staff are attentive and very willing to ensure your complete cuisine satisfaction.   CPK also serves a full bar of alcoholic beverages!

We were seated quickly. Grilled scrimp salad arrived after the margarita pizza. Pizza arrived after thirty minutes and it was luke-warm. Same for the grilled shrimp salad which arrived shortly after the pizza. Both my and my friends grilled chicken Caesar tasted off. Did not finish and left the luke warm pizza as well. Manager acknowledged the kitchen was behind and offered to comp one of our items. They need a good kitchen manager to push hot food or it's going to continue to be an issue for them. Don't go if you see people waiting or you'll face the same problems.

Pazé was our waitress she was patient and helpful. She made the experience that much better from recommending her favorites to being so accommodating to us both. She's great at her job what more can I say

More restaurants will need to strive to the level of service that was provide by this location.  My wife and I decided to have dinner here and greatly enjoyed our experience. Our server's name was Samy, she was very polite and attentive. We ordered a avocado club rolls and a Sicilian pizza. Half way through our dining, she and the manager, Trisha, both aplogized for the long wait for our appetizer and said it would be out momentarily. My wife and I did not notice how long it has been but the staff was on point and made sure to see we were taken care of.  Our waitress, Samy, stopped by multiple times to see if we needed anything. Our overall experience will always be remembered, and we will return again. If we are lucky enough, we wouldn't mind being seated in Samy's section.

CPK was my go to place in high school, when a couple of classmates and I would go to the Ala Moana or Pearlridge location to share Thai crunch salads, fried mac and cheese balls, or three cheese raviolis, while discussing school issues, projects or just gossip. When I think of CPK, I realize that I never actually order their pizzas, but always a pasta, salad or appetizers galore.  Nowadays, when I do get a chance or find myself in the mood for CPK, I still tend to order the same things, just add an alcoholic beverage. Their sangrias are really good and worth the price you pay (~$9).  Always good: spinach and artichoke dip,  fried mac and cheese, Thai crunch salad, three cheese ravioli or spaghetti bolognese.  Surprisingly good: Kung pao spaghetti and the steak chimichurri. I'm not a huge fan of their shift from butter to herb oil for their free bread, but you can always ask for balsamic vinegar to make the herb oil better.

Came here and had about a 40 minute wait.  Was able able to walk around the mall for a bit until we felt our buzzer going off.   There was 4 of us and we ordered 2 pizzas and 2 pastas.  Was a little disappointed that  my fettuccini pasta with chicken came out with only 5 pieces of chick and was really dry.  I was able to speak what our server and she was nice enough to go get her manager.  They were able to resolve the issue and had made an extra side of creamy sauce with more chicken.  I was happy.   Besides that I love CPK and their drinks and appetizers are awesome!  Be sure to bring $$ because you will be spending more than $50! Try their lettuce wraps and their spinach dip. Yummy!!! Can't wait to come back...

What an AMAZING MEAL!  They put out a new menu at the start of the New Year (abt 3 wks ago) and at first we were skeptical. Hubby came here primarily to order their Carnita Tacos which he loves... and at first was disappointed to hear they discontinued that entrée.  They still have the Avocado Egg Rolls, we ordered them and I swear they're even better than before! Hubby got the Fettuccine Jambalaya and loved it.  I ordered their RIB EYE and it was AMAZING (just take a look at my picture)! I thought the flavor was up there with the likes of Morton's and Ninnikuya- A Garlic Restaurant (remember them on Waialae!) It's served on this cool chopping board platter, with a really generous portion of Fresh Arugula Salad that is tossed in a lite vinegarette dressing, yum! And the fingerling potatoes are roasted in butter, garlic and herbs, just so tasty!  Staff was friendly as always, and eager to please.  I really appreciate an establishment not cutting corners on cost by understaffing. They seem very adequately staffed, and staff always conduct themselves very professionally. A perfect experience!

Awesome atmosphere with even better service. My ribeye was a little too raw for my liking. I don't mind rare meat but it was very raw in the middle and still cold. And if you're picky about your steaks, this wouldn't be the dish for you. Looked and tasted previously frozen. They offered to make me a new plate right away after seeing it was raw and the manager made it a point to come and apologize. Quality of the ribeye wasn't the best as it was like ordering a burger from Taco Bell or oysters from a diner, I ordered a steak from a pizza kitchen. Know where you are and order accordingly. Despite the quality of the meat, everything else was on point. But I've never been so satisfied with customer service. They deserve every bit of 5 stars.

I always leave here happy :). We always order the California club pizza and never get tired of it. For our previous visit we tried the new quinoa salad and I really enjoyed it, very light. Their deserts here are also great but my favorite is the salted caramel pudding

A 45-minute wait for a table quickly turned into a 3-second snatch of chairs at the counter. Sweet because I was hangry on this Friday night! We just had to wait a few minutes to get the counter cleared and wiped off before receiving glasses of water, place settings, and menus. Since we were overlooking the bar, the pizza 'n pasta making stations, and plating of all the appetizers and main dishes, it kind of made our decision making process much more difficult because everything looked so delicious! Service was great! Our server took notice when we were ready to place our order. Delivery was pretty quick, too! We ended up with Chicken Lettuce Wraps for starters, Thin Crust Pepperoni Pizza, and Chicken Tequila Fettuccini for the main dish. Oh! And there was complimentary french bread and olive oil for dipping.  Everything was delicious! But, I should caution you that the Thin Crust can get a little too crunchy, so if you have any issues with your jaw, you may want to stick with their Original Hand Tossed. The pepperoni was excellent though. Highly recommend it as a topping on any pizza! If you're a lover of Moscow Mule, order it here! It was a perfect pair to my meal. Cold, sweet, and gingery, with a little kick and perfectly mixed in a copper mug made for a great drink after a long day at work. BTW, if you do end up having to wait more than 30-minutes for a table, you can always pop back into Pearl Ridge Mall for some shopping. Or, skip over to TJ Maxx across the parking lot! ;-)

I love CPK for their great pizza quality, pasta, and appetizers. They even offer a gluten free crust! Service is always friendly and I love their pizza dough app. Where you can get points and then use them for discounts.

This CPK is so busy!!!  But then again, what CPK in Hawaii isn't?  Still, you have to love them for their pizza and awesome food.  My favorites are the thai pizza and the bbq chicken pizza.  I also really love their Chinese chicken salad.  Some things I really like about this location is that the service was excellent.  The waiters are super attentive and really go the extra mile.  But like I said, this location can get busy, and it is smaller than other CPK's I've been to so it can get a little noisier.  I still love CPK though!

Friendly server, seated right away (arrived at noon) considering its a Saturday. New menu items "Ahi creations" and seasonal blackberry alcoholic/non-alcoholic drinks. Trying the new roasted garlic chicken and vegetables (Brussels sprouts, cauliflower, fingerling potatoes). The Seared Ahi was OK, the bok Choi wasn't over cooked; overall the sweet/salty sauce made the dish. The roasted chicken is a winner- the garlic did not over power the juicy chicken. Lastly the Raspberry Fizz was good for what it was, I ordered it thinking it was going to be sweeter and the carbonation of the champagne caught be off guard.

UPDATE: Went again on 1/23/16. Arrived at 4:55 pm. There were no parties waiting outside so I thought that was a good sign. I WAS FUCKING WRONG!!!!!!!!!! ABSOLUTELY FUCKING WRONG!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We get there and are greeted by Daniel. I tell him it's for two. He doesn't take my name, which at the time seemed okay since he explained that there was only one other party of two and they were going to be seated shortly. We sat in there waiting area and watched that party of two before get seated. Then a few minutes later we see another party of two get seated. Then no more than a minute later,  ANOTHER party of two got seated. SO WHY AM I STILL FUCKING WAITING??! So I get up and walk over to Daniel, who has the look of an idiot now, and ask if those two parties had reservations. He stammered to answer because he'd come to the realization that he forgot about my party. He offers to seat me. FUCK THAT! THE CUSTOMER SERVICE IN THE BEGINNING SETS THE TONE FOR THE REST OF THE VISIT!!!!!! Why the fuck would I want to still eat there?! So I say no in the nicest tone I could possibly muster and walk out. Then I decide to turn around and get the name of the woman who looked as if she was the manager, but stood there with the same idiot look Daniel had and did nothing to assist the situation. Her name was Trisha or Tricia (however the fuck you wanna spell it). If I wasn't as tired as I was, I probably would have caused a scene so that the entire restaurant knew of their stupudity. I'm done with that place. They obviously can't seem to hire anyone competent for their front, which sucks because the wait staff is so friendly.

1.22.16 Aloha Friday pau hana with co-workers Sat on the bar side, no wait Had to ask for bread & water Halibut- ono Rest of the staff: manager/ take out/ cooks -cool Server: can make use of a little smile & follow up, so flat affect

The only reason why I'm rating this 4 instead of 5 is because CPK updated their menu...AGAIN. Also, little things changed like, no grated cheese on the table... I'd prefer the one on the table than the one they grate by hand. Anywho, service is what you'd expect- it's the same at all of the locations I've been at. There is one worker at this location that always takes good care of us though. I believe her name is Melina or Melinda (sorry about the spelling). Ask to sit in her section... She serves with a smile and with such amazing positive vibes!  I'm gonna put my secret out there, but I get the wild mushroom pizza with the white truffle oil AND I add BACON! Do it... It'll be the best decision you'll make in your life!
Ok I like this place...what else can I say, however it's been reaaaallllyyy crowded lately.

Fettuccine Alfredo with mushrooms tasted dry and bland, even with the extra grated Parmesan cheese that was added. For some reason, it tasted way better at the Ala Moana location. Wild Mushroom Pizza with Truffle Oil. Delicious! The truffle oil is a must have, takes the pizza to the next level! Thai Chicken Pizza sure was fresh with its raw bean sprouts and slivered carrots, but it's not my cup of tea.  Service at the bar counter top was mediocre, they seemed too preoccupied with making drinks and serving the rest of the restaurant.
just to shorten this review.  i hope whoever goes to eat at this location DOES NOT get the same server as we did!

We went here as a last resort because nothing else (that sounded remotely appetizing and wasn't in town) was open after 9 p.m. Not a huge CPK fan in general, so expectations were low walking in. We were pleasantly surprised. The service was decent and the food we ordered was tasty and came out quickly. I was excited that my "small" original bbq chicken chopped salad was huge and super filling. My husband tried a seasonal pizza pie with eggs, bacon and potatoes. I didn't like it but he loved it.  We had an overall pleasant experience here. While I still wasn't blown away by the food - I would stop in again if I was around and it was later in the evening.

You really can't go wrong with the chinese chicken salad or the original BBQ chicken pizza or the artichoke dip even. However, if you order anything else, it'll be a hit or miss. The service is also a hit or miss at this location. We had one waiter who asked us if we wanted dessert when we just got our entrees. We politely told her that we'll see after we eat a little more of our entrees. Not even 10 minutes after and still far from finishing our main entrees, our waiter comes around again and ask if we've decided on dessert yet. Once again, we said no but we all thought 'Why can't she wait till we eat at least 75% of our entrees?". Come to find out, she was finishing up her shift and wanted to give us our check before she leaves. Instead of rushing us, she could have just pass it on to the next oncoming waiter. If anything, you could just do take-out. But, there was an incident where I ordered the artichoke dip to-go, and the portion given was no where near how much they give when you sit in.

We came here on a Friday night because we couldn't think of other options. Wait was 1.25 hours for a party of 2 during valentines day weekend.  The major disappointment was the price. We spent $70 for 2... This was more expensive than my actual valentines day dinner. I  was/am a big fan of CPK but they started changing the menu options and attempting to be fancier.  Wild caught sesame ahi ( -- 3 stars. Seared ahi good. Veggies raw.  Poke chop chop salad -- tastes better than looks. Ahi quality good. Mango iced tea --  complimentary free refills. I like to switch flavors with every new refill because all the flavors are great.  It used to be a place I go for a casual, decently priced meal but not anymore.

We came here an hour before closing on a Friday night. We were quoted a 30 minute wait so we decided to walk to TJ Maxx and Ross which were the only stores open at that time. Not even five minutes later, our pager lit up and vibrated. Not bad for a busy weekend night. I've read the other reviews since I haven't been here in a while. I always go to the Ala Moana location for convenience instead. Luckily we knew what we wanted so there wasn't much of a wait time. I believe our waitress's name was Jennifer. She was very friendly and attentive. Great service as she was always refilling my son's drink without asking. As soon as it was empty, she came with a new one in hand. That deserves an A+. Our food came out in a timely manner and they were all good. The only reason I didn't give it five stars was that they ran out of the butter cake (one of their most popular desserts.) It was something I was looking forward to since I told her I wanted to order it as soon as we were done with our meal. She apologized and we ended up ordering something else. I had my heart set on it so I was a bit disappointed. Other than that, we received great service. Don't believe everything you read; otherwise you'll miss out on great food.
The chicken pasta was really good. I only don't like the tables because they are so close together like I have todo my Ninja way in and out.

Ordered lettuce wraps.  They brought it out with frozen and thawed wilted lettuce.   Asked for better lettuce.  They brought us the same frozen thawed witty lettuce.   3rd time hey only brought 3 pieces of lettuce that had obviously been trimmed.  Too funny.  My wife asked for her dish with no sauce.   They brought it with sauce and asked if that was okay.  No.    They had to remake it.  I ordered the seared Ahi.  It was good.  Flavorful and light.  Waitress was great. Very personable.  Kitchen needs to tighten up.

You can't really go wrong with California Pizza kitchen. Awesome location, delicious food and drinks, and the service usually is pretty good here. I especially love their chicken picatta and pesto cream penne. Also love their Mac and cheese bites and butter cake for dessert. I don't really care for ordering take out; you have to stand in an awkward area for phone orders that leaves you in the way of servers and people heading to the bathroom.

Ever since they got rid of the Portobello Mushroom Ravioli with Garlic Cream Sauce, my experiences at CPK have never been the same.  And that must have been well over 8 years ago!   My boyfriend and I went on a Saturday afternoon since it was our first day off together in a while.  I expected a wait since it was 11:15am and there were people standing outside, but we were seated right away since we were a party of 2. First thing my boyfriend brought up was how dirty the menus were.  Being part of the restaurant industry for a while, I understand that there are details that can sometimes be hard to catch, but there were dried CHUNKS of food on his menu.  Like there's no way menus stacked on top of it could've sat flat, at all!   I had to use my napkin for my stuffy nose and he didn't want my utensils resting anywhere on the menus (which took up the whole table) so he held it until we received the bread plates.  Also, and I don't know if it was his time of the month (hehe) but he was also disappointed that his menu didn't have the center insert with the seasonal specials like mine did.  Anyway, long story short, I really only enjoy the appetizers, nowadays.  I've had the pizzas that were either really tough or the sauce too sweet.  I've had the sandwiches which had ciabatta bread that cut the roof of my mouth.  And the pasta's weren't exactly out of this world.  But, because the appetizers are so delicious, I just get them as my meal.  The avocado club egg rolls, the spinach artichoke dip, lettuce wraps, and the hummus. All excellent and I've never had a complaint about them ever.  Oh, and the new Moscow Mules they serve are magical! Service was excellent, food came out timely and hot (taste is another issue, unless it's an appetizer), and place looked as clean as can be. Just please, pretty please, bring back the Portobello Mushroom Ravioli!  And NO I will not order the cheese ravioli, add mushrooms, and request for the garlic cream sauce.  It's not the same, but I appreciate the effort to accommodate.

CPK is my go to place ALWAYS! I am in love with the appleberry sangrias!!! It makes my heart so happy every time! I just recently discovered that it will be taken off the menu?! Whhhyyyyyy!?!?!?  please reconsider!!! I come here multiple times a week with different friends and even co workers... Pearlridge location will be loosing a lot of business from us when this becomes official  I love the food and the service but it's the sangria's that keep me coming! Think about it

I love love love the Thai crunch salad. Half serving is perfect. They add avocado for a couple dollars extra. Not worth it. The salad is so flavorful you'll miss the creamy avocado. Another fave of mine is the mango iced tea.  I've tried it at Chili's (no Bueno).  We wanted a quick lunch and got lucky. It's Monday and approximately 3pm. There wasn't a line or a wait. The bread and oil was delish. My daughter had the original pepperoni pizza. There are chunks of fresh tomatoes in the sauce. I don't mind it but my daughter picked them out. Our waitress was friendly. Service was quick. It was a good experience and we will definitely be back. Oh yeah I've had pesto penne past with shrimp and or chicken(had both ways), it's awesome when they cook the pasta right. Only had one occurrence of that which may happen sometimes if someone is training or they are short staffed. I still order it as it been great all the other times. Also if you haven't already do sign up with the pizza dough app for CPK. It's a bonus rewards app and you can use it to order online. I use it every time we go and love the benefits. My bday is coming up. Wonder what treat I'll get.  CPK

Being the adventurous sort I tend to experiment and try holes in the wall, or off the beaten path type places. However on occassion, i feel the urge to stop and grab a bite at an established eatery. Today was one of those days.  Stopping in and sitting at the bar I was greeted by Karen, who went through the beverage selection with me. I had my heart set on a Malbec, but at the last possible moment I changed my mind and decided upon "The Executive Decision", one of CPK's mixed drinks consisting of Casamigos Tequila Blanco, Muddled mint, Fresh Agave Sour, Monin Organic Agave Nectar and fresh lime. I'll tell you what, i wasn't disappointed.  I ordered a hand tossed pepperoni and applewood smoke bacon pizza with truffle oil on the side and all paired together hit the spot.  Needless to say, i could not finish it all. I will tell you that I did finish off another two Executive Decisions!!  So if you're undecided on dinner options in the Pearlridge area CPK could be a clutch last moment choice.
I've visited this location twice now and both times I was surprised how dirty the menus and tables were. The menus we're practically stuck together. Usually a very busy place, expect to wait.

Our waitress Charlotte was GREAT!!! When deciding to go to CPK, you're deciding on waiting for a table. We arrived at around 7:15pm on a Friday night and were told there was a 45 minutes wait. We got a buzzer and waited outside for around 25 minutes before we were buzzed.  Right when Charlotte greeted us, we felt like she was an old friend...literally! (my boyfriend and I both discussed how we thought she knew her from some place because she was so friendly!) When she took our drink order, she asked us if we wanted to place our dinner order as well because she knew we were waiting a while just to be seated. We took her up on that offer and my bf ordered the Pesto Pasta with chicken and I ordered a BBQ chicken pizza. She mentioned that the BBQ chicken pizza was her favorite dish as well! Our food came out fairly quickly and Charlotte was very enthusiastic about her parmesan contraction. My boyfriend wanted some on his pasta but I didn't want any. She was so enthusiastic about it that I let her put some on pizza as well! My pizza was perfect but my boyfriend's noodles were really chewy. Charlotte was VERY apologetic and took it away right away and a few minutes later, a new pasta arrived at our table. It was perfect! My boyfriend ordered a diet coke and Charlotte brought refills before he was even finished with his previous drink. She was so on it no matter how busy she was. When we were done with dinner, Charlotte brought us the dessert menu and mentioned she loved the Butter Cake! She then followed up with asking me if that's what I usually order as well. I thought it was so cute that she was concerned about if it was my favorite dessert as well. We did end up getting the Butter Cake with ice cream and it was so yummy! The cake was warm and delicious! When our bill arrived, Charlotte told us she had taken the Pesto Pasta off our bill. We were so grateful for her great service and gave her a huge tip!  If you are ever blessed with getting Charlotte, you're in luck! :)
Always dependable,  good for my diet SALAD. Karen was great! Efficient, not vulture-like, just friendly enough. Appreciated the half orders.

I really enjoyed the service from the moment I walked in until the moment I walked out.  The hostess immediately greeted us with an awesome smile and walked us to our table. Our waitress Kisha was extremely attentive.  I could tell that she was a hard worker.  We ordered the California club pizza, jambalaya and BBQ chicken chopped Salad.  The pizza was a good healthy option and wasn't too salty.  The salad could use a little work because it just seemed a little too bland for me.  I was expecting something with a little more flavored.  Lastly, the jambalaya was a little on the salty side but definitely satisfied my cravings.  4 stars for the good service and okay food.

Fours stars cuz I really like CPK but jus noticed that their forks suck!  Not sharp enough to eat salad with, you have to use it like a spoon...wtf! And its very cold in there.  Love the buttercake!! #1
A bit disappointed to see that the portion sizes for the pasta was smaller. Kind of sucks! And I tried a new pasta the zucchini. Not a fan of it. Much rather have Fettuccine Alfreddo.

Creamy, tasty chicken, mushroom Alfredo! Done perfect! Everytime I come here I tell myself I'm going to try something new but stuck to the old faithful "garlic cream fettuccini " w/ chicken and mushrooms. Had an artichoke dip which was also amazing. Our server Melinda was pleasant and attentive. Always my go to spot when Im in the pearl ridge area.

Excellent food and exceptional service! Wherever we are in the area, we always stop by for a delicious lunch or dinner. I believe that of all the CPK locations, Pearlridge has the best service....friendly, fast and accurate.  I highly recommend the pesto cream penne, lettuce wraps,  bbq chicken pizza and the spinach artichoke dip. You won't be disappointed!

Actually 5 stars why not?! Brandy our waitress was very attentive and made our dinner an experience.  The food was great as she was able to bring them out on time.  Normally in the past our salads and main course came at the same time.  Something so simple but easily over looked.  A major plus for us was we got there right before the rush at 5:00 pm.

The girl running the take out area last night was horrible. I had a 2 year old child I was holding and the place was packed and she let these two old ladies take up the whole takeout area and talk about what to order. I interrupted them and asked if I could just pick up my food while they were looking at the menu. They acted all offended but moved over, then the dumb take out girl tells me the she's actually helping them to order right now and shed be right with me. What an idiot. I should of just left. The place was packed and there was no room in the walkway where take out is. anyway, whatever your name is at the take out counter- grow up and try to work smarter not just like a robot.

Came here on a Saturday afternoon with my sister and her friends and my nieces and nephew. We got a table right away and the lady that was our server was so nice a patient and I really appreciate that people have patient because I didn't know what to order and I didn't like cpk before but now it grew on me. For my food recommend the chicken pesto penne pasta and the Thai salad I think that's what it was called but these food made me into a happy camper. I really look forward to coming to this location again it's way better than the ala moana one.

Had my daughters 5th birthday party here. They do kids parties from 8:30-10:00. It was nice to have the place to our selves. The kids loved making this own pizza and having ice cream sundaes. They got a tour of the restaurant (behind the scenes) and even a court little coloring kit to take home. All the staff were extremely friendly and it was super easy to book. My daughters favorite part was getting her own chef coat and hat. Awesome place to have a kids birthday party.
Love this place. Kids can be loud and we enjoy not having to clean up the floor after 2 4 and 6 year old girls done testing all the food on table. Super friendly staff. Charlotte is awesome.

Just left this CPK, without receiving our food order. We ordered soup and salads, all we received in 45 mins. was diet cokes and bread. The waiter was neglective and uninformative about the status of our food. After getting up and going to the hostess to ask for our bill for the sodas, explaining that we were leaving without our order, no manager came out to speak with us and we left. This CPK has been in decline for awhile and our previous visits were hit and miss with quality of food and service. I would recommend going to a different CPK if possible.

Came here to have lunch w/ a girlfriend and we got sat immediately! How often do you see that at cpk! By reading other reviews, our server was Charlotte, (I thought it was Charla) super awesome server. My friend & I couldn't decide what to get and so our server gave us more time, dropped off some bread & our spinach artichoke dip. We ended up getting a pepperoni pizza & the Kung pao spaghetti w/ shrimp. I normally get the kung pao spaghetti but for whatever reason (maybe I was really hungry), I ended up eating a whole pepper & ugh! My whole mouth was burning. Our server came back and she noticed my mouth was burning & asked if I needed some milk to help. I declined & just kept drinking water but that was A+ service. Our whole meal was pleasant thanks to Charlotte & as always, service really does affect ones visit. Thanks! :)

Got there at 5pm for an early dinner with my family of four. We got seated quickly and our server Brandon I believe, he was great!  I usually order the Caribbean sangria but he told me they got rid of that and now they have new sangria's. I didn't know what to drink but he mentioned the orchid sangria is something a bit closer to the Caribbean sangria. I went ahead and ordered it and it was delicious!  Every time we eat at CPK I always get the garlic cream fettuccine w/ shrimp and mushrooms.... Awesome! Just fantastic! Along with the butter cake! The best dessert ever!  Thank you to our server who kept refilling my husbands coke and I didn't need to hear him complaining about "where is the server" and tending to our needs as quick as he did. One of our favorite restaurants to eat at

Just had my son's 7th birthday party here.   It was great and the kids had a lot of fun.  Our hosts Kat and Jerry took really good care of us.  They helped the kids make their pizzas then took them on a tour of the kitchen.  They even took any adults that wanted to see too!   For our party we preordered food for the adults.  There were extra tables for them to hang around while the kids made their pizzas together.  Kat and Jerry were really organized and kept everything moving along at a nice pace.  At the end they helped pack all the food. The kids all got coupons for a free kids meal which was nice too.  I would definitely recommend a pizza party at cpk Pearlridge.

I came to pick up my favorite chicken tequila fettuccine for lunch. I stood there for awhile waiting for someone to acknowledge me. Good thing it was one of my few patient days.  Finally I'm putting in my order to go. Sit down wait about 10-15 mins. Then get my food and I'm off back to the office to eat. The usual packaging with bread (cold and hard) and the oil herb dip and the fettuccine. It was warm, cools down from the 10 minute drive no fault of theirs. The flavor is pretty standard but what made me drop the two stars was the under cooked fettuccine, it was hard in some areas of the pasta which made me feel like I was eating playdo. Pretty disappointing. I won't say I will never come back because I do love me some CPK and either they had an off day or just an inexperienced cook. Just wasn't my day for this dish.

Came in tonight to celebrate some great events. Best choice hands down! Gillian was phenomenal! Amazing service all around. Their Chicken Picata was drool worthy! We didn't want to finish it. I've found my ultimate favorite!

Ate here for lunch here with a girlfriend earlier today. Ordered the spinach and artichoke dip plus avocado egg rolls for appetizers. I had a half order Thai Crunch salad with avocado of course. Honestly I ate here more than a few times had no problems what so ever. Today I had a very bad experience but I kept it cool bcuz my waiter was so sweet. I found a piece of latex glove in my salad, yes a LATEX GLOVE! It was in my mouth, I thought it was a piece of chicken until I spat it out! The manager only offered to pay for my salad and give me another to go, didn't even offer to pay for the whole bill which he should of! That was disappointing but I just kept calm. I shoulda said something though. I probably won't eat there again bcuz this happened before to someone else at the same place! Thank goodness I didn't swallow it!

The two stars are for the delicious food and drinks we had. That's about it.  My girlfriends and I come here all the time. We love to do the call ahead seating. We don't have to wait as long, which is a plus on busy weekends. Mother's day we called around 430 to see how busy it was. The girl who answered the phone said she couldn't quote us because we had to walk in. We told her we wanted to do call ahead, but wanted to know what their current wait time was. We were pulling up to the mall to park. She again said she couldn't quote us a time or do call ahead. Then she suddenly transfers us to the host stand. That girl again tells us that she can't quote us, but she'll take our call ahead ??? What? We don't want to do a call ahead if it's still going to be a 45 min wait. After silence on her end while she thought about it, she finally says there's no wait at the moment. THANKS! That's all we wanted to know. We walk in 5 mins later and are sat right away. Our server was lacking a little in hospitality, but was alright. My kid ends up having to use the restroom. Not a big deal. WOW! It looked like hurricane Flossie struck worse in there than it did in my yard. Paper towels all over floor, toilet paper rolls piled on the floor, soaking wet counters, no seat covers, and an overflowing trash can. I couldn't believe that it was that messy and it wasn't even busy.  We'll come back, we always do. They need to get all their front host staff on the same page. I don't know why we had to have a 10 min conversation on how long their current wait was. Cleanliness needs a whole lot of work.

It was a good place to end the night here...We got complimentary dessert because the manager said our food was taking longer than usual but we didnt mind and the waitress and staff was on point...Awesome experience and will always be back...Maaaaannnn that butter cake though it hit the spot!!

So the bomb!! The service can be iffy at times but most of the time it's on target!! The food never fails, I thought this place was expensive but not really and the quality of the pizza is so much better. Once you try this place you won't want any other pizza, no other place compares!!

I've been to this specific location about three times already.  The wait time is not bad even though it is smaller than most CPKs.  The tables are pretty close together, and half of them are up against the large windows so everyone walking by can stare at you awkwardly.  One instance I sat at the table all the way to the right from the entrance and there were a lot of nats in that area.  I like CPK but I don't think this is an amazing location.

Having an early dinner with my son.   It's nice and cool, kind of empty at almost 5 pm.  We got lucky and got Gillian as our waitress again!  She is awesome!   The last time I came, it wasn't a pleasant experience because the hostess kept seating other people and forgot about us.  Gillian make the experience nice.

Such a good place to have dinner with friends! Ordered the Garlic Chicken Pizza and it was pretty good! Spinach artichoke dip was bomb :) First time eating their Butter Cake with Vanilla Ice cream & it was pretty good too. Warm/cold dessert was interesting:)

Overrated. The food took about 40 minutes to come out. I had the roasted veggie salad and he had the kum pao spaghetti. The food was good but on the pricey side. Could have gotten a better salad for cheaper at Aloha Salads as he could've gotten a pasta dish at Bravo's that was better and less expensive.

I never expect much every time I dine at CPK Pearlridge, or at any CPK for that matter. But, my last experience there exceeded my expectations. Lindsey was our host and Sandy was our server. They were both nice and very helpful during our experience, and very exceptional in their customer service. We asked for cheese because we didnt have any on our table. I was surprised to see that Sandy came out with a small bowl of freshly grated parmesan cheese. Won't get much into their food, but they did revamp their menu a bit. Their pizza is always a good choice and their sangrias are always refreshing. Kudos for the better service. I was very pleased.

I know it will be crowded and loud but I also know the service and food are top notch. Love the bread and oil they bring, and the Chicken Milanese I ordered was so yummy!  For what it is (casual, reasonably priced food) CPK is a 5 star place.

I usually love coming here. Today, my gf wanted to sit at the bar and so we did.  Worst decision ever!  Bree, the bartender/server was working the bar alone. It wasn't busy, there were 5/6 of us sitting at the bar and so I kind of expected better service then we received. We had to ask random waitresses to assist us with balsamic vinegar for our bread, more bread and more water. We weren't done eating yet and we asked for our check because we weren't sure how long it was going to take us to receive it. All in all. Horrible service today! On a side note: there are flies everywhere in this place..!! What's up with that!?! It's one thing to have to get assistance from someone other than your waitress, it's another when you have to "shew" flies from attacking our meal!

Found a bug crawling out from the bottom of my pizza last week :( The waitress didn't find it urgent and didn't seem that sorry about it. They did give us a new pizza within 15 minutes after the incident though. I still love this place, and I know it happens, I just wish they were a little more empathetic about the situation. They questioned us implying we did it on purpose. The manager came over and explained that the bugs fly from outside... okay... where else do they come from?!

Came here for a lunch date. The server was super friendly, and made great suggestions. I had a modification to my order, and it came out great, too. We had the BBQ chicken & chipotle chicken pizzas, which were wonderful.  We also got that flight of sangrias they were advertising, which was delicious - and much bigger than we expected for the price! Best of all, I accidentally left my card there, and the server was honest enough to grab it and place it into the safe until I could make it back to retrieve it. The host and manager were prompt about it, and made sure to check my ID before handing it away. Kudos!!  I'll absolutely eat here again.

Was it worth adding extra $20 to your tip? Went there on Fathers Day 6/19/16 everything was normal when in with my family and ordered as normal and left and went home. a few days later wifey asked if i put tip because the amount was different from the charge on the card. we always zero out the tip on the charge receipt and leave cash, because it benefits the server. the charge was $67.00 but the bank statement was $87.00. so call and talked to the manager, after she did some research she said that there was a $20 tip, but i told her that we left cash and zero out the tip. then i asked why would the server do that? the manager was surprised too, said she would have to talk her and find out.  the manager refunded the $20 and offered to put our name on a list so next time we could get complimentary food or dishes, but honestly, i will never go back to this place and can't trust going there again.  hope it was worth the $20? it not so much the amount but the company values and policies I'm worried about.  i hope that the sever is not working there anymore. she or (someone) straight up stole and fraudulently charged the credit card.  don't care who did it, don't trust them and will never return to this location and will think twice about supporting this company at any location.  if you decide to go here be careful and double check the check. Manager: Trisha Server: Rachel  Overall: 1 stars Service: average, but will never go back or trust them again. Time: normal wait. Money: $$ little above average $8-15 range

Ok I have always loved this place, what has happened?   The food doesn't taste the same and the waitress was so MEAN....  I new something was wrong when we first walked up to check in for a party of 3 adults and 2 children and the girl says 45 minutes? ! HUH  NOPE NOT SO SO we get buzzed about 15 minutes later we get sat down and we get a waitress that had a very hard day and needed either a break or to go home... She was rude especially to my daughter.  Appetizers came out fast, but what upset her I think was when I asked to edit my order to a salad instead, I know I asked her in sufficient time, it was less than 5 minutes when she left the table. She comes back with A LOOK TO KILL! I DID APOLOGIZE and canceled my order.  Everyone's food came to the table which took longer than normal, the 2 children went to sleep waiting (so long) our food was all cold oh yeah and my daughter's plate was WRONG! OMG By now we were all like we are tired we wanna go already  and with no apologies from our waitress she finally brings my daughter's plate...urghh I WILL NEVER BE GOING BACK TO CPK AGAIN!! SERVICE 0 STAR FOOD 0 STAR AMBIANCE 0 STAR  (HOT SON) STAFF 1 STAR  (GREETER)

Was going to give 4 stars because its always crowded and wait time can be long; however, for lost repeat customers, it's a given. So expect to wait 20-30 min.  At least it's worth the wait. Food here is always consistent and delicious. I recently tried the wild mushroom pizza with truffle oil drizzled over, delish. We love the tortilla soup and whatever pasta we're in the mood for, oh and got to have the oriental chicken salad. The dressing is like an Asian barbecue, delicious with the crispy Chinese cabbage and won ton chips.  Great location and plenty of parking since it is part of Pearlridge (downtown). Tried the sesame ginger chicken dumpling tonight and it wasn't good. Don't waste your money. We also had to ask to have the chips with our artichoke dip to be returned since it was stale but when they brought out the new chips, it was fine.  Strawberry lemonade is great and they keep bringing you a new cup each time it's half full.  The original barbecue salad with chicken was delicious.

Diverse menu of gourmet pizzas, pastas, salads and sandwiches but too pricey to make it a regular stop. Great tasting food and excellent service. Atmosphere is casual but too loud for a normal conversation.

second time coming here but only now I finally get to leave a review. the place is very clean, the hostesses & waitresses are very friendly & accommodating. my friend, my nephew & I came around noon just before the lunch rush, we promptly got seated in a booth. we ordered a sangria (now they have a sangria flight that you can order-- which I def. need to try!) and fruit punch for our nephew. as for the food, we order a small cheese pizza for the baby which was only $5 something on the kids menu. I ordered the half Chinese chicken salad (decided to try something new since I always order the BBQ chicken salad) and it was very tasty. then we shared a kung-pao spaghetti with no chili & it was amazing.. the waitress even grated a little Parmesan cheese on top which made it even better! the portions were very generous, compared to the kahala's CPK. I think I would rather come to this CPK because of the amazing customer service we received. thank you pearlridge CPK. you guys never disappoint. :)

AWESOME Customer Service! My Aunty's salad took a little longer than usual & after she got it & was eating, the Manager stop by & apologize for the wait & COMPT her salad for the longer wait! We always love the food here!

Their selections of pizzas and pastas are alright. I usually come here for their drinks and desserts. The service I get here sometimes fluctuates from bad to good. So depending on how hungry you are, you might want to consider the line because sometimes in can get  really busy! This place is good for shareables with friends or company of your family!

I know that we came during the dinner rush on a Friday night but service shouldn't be compromised. We were seated in the corner as we wait for our waiter to take our order she came to the table and took our appetizer order but then left. Like okay I get it you don't have time to wait for our complete order. As we sit in the corner watching her hit all her other tables and walk around us was just unacceptable. What finally made her return to our table was when my water was completely gone then we could add our entree. Once our food came it was delicious better then the old menu. I had order mahi mahi tacos and my boyfriend had ordered the garlic cream sauce with chicken and mushroom, we had also gotten "the works" pizza to share since I haven't eaten all day and he just finished work late. Sorry no pictures cause we ate all the food. Overall we will be back but just hoping for better service. 4 stars for the food but no stars for the service so I settled for 3 stars as the middle point. Won't be back for a while maybe during a time where it is t busy that they'd forget us.

I'm giving it one star for the reason that they don't cross shift their wait staff..walked in at 16:30 and its 17:12 STILL waiting to be seated and mind you that there are still people before us who are waiting to be seated!! #fail #getwithit #youthinkthattheywouldgetittogether

This one is much bigger than the one in Kailua. Pizza and salad is one of my go to's and CPK is good for that! They have a wandering array of veghead options, their wild mushroom being a personal fave. Saying that, I wasn't overly impressed with the one I got here. It was kinda dry, didn't seem like alot of attention was put into it. This was my first time in this particular one - it was the wild mushroom pizza at the Kailua location that really grabbed me..  On the other hand their roasted veggie salad was well done. I sat at the bar, an addition their other location lacks. The waitress was really good. It was really hot out and she kept the lemon water flowing.  It was really packed in there that day but surprisingly enough I was able to get a bar spot instantaneously. I was surprised at how big it was inside and they keep the bathrooms clean.

CPK Pearlridge is one of my favorites! I always order the "five cheese and fresh tomato" pizza and the yummy spinach artichoke dip. This particular review is for this past Wednesday 7/27/16. We enjoyed a late dinner with our party of 12. We expected a long wait because it was a fundraiser night. However, our server DALE was wonderful! Dale gets 10 Stars for his superb service! Also, the food was great as always!

Truffle oil on my mushroom pizza? Yes please!! Surprised whenever I go to a CPK and there's no line....consistent, tasty offerings--you know what to expect. Friendly, efficient service and enough to share. Had to have greens today too ( iceberg lettuce does not count as a green!) so ordered the Waldorf--chicken, candied walnuts tossed in a lite vinaigrette. The greens were a little brown and not as fresh as they could have been and the plantation tea was very watered down, otherwise it would have been five for today's lunch.  It's tough being perfect year after year. Still like the wood fired pizza and the ease of coming here. Lots of free parking at Pearlridge and yes still thinking about the hot butter cake with ice cream I could have had.....
Our server was so nice. She had some really good suggestions. Definitely knew her menu and the different tastes. I ended up taking her suggestion and getting it.

California Pizza was awesome. Matilda was our server. She was on point. Her suggestions from the menu was perfect. I was keeping to my healthy meal options and craved a good salad. Matilda suggested the BBQ chicken salad. It was filled with corn, black beans, eggs, cheese, croutons and BBQ Slices. The salad was huge and I ordered the 1/2 salad. The full must be humongous! My only issue is that I'd prefer my meat hot or warm on my salad. The chicken was totally cold.  John had the Mahi Mahi Taco's. He said his meal was Delicious. The restaurant had a good feel, nice music with a warm atmosphere. It was packed for 1pm. The drinks were okay. But I really really enjoyed CPK. We will visit this restaurant again

My friend took me there for lunch to "celebrate" my birthday. Our server was Jerry, the sweetest, most 'on-it" wait-help there is! She predicted everything we could ever think of. Just awesome!!!   We started off with the mushrooms and olive flat pizza; that was so good. She brought us the comp bread with the olive oil & spices...yum,!  She then brought the artichoke/spinach dip with both chips and pita. By then, we were so oinking I couldn't shovel in another bite!  Here came the salad I ordered . Of course by then,  it's time to ask for a take-out box.i began to turn green but Jerry wasn't done yet. Here she comes with a chocolate sundae with a candle sticking out the top! I thoroughly enjoyed the food  the company and I must give much credit to Jerry, who made this "celebration" memorable!

Food is always good.  This place ia busy and usually we have to wait, so don't come hungry.  The strawberry lemonade is refreshing and free refills.  The tequila fettuccine with chicken is tasty.  The Kung Pao spaghetti is good too but once I had it when it was dry. The service is good but can be slow depending on the crowd and kitchen.  The best thing about CPK is that if you don't like what you ordered, they will take it back and you can order something else.

I'm always very impressed with the service I receive at Pearlridge CPK! This evening, Samy was our waitress and I was very pleased from before I even sat down! Even with the large volume of people dining in, the staff here is always extremely pleasant & the food is always delicious!!
The one-star rating is for the poor management of this restaurant. I counted eight open tables, many next to one another. AND, the wait for a party of five was quoted as 20 to 25 minutes. Sad!

Second visit here in a week.  Both visits 5 stars! First visit I got the creamy garlic fettuccine, it tasted so rich and flavorful!  My mister and I usually split our meals, but since he wanted only a salad, I didn't offer him any.  He automatically thought I was going to share, but I didn't offer it was so good.  My mister got the caesar salad, it was a vinegar or oil based dressing, not the creamy type that we are use to, so we didn't like it, and won't order it again.  My son got the BBQ chicken pizza, he liked it and said he would order it again, the pizza was large enough for 2. Second visit I got the pesto cream penne, it was good, not as rich as the creamy garlic fettuccine. I didn't taste much of the pesto though, felt like it needed more flavor, I guess I should have asked for parm cheese, but it was okay.  I took home the leftovers and my mister and devoured it.  I also got the arugula salad which was delicious, what I think really makes it is the shaved parm cheese, and sundried tomatoes.  The arugula is not overly dressed, so you can taste everything els. The girls and I all insisted we were full, but still ordered dessert which all 5 of us split, was the butter cake with ice cream, and the chocolate souffle cake with ice cream.  We ate it like a bunch of starved savages, so much for us claiming to be "full".   Both desserts was so delicious, but I preferred the butter cake.  As for the chocolate souffle, I felt the chocolate syrup or hard bits of chocolate on the cake was quite bitter, the ice cream definitely helps to off set.   Our waiter was so patient with me and my girlfriends! however, when we go out, we usually like to sit and talk and take our time.  Well, CPK is not the place for that, they we so crowded, and of course they would be on a Saturday, at lunch time.  We need to find somewhere that we won't feel rushed, and a place we can actually hear each other. We all really enjoyed our meals, and the service.

Not very happy about the service received this past Saturday August 13, 2016.  Management needs to hire more servers on the busy nights like Fridays & Saturdays or holidays. Why, should you ask?!?  Because those are super busy nights.  I had to ask several different servers repeatedly for chopsticks and for my grand-daughters fruit punch.  Not the servers fault they were so busy which made it impossible for them to give diners a better experience.  Management, staff members require moral support to make your customers dining experience an excellent & enjoyable one. Hire more accountable workers who shows up on busy nights!   Customer at the Pearl Ridge location, party of 8 with 2 children.
Got awesome service and delicious food! I will definitely be back. I appreciate the manager always checking on us.
Love their spinach artichoke dip! Tried the apple crisp w/ a scoop of ice cream. It looks so much better than it tastes. But, it tastes alright. I guess it depends on your preference.

My family and I (party of 14) went to CPK tonight and we had the BEST experience there because of our waiter, Brenden!  Food was great, but it did take a little while for it to come out because the restaurant was busy (understandable). Also one of our meals came out really late so both our server and the manager (Patrick) came out to let us know that they'd be taking the meal off the bill.  The experience and 5 star rating really is more so because of our waiter. He was cracking jokes left and right with our family, always kept our cups full, always checked on us if we were doing ok, and was just all around such a great guy! We're hoping to come back again when he's working because he just made the whole dinner experience awesome!

Came here last night for a belated bday dinner for one of my gfs and me (cause our birthdays are on the same day) and I gotta say service was BOMB.  Brendan I think was his name haha was hilarious omg. He wasn't even our main server!!! I think he was helping our server out cause we ordered a lot of stuff and he just stole the show lol. So nice, funny, and bomb dot com customer service liddat hahah you'll get it once he's your server.  Food was on point as usual. I ordered my usual, chicken piccata no capers add mushrooms, amaze. Except I ordered extra noodles, and it came out with the same amount as a regular order.. but I guess they caught my back on that one cause we all know I don't need the extra carbs lmao!  Omfg and the seasonal strawberry biscuit dessert was IMPECCABLE. I thought I was gonna regret it cause our Lady server said the butter cake is better, but I regret nothing lol, it blew the butter cake out the water. No competition! I hope they end up putting it on the regular menu, cause I'm coming back just for that lol. Thank me later ;)

Had a lunch meeting here on August 28th to plan a baby shower.  My first grandchild and I'm excited!  It was very busy when we got to the restaurant and we waited about 20 minutes to be seated but once seated service was good.  We ordered the split pea/barley soup, bbq chopped chicken salad and a chinese chicken salad.  Our server suggested we try the butternut squash soup and loaded baked potato soup before settling for the one we ordered.  She brought out generous portions of each for us to sample and OMG were they both delicious!  We opted for the butternut squash soup and 'til this day I've been thinking about it LOL and I want to go back just to have it again.   *Menu have changed since I've been here last.  I notice some things were discontinued but I always notice they have have steak and fish dishes.  I'm looking forward to trying those next.

I'm still amazed our wait time was 25 minutes when we arrived during non peak hour between late lunch and snack. Time passed quickly with conversation and high energy throughout the restaurant.   Experienced attentive and impeccable customer service from start to end with our order, beverage refills, toppings, and specials.  Complimentary house bread with olive oil and seasonings tasted amazing!  We noticed full size Original Barbecue Chopped Chicken Salad portion became smaller.  We chomped away and polished off the salad from our plates!  Sicilian pizza on thin crust was on par.  Roasted garlic chicken pizza is a winner.  Even my child loved partaking roasted garlic chicken pizza minus caramelized onions.  We will definitely return for more CPK.

Typical CPK that's in a mall. Not my go to, to go for lunch, but my friend loves CPK so I appeased her request to meet up there.  Our wait wasn't long maybe 5 minutes we had a party before us. Wait for our food was about 30 minutes. I got the shrimp fetti $16, it was good. There's parking all over because its a mall. Air conditioning is good. Full bar. Always busy. Not sure when I'll come back here again.
Th si was the first CPK I've ever been too. I was surprised on how good they were. I got a cob salad. It was a huge portion a day I shared a pepperoni pizza with a friend. It was all very good.

Have you ever gone to a restaurant so many times that when you know you're going there, you already know what to order?  CPK is one of those restaurants for me.  I normally get the Vegetarian Pizza on honey wheat dough or the Garlic Cream Fettuccine with Shrimp (add mushrooms).  A few years ago, it was mentioned to me that CPK has this "Adventure Guarantee" that allows you to try something new on the menu that you've never had.  And if you don't like it, they'll give you what you normally get.   Well, I went on that "adventure" once and tried the Brussel Sprouts Pizza and really did not like it.  So they took it away and made me my normal Veggie Pizza.  Call it "scarred" but it's been years since I took that adventure again.  Until 2 nights ago, a bunch of our friends got together.  This night I didn't feel like eating the Veggie Pizza or the Garlic Fettuccine.   I looked to the table next to me (because that's what you do when you don't know what to order), and peaked at what they had.  I saw a lady's plate that had green pasta in it and my mouth said, "THAT - I want that".  So I asked the waitress what it was and she said it was the Chicken Tequila Pasta, which just so happen, is one of their popular dishes.  Well, I didn't know that because I was stuck on my Veggie Pizza and Garlic Fettuccine all these years.   Did I like it?  Oh yes I did.  I may have added another "favorite" choice of dish when we make the next trek here.   This CPK is quite smaller than the Kahala Mall and somewhat similar than the Ala Moana one.  Located at Pearlridge Shopping Center Downtown, parking has never been a problem during dinner, especially when the mall is closed.  The best parking to get is the one directly across the street above CPK in the covered garage.   I have been to this location many times and never had a bad experience.  The staff is always pleasant and we never feel rushed.  Even though sometimes I wanna rush people out who's talking story while we're the ones waiting for a table to open up. Haha.   Tip: Download the CPK app, and register for their rewards.  For every $100 you spend, you get $5 credit towards your next visit.  You also get a gift on your birthday and notifications of specials.   This is one of my husband and kid's favorite places so I'm definitely a fan.
Great food! Excellent service! Lots of parking space! Had an awesome drinks with my date handsome hubby

This place should get zero stars. It's a Friday night and the girl at the front told us the wait would be 45-50 min my family I which was a party of 4 literally waited over an hour not realizing the time. There were more people walking out of California Pizza Kitchen then there were people going in. So confused how is the wait over 45 min and a lot of people that were done dining in leaving?? My bf walks in and the girl tells him there two families before us, really?? Thankfully my kids were on their phone that came in handy while we waited. The food is ok, not all that to be waiting over 30 min for .
Love this place! Staff members are always friendly on time and always make sure you're taking care of.

After a couple of dismal experiences at CPK Kailua, my hubby and I had just about lost faith in CPK. But after our recent visit to CPK Pearlridge, our faith has been restored and we came to the conclusion that not all CPKs are created equal. This location is top notch in terms of service and quality. The staff is very professional, quick, accurate, and they work as a team. I was trying to find our waiter, but one of the other waiters caught me looking around and asked if I needed something. Awesome. The food comes out piping hot (almost too hot, as my sons were eager to dive in and got frustrated when we told them that they had to wait for the food to cool down!), and they don't skimp on any ingredients here.  My favorite items: - mushroom pepperoni sausage pizza - cheese pizza (CPKids menu) - fusilli w/meat sauce (CPKids menu) - Thai crunch salad - original BBQ chicken chopped salad If you're not a member of the CPK Pizza Dough rewards program, sign up now and start earning points towards discounts and free menu items (including a free dessert during your birthday month!).

The California Pizza Kitchen at Pearlridge definitely deserves 5 stars. Soon as my wife and I walked in, we were instantly seated with no wait. It looked extremely busy but, it turned out that the waitress was constantly attentive and knew to come back at the right time. We ordered Ahi egg rolls, a full Italian chop salad, and a Thai chicken pizza. Everything was promptly served with no issues.

This post for the pearlridge location has nothing to do with the food, which is excellent by the way. My family eats there every month. We've had a server by the name of Deidre twice now and both times she sucked. The 1st time she was not very personable and didn't check on us. The 2nd time we were waiting for our food for 30 mins before we asked another server to check on our order. When it finally came, which someone else brought to us and apologized, she later came around and said, "good things come to those who wait, huh? " She has some nerve!!! So RUDE! at the end of our meal, she then had the nerve to argue with me about my dough rewards points. Management needs to send her for more training immediately. What a liability.

Took the family there today for an early dinner. The service was great until the food came. I can say that the kids pizzas were good. Do not order pasta. It's a pizza place. My wife's pasta was just ok, no flavor. Mine however was the creamy garlic shrimp pasta. One of my top 5's whenever we dine out. It was not creamy by any definition.
