I think they may have left that part out completely. In fact it was so dry I could only get about a quarter of it down with my iced tea, then had to tap out. I mentioned it to the waiter on our way out, not intending to get a discount but just to let him know how bad it was. Pasta was undercook as well. He asked if I wanted a discount I said not really, intending just to never go there again. He came back with the bill and the entree removed from my bill. So based on his customer service I gave two stars. As the story goes, if it a pizza place, stick with the pizza.

My daughter and I went to eat here Saturday afternoon. This wasn't the first time-been here many times. The food was great. We were seated beside by a young couple. Same waitress served them. But i felt like because I was with a little girl, she didn't care as much as the couple beside us. She kept going back to them asking for more bread and if they are ok etc.. Us? Not so much. Never offered us if we want more bread. I even had to ask to refill my water. I bet we paid more than the couple. Not sure if we going back to this place again.

Love PearlRidge and Ala Moana CPK locations! The pearlRidge though has the best service around! They go out of their way to take care of you and make sure everything is perfect!  The food is delicious and brought to you The minute it's ready! If your server is busy they will have someone else bring the food to you. You always get your food hot from the oven literally! Parking is variable depending on the time of day. Parking is shared with PearlRidge shopping center. So parking is first come first serve basis. We usually don't have any problems with parking. I like the fact the parking is free! My suggestion is that you get the California pizza kitchen app because they offer discounts and deals through their app.  All the pizzas and food are delicious! My ultimate favorite is their thai crunch salad. I will actually crave that salad if I don't eat it after a while. They also offer a wide variety of alcoholic and nonalcoholic drinks. One of my favorite seasonal drinks they have right now is the beehive sangria.  They also have a nice selection of beers on draft. They also have another one of my favorite seasonal beers on tap and that is the Sam Adams Oktoberfest beer. So give them a try you will not be disappointed!SYOY!!

About two weeks ago, my two friends and I came in about an hour and a half before closing, which seemed like well enough time for a meal and to leave before the kitchen shut down and the restaurant closed. I don't know if it was how late it was in the day or if this location was just short staffed but we waited 20 minutes for our waitress to take our order and then it took almost an hour to get our food (45 minutes). We were at the restaurant literally til closing and normally I am patient but my party and I were already dead hungry by the time we even stepped foot in CPK. The waitress explained that it took so long because two of my friends orders were the gluten free options but both my friends claimed they had ordered it before and it had never taken this long. No idea what's going on with this CPK but I would definitely not come here again.

Love the BBQ Chicken Chopped salad....love the pizzas....and love the atmosphere.  Even when dining alone I just take a seat at the counter and meet new people or chat with the bar tender.  The food is worth it for sure.  Prices are okay but I try to find gift cards or deals so my purse doesn't take a hit.  I don't go often but when anyone's asks for recommendations this is always an option I throw out.
Unlike other chain restaurants, the staff at this particular CPK is very friendly and customer oriented.

In the heart of Pearlridge shopping center so there is lots of parking available! Pearlridge CPK, I feel is always soooo busy! There is always a wait here.  Our waitress, Keisha was very friendly and nice! Everyone was nice there!  We had the artichoke dip as always for appetizer. I got this special, it's a mushroom pasta! The pasta was curved and it was very interesting! It was also light and good! I loved it! If you love mushroom, you should get this! Something different!

I'm going to shout from the rooftops that I love this place! It's a chain restaurant yes, but they do a great job and it's good value, great service. And they give free meals to veterans on Veterans Day.  We went on Veterans Day and we had such a great meal. Our server, Brendan (or maybe it was Brandon) was one of the best servers I've come across in a while. His recommendations were spot on, great sense of humor, personable, on top of it, etc. etc.  The food was so yummy- from the free bread and olive oil (I was just thinking about this the other day- very few restaurants actually give free bread nowadays), to the drinks (sangria flight, 3 for $10 are you kidding me??!!), sausage, mushroom and pepperoni pizza, BBQ chicken pizza and arugula asparagus salad, and the soufle dessert. I was in a happy lil food coma after.  The wait time was quoted at 55 minutes but they called us after 35. On a day with free food in a location next door to 2 bases!!! Stuart Andersons Cattle Company down the street turned us away at 5:30pm saying they were too full to take walk-ins for the rest of the night!!! So glad we wound up at CPK instead bc it was a fantastic meal. I've never had a bad meal here. The Kahala and Ala Moana locations also do a great job.  Mahalo to CPK for treating our troops and Veterans well. We love you guys!!!

It's been awhile since I've had CPK. Tonight, my fiancé wanted to take me out for dinner. It wasn't that busy, so we were seated right away. Our server gave us our drinks and took our order.  When we got our food, it seemed like their portions got smaller and the plate was bigger. I don't know if it's this store, but the food that I got (Garlic Cream Fettuccine w/ chicken & mushroom) was really, really dry... Minus 1 star for that. it was kind of hard for me to enjoy it because I feel like the pasta wasn't cooked enough as well.  Thankfully, my fiancé shared the Pepperoni Pizza that he got; & the Spinach Artichoke Dip which satisfied me.  Also, when we got our check, I saw that the server highlighted the bottom of the receipt where it showed the tip. I normally tip based on how well the server was and everything, but damn seeing that was like we were forced to give a tip.... LOL

I've been to this CPK many times in the past few years but will write a review based on tonights experience. First of all, they do not do reservations and you dont have to worry about parking since this is located in the mall.  (Of course not including holiday seasons when its packed haha) Tonight we came on Wednesday around 6:45pm. We were quoted a 30 minutes wait and recieved our buzzer which can only reach as far as fun factory which where we killed time for my 2 year old. We were seated around our quoted time and were welcomed. Right away we were offered drinks and sat our party of 8. Tonight was a fundraiser for HPU's graduating nursing class where 20% of the bill went straight to them. Great fundraiser CPK! Got us co-workers out for this occassion. Overall service was excellent as we were constantly checked on and did not feel rushed. Favorite recommendations are the spinach artichoke dip, BBQ chicken salad with avacado, BBQ chicken pizza, salmon, flat breads or their fettuccine pasta. Although we did not get everything I listed tonight, all of our food was fresh, hot and came out within 15 minutes. We also were served bread with its olive oil/pepper/balsamic within 5 minutes of ordering our drinks and entrees.  I also loved how one of the managers came coming to our table and other tables to help out whether it was grabbing things we needed or clearing the table which i love to see as opposed to seeing managers talking story doing nothing at other restaurants. Always a great experience here! *Kids always get a kids cup with lid and straw, kids menu and crayons! (Always a plus!) *Bathrooms are available of course but stalls are a bit tight *They do take out! Can't stay? My family loves ordering take out for CPK.

I used to like CPK but their service and food has been going continuously down hill. Went here today, the complementary bread was as hard as a brick and the rest of our order was medium at best, and that's being generous. Probably wont be back.

Not happy with the service here. Our waiter Christian was extremely pushy and kept rushing us.  He kept telling my party that he was going to give our table away and we were there for  only 20 minutes.  I've never had this kind of service at Ala Moana location.  Definitely recommend Ala Moana over this location

This place is great! Great customer service and the chefs are prompt. One of the best places to eat out here. Restaurant is very clean to include the restrooms. Dishes, silverware are well maintained.

Just okay.  Dang for a salad I would have bought one from somewhere else as a takeout it was almost twenty bucks for what?  Nothing!  Teeny tiny salad that I ate in a few quicky bites.  Tasty but not a meal at all when ordering takeout.

This location is extremely noisy. My opinion is based upon a dozen visits over last 1 years.  Tonight the waiter was challenged to get any thing right, from drink order, appetizer, when to offer the dessert menu. Christian's timing was way off, hurried bordering on rude. Senior waiter came by to make sure we were being serviced. She was very professional. Food is usually prepared to standard and tasty and is worth the value.  I would visit more often if the noise level was tolerable and the entire wait staff was professional.

Worst service I've ever received at a CPK restaurant. Waited 1.5 hours after being told the wait was 30 minutes. Completely brainless server who kept forgetting to bring simple things like bread and water. Walked away to talk to people while taking our order. Got our checks mixed up & forgot to give back our credit cards. Charged us for take out we ordered & didn't give it to us, AND didn't apologize when we came back to pick it up but instead gave us an attitude like it was our fault. The only thing they've got going for them after this visit is the food. Very disappointed.

This was my first experience dining at CPK.  We ordered a couple of appetizers, the Buffalo Cauliflower which was good and really spicy! The Lettuce Wraps with Chicken were tasty as well.  I had ordered a drink, the Mint Icicle, when we ordered our appetizers but did not receive it until a bit after our main course arrived. The drink was good but was a bit too strong alcohol wise.  Maybe they made it stronger because it took so long, I don't know but all I was told from our server when I was still waiting for it was, "I haven't forgotten your drink, our bartender is just backed up."  Our main course was the Hawaiian Pizza which was amazing! Even though there wasn't much sauce, the other toppings made up for the taste. The pineapple was amazingly fresh and tasty!  My husband got the BBQ Chicken Pizza and he had them add on bacon. It was quite good as well, but we would omit the bacon next time because all the other ingredients were so flavorful that you couldn't taste the bacon much.  He also had the Mango Iced Tea which was really good.  Overall, the food was good, service was friendly. Only 4/5 stars because the drink took so long and arrived after our main course was half way consumed.  Would we eat her again? Probably :)

Our evening at CPK started pretty good! Waited a little longer than the time given but we were ok. During the time waiting, it flew by pretty fast as we were talking stories and taking photos.  After we were seated our waitress came by and introduced herself as Rachel. We ordered drinks and appetizers . She brought us waters and shortly after a decent amount of time our appetizers (spinach dip & egg-rolls) were dropped to our table by I'm guessing a food runner who was by the way, really professional & nice (he should have been our server). We asked him if they still offered the complimentary bread (because none was offered to us)? He responded "oh yah sure I'll bring some right over" which he did. We also had to ask for side plates for our appetizers & bread because none were dropped to our table by our server. As we ordered our dinner Rachel recommended the spinach asparagus pasta and to add-on chicken and to have it with garlic cream sauce which is her favorite (didn't mention it cost more, she made it seem as if it was an included option). Appetizers were really good but then our dinner came and that was a different story. I'm guessing it was different cooks from appetizers. Our pasta was super dry as if it was spinach and asparagus just tossed in with noodles, no seasoning, no sauce, maybe a drop of olive oil. As our waitress walked by, I informed her of our pasta having  no sauce and no taste at all. Which she didn't even bother to look at or examine. She responded with offense and said "oh I can order a side of the garlic cream sauce". She left our pasta to get cold on our table while we waited for the sauce. She passed our table a couple times serving other tables. The 3rd time passing she stopped and mentioned "sorry it will be out soon, they're cooking the sauce". Then My husband and I proceeded to show her how dry it was and lifted the pasta with our forks and tablespoons so she could see for herself and at that time I mentioned politely "oh, I think they just forgot to add the sauce" she got offended and said "I did punch it in and ordered it with sauce!". Now at this point by her defensive response, we're thinking, did she forgot to order it but didn't want to admit it because she was the very one who recommended it. We turn to our 6yr old who ordered the mac n cheese which had no sign of cheese on pasta, nor did it have any smudged of cheese on plate or spoon. Our poor kid was having a hard time to eat his mac n cheese (photo attached). He had to take a drink with every bite to wash it down because it was so dry. Finally the garlic cream sauce gets delivered and our spinach asparagus pasta with the added chicken is super cold. The pizza our daughter ordered was okay (it could have used more tomato/pasta sauce). By now we're so over it and so hungry we just ate part of our dinners to fill our hunger, asked for the check and wanted to get out of there. But our 6yr old asked for a kids sundae (which is .99 cents if a kids meal is ordered). While we were waiting for his sundae we asked for boxes. We decided to take food home and fix it (photo attached)! Rachel insisted to box our food. After the 3rd time me saying "no, we'll take the Togo boxes and we'll box them ourselves" she finally said ok. The vibe we received, we didn't trust her wrapping up our food in the back! At some point she mentioned "I'll have the manger remove the cost for the sauce!" I responded "oh, it cost for the sauce?"  Because not once did she mention it would be an added charge. Anyway, we receive our bill and she charged full price for kids sundae when it was supposed to be .99 cents if ordering a kids meal. I bring it to her attention showing her both the kids menu with price & our bill which she totally played dumb and looked at both menu and check back & forth. She then mentions "I wonder why it's like that, I punch it in the same way all the time." Finally at the end she said she was able to figure it out. (Figure what out? I believe she purposely charged the regular amount).  In the past, food and service was always pretty good! Never had a problem before. This experience will prevent us from returning to this location. We'll continue to dine at the Alamoana location and we'll be trying the Kapolei location when we visit the mall.  *Our waitress made our experience awful. I understand the food wasn't as good as in the past but with good genuine service our waitress could have turned everything around quite easy.  *We still left gratuity at 10% after bad service (normally we leave 20% on average to good service).

If I could add more stars I would. I LOVE eating here for my birthday, an anniversary, and just a special occasion. My boyfriend and I usually go here to eat, but since I found out they do take-out, we've always order from here and eat it at home & have a movie night. The Chicken Milanese is a my favorite dish to order as well as the California Club & BBQ Chicken pizza. & I always, always order their red velvet cake which is amazing!!!

I haven't dined at this CPK location by choice, since high school, and tonight reminded me why. If it weren't for a gift card and my laziness to drive to Kahala CPK, I wouldn't have dined here. Hate to start the new year off with a 2-star review but here we go.... Pros: +Seated immediately without reservation. +One of the few eateries open on New Years Day. +Friendly and helpful foodrunner/busser. +Good complimentary bread. +Food arrived promptly. +Ample free parking in the mall's lot. Cons: -Server was virtually nonexistent.  Rather rude, he wasn't paying attention to us. Hardly checked up on us.  We attempted to flag him down for the check and was ignored. Roughly handed us our take out boxes. The service killed the entire experience especially because the food is nothing to write home about! -Loud ambience. -Dirty utensils (good thing my husband ordered pizza). -Had to ask foodrunner/busser for Parmesan, complimentary bread and refill on water. -Pasta noodles were overcooked. -I believe they changed their spinach artichoke dip recipe, I prefer the previous version. -Water was only refilled once on request. 2-stars instead of 1 because the foodrunner/busser was great!  I am sticking with Kahala's CPK.

I don't know why I keep coming back to this location. It's always a disappointment. Took forever to get our food, 3 tables that came after us got there food and one of them had the same thing we ordered. Then once again can't make garlic cream pasta, when it came out barely any sauce, I mean if I wanted to eat pasta with garlic I could've done that at home. Than I ask for more sauce and it was tasteless. Granted they were apologetic and gave us a free dish but I just can't with this location.

I give pearlridge CPK FIVE  . We waited only 15 minutes and was seated right away. As soon as we got seated our waiter came and took our orders. Super fast service. We got our food before we  finished our appetizer. I love eating at CPK and I love it that this place is small but they don't make you wait for two hours like kapolei CPK, plus the workers are super nice, they always come and ask us if we are doing ok. And the food are sooooo good which I love about CPK maybe that's why our friends always gives us CPK gift cards every year. KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK AND I WILL ALWAYS COME TO THIS LOCATION. You have my business.

I've always enjoyed eating at CPK. The food tastes great and service is wonderful. My son normally gets the shrimp scampi and I order the Moroccan Spiced Chicken salad. For appetizers we get the lettuce wrap and spinach and artichoke dip.

The original BBQ pizza with pineapple was on point. Really good food and good staff. Only thing I didn't like was that it had more tables than booths. Not a bad thing per se I just am a booth type of guy.

Come here 2-3x per month. Love this location. People are friendly and servers are attentive. Never been disappointed on the service or the food. We always get the spinach artichoke dip as the appetizer, wild mushroom pizza with truffle oil (a must) with either a cobb salad or chinese chicken salad (yummers!) and the chocolate souffle for dessert (onolicious!). Just FYI....this place can get pretty busy and the wait over 1hr long, so come early (we come about 430pm).

Well it started off good party of 15 was told 30 to 45 min got a table quicker then that . and from there it went down hill we got one refill that's it my family eat desert first so we put the order in and told them we want it first that didnt come out till or food came out noodles was hard and my nefew barley had any it was my first time and im going to try again another location

This is the first time I have been to this particular location, and I was surprised that for a Saturday night that CPK was not slammed. The wait was not long, then again we had reservations. We started off with an appetizer for the keiki's and then ordered two pizzas. I ordered a salad because I am so boring like that. The kiddos loved the tossed crusted pepperoni pizza and were fighting over the last piece. Of course out of them all the smallest managed to charm his way into getting it. My eldest celebrated his birthday low-key as he did not want the birthday song to be sung by the staff, but rather we did it at the table after he received his ice cream. We loved the service at this location because they were very attentive. We will be coming back!

It was pretty crowded but luckily didn't have to wait too long. This location is smaller than all other CPK locations so you feel boxed in and claustrophobic.  I ordered the garlic fettuccine Alfredo with chicken and mushrooms. I was surprised at the small portion! Went to other CPK locations and the portion was much more, so I don't understand why this location gave me less.  Also, we told our server to box up our left over pizza and salad but she did not include the salad! We found out the next morning when my wife wanted to eat her leftover salad and found out it wasn't there. Very disappointed and will not be returning to this location. Go to Ala Moana or Kahala instead; much better service and food. UPDATE: found the salad, was on the very bottom of the package!

We visited CPK on an early Friday evening arriving shortly before 5 pm. We beat the crowd like an old couple. This location typically gets busy during dinner hours and there was a line outside by the time we left.  The servers and hostesses here are friendly and pleasant, but service is mediocre. We waited for quite a bit before a waiter came to check on us. We ordered water, appetizers and main dishes. When our appetizers came out, the server mentioned - oh I beat out the drinks. Our water came about 15 minutes later when the waiter stopped by and realized he had forgotten. While we understand that staff has specific roles - we left perplexed by the team work. Since the appetizer server noticed, she could have reminded the waiter or helped him out. Or maybe the waiter who seemed to have tables at opposite ends of the restaurant could have asked for help too.  The food here is good. I really enjoyed the farmers soup (butternut squash, vegetables, cream) which is new to the menu. And the BBQ chicken pizza is always consistently tasty.

One of my faves to eat at. I can't wait for the Mililani Town Ctr one to open. It's a good thing the food is good because it made up for the not so great service. I'm not sure if the waitress was having a bad day or personal problems, but she found it difficult to crack a smile. I hope her evening & the following day was better.

Came to have a nice vegetarian meal of mashed pea soup and spinach with artichoke dip. Ended up fighting off fruit flies during the entire meal. We thought it was our table so we moved to another table, this however did not help. I did notice the uncovered sliced lemons in the room by the table we were initially sitting at. This made our water with lemon in it quite unappealing. We did bring this to the waitresses attention. The manager tried to blame it on the rain, but I believe it had something more to do with the food storage. I try not to eat at this location very often because of many other difficulties. I think this may be the final straw. It may be time for the health department to check this location out. I would not like to see people getting sick because of pure laziness.

My husband and I had an awesome night that ended here. The pizza was definitely only a two person pizza if you don't start with an appetizer. However, we got the Buffalo cauliflower (fried is how it comes) with blue cheese crumbles and some of their awesome bread to start.      The service was really good. Everyone we came into contact with was really professional and helpful. They refilled our drinks a couple times without any prompting- they just magically knew we needed more water after putting multiple pieces of flaming cauliflower into our bellies. I'm not saying the cauliflower was spiced, but on a scale of 1 to violence, it made me drink some extra water. Oh, and I'm indigenous to those from the New England side of the US... so we don't really celebrate hotness like my homies out here. I love it.       The pizza we got was the oven roasted garlic chicken and onions. It was great. I would only change my order to well done because I like crispy pizza myself. Otherwise it was great- just kind of smaller.    We got a beer- and that was my issue. I wish they had a better tap selection. There's nothing more disappointing than a cold glass with a bottled beer when you're at a pizza joint with a full bar. However, do t let my love for Kona beer stray your attendance here- they're pretty awesome on all fronts!

I LOVE the Chicken Picatta! It's so flavorful and delicious! 9 out of 10 people I show this dish to absolutely fall in love and instantly becomes their new favorite.  The egg rolls are great, the Chinese Chicken salad is amazing, the Spinach Arichoke dip is yum (well you can't really mess that up lol).  All the pizzas I've tried here are awesome too.  The butter cake dessert is simply delish too.  I also like that they have a rewards card so you can get nice discounts every so often.

I always enjoy coming to CPK. The service is always great and the food is always onolicious. A few weeks ago I jumped on the new year bandwagon and decided it was time to shed a few pounds from the holidays. I started a healthy eating regimen with lots of exercise...yadda yadda yadda. Fast forward to my date at CPK. I had fallen asleep for a "quick nap" but didn't wake up til 9! I started panicking because I was so hungry and was way too lazy to prep something. My husband and I jumped into the car and drove around...I prayed CPK would sit us even though they were closing in half an hour. They did! Yes! The service was great! We weren't rushed like we were ruining their lives for coming in so late. It was actually a bit crowded which surprised me. I was just so grateful they didn't turn us away because they were closing soon.  I had the BBQ chicken chopped salad. Don't get on my case about calories and whatnot this was considered a treat for myself. I added the avocados to my salad as well. It was delicious! The amount of avocados you get is so generous even for just the half portion.  This was my first time getting a salad. I used to look at people awkwardly for getting a salad when they could choose the delicious pizza or pasta. My usual is the Kung Pao spaghetti and spinach and artichoke dip which is also amazing. But like I said, I had to be somewhat behaved right!  Either way I left completely full with a satisfied belly. I'd definitely get the salad again! Or get the pasta. Who knows. Options are always good.

This was a while ago but I went out to eat with my 2 friends because I usually love CPK. However, since this one visit I haven't gone back. Our server was Rachel and I ordered the raspberry iced tea and it tasted a little different so she offered me water and I said yes. However, all 3 of us saw her ROLL her eyes before she even turned. Not only that, she took away my drink and still charged me for it. Like if she was going to charge me for the iced tea I still would have drank it. Also, when I ordered the garlic cream fettuccine alfredo, I politely asked her for no cilantro (I think) and she told me, in a clearly irritated tone, "We don't put cilantro, do you mean parsley" (Unless I have it confused and it's the other way around, I tend to mix them up a lot- not much of a cook) and by this time I was just getting a really bad anxiety attack and I just wanted to go home. Rachel is a complete nightmare, and both of my friends saw it too. I was just going to leave no tip but my friend left a penny, apparently that's worse. I called to complain later and Eva was nice enough to send me a $15 gift card. I appreciate that, but I went to another location to use it. Eva said on the phone that a lot of people complain about Rachel. I'm not surprised. Don't know why she hasn't gotten fired yet if she hates her job that much. I work in food service too and I would definitely be fired if I acted that way. This left a bad taste in my mouth. I left angry and won't be coming back any time soon. Reading other reviews with Rachel as their server, I'm shocked to see that she stills works there.

I like going to CPK for lunch meetings during the week to avoid the crowd! Visited the other day after 1pm and it was nice and quiet. :) I normally go for the lettuce wraps, and we also tried one of the newer items on the menu, ahi spring rolls. It looked okay, but sadly it was filled mostly with avocado and the wrapper was way too thick. The chicken & shrimp lettuce wraps was tasty as usual, and it was a huge portion! I swear they serve way more when you dine-in versus take-out. Anyways, it was perfect for lunch without the extra carbs. Our server was awesome, he made sure we had everything we needed. The one thing that turned me off was the amount of gnats flying around in the restaurant! We had to constantly shoo them away, which got more and more annoying as time went by. The restroom was worse! I was attacked by a cloud of gnats while washing my hands lol ewwww so gross! Overall I'm sure I'll be back again in a few months but they should close the front door to prevent from any nasty critters from getting in! I don't even want to think about bugs in any open kitchen either....

Our food was ok minus the cold spinach dip. But our server Nora was great. I do however have a big problem with these people that order take out by our table. I mean they should have just sat down with us. You should have the phone order people wait outside and not hover over people's tables. I felt super crowded and couldn't have a comfortable conversation. I had to move seats and sit next to the person that I came with. I came to have dinner facing the person I came with rather than stare out at people standing in the way. Or hover over me while I eat.

Although this is probably the smallest CPK on the island, I still think this CPK has the best service. I've never had to wait no longer than 20 min for food. At Kapolei, Ala Moana, & Kailua CPK they can take up to an hour & a half & the employees aren't as polite.

I love this CPK even though the wait is quite awhile when it's busy but if you go at the right time you get sat right away. We had a guy server i believe his name was Christian and he seemed to be distracted most of the time and always in a hurry. We sat next to the registers and the table next to us went to pay and give him there check but what my boyfriend and I heard next just sounded so rude. We both work at a restaurant and we know how you should talk to customers so when this couple gave him the check there change was about $30 dollars and instead of giving it back immediately he asked "oh do you need your change" and idk but if i were them that would be an awkward question for a server to ask me and they both just looked at each other and just let him have it. That is rude to me and not acceptable.

I really like California Pizza Kitchen. I think the flavors are much more complex than the name lets on. Me and my husband had the white corn guacamole, the spicy chipotle chicken pizza, and the Gorgonzola pear pizza. The white corn guacamole was very small, but it was tasty. The chipotle pizza was good as well, but the Gorgonzola pear pizza was better in theory than in execution. The pear slices were a little thick and still very chewy. The service was good overall.

In fear of getting spit in my food, since we just got seated...I will leave this here for now... While we were in the waiting area waiting for our table...we had plenty of time to observe the happenings around us.  What is straight ahead of us, is the bar.  We were able to watch the bartender in front of us, mixing the drinks.  My mom caught her putting strawberries and limes into 2 mixed drinks...with her bare fingers.  Yuck.  Off those drinks went to the lucky table.  She scratched her head a couple of times, then proceeded to make the next drink.  Again, dropped a couple lemons (and whatever germs were in her hair) into someones drink with her bare unwashed ungloved fingers.  This is absolutely disgusting!  We watched this go on and on, the entire time we were sitting there.  Mind you, there were tongs right in front of her.  How gross and a complete disregard for cleanliness!  This must be allowed by health inspectors?!  Her name is Christine...and while I'm extremely tempted to take her picture while in action, I'll save her the public embarrassment and hopefully management will intervene here.  If I should see this happen next time we come, I will not hesitate to post the picture. Watch your food/drink people...

Ordering online became more of a bother than a convenience.  It had been my experience in the past that their system does have glitches.  For example, although you have a confirmation that your order has been placed, the restaurant may not have received the electronic order.  So, it's always a good idea to call and confirm that they halved received your order.  Well, I did just that  and was met with allot of phone shuffling.  I spoke to three different people during this 12 minute phone call.  Just to confirm if they received my electronic order!  I don't know what was going on at the restaurant at that time but I do think this was an excessive amount of time to confirm whether an order was received or not. On the upside, the food, although pricey was tasty.

Ate here yesterday and now my family and I are recovering from severe food poisoning. We are sure we contracted food poisoning from CPK because this is the only place we ate where we all shared meals. We began to feel sick about 3 hours after eating there. Sometimes eating at home is just best. Often times there just is no way to tell when food has been contaminated with any pathogen, in our case even the taste/ texture of our meals were within the norm.

TOP NOTCH service!!  I was super impressed by the general manager, Thomas.  He walks around the restaurant ensuring that all patrons are happy and that the food is up-to-par.  I had ordered the Jamaican Jer Chicken Pizza and it came out a bit overdone especially on the edges.  I noticed but dismissed it and started to eat it.  Thomas passed by and took on look at my pizza and said "That looks overcooked.  I want your pizza to taste the way it is meant to taste."  How nice.  I have never had that happen.  Normally, food is only re-done if the customer requests.  Definitely coming back here!!!

The worst takeout food ever! I ordered the adult Mac and Cheese through Bitesquad and got pasta with barely there cheese! I don't even think it's cheese! It's Alfredo sauce!! When I first opened the box, the noodles and sauce weren't even mixed so I thought it was just cooked noodles! Spent $13 for this crappy meal! So angry!! Never ordering from them again!

I was writing this review while I was waiting for a table. I know eating here on a Friday isn't the best night to eat out, but we were here on 05.03.17, girl's day.  So far docking one star, here's my reason.. There were 2 workers in the front, a male and a female, I walked in with no greeting, no smile. I waited as they finished up whatever they were doing. As I was waiting another lady came to the podium and told them how many were in her party and they took down her information first. Usually it's common sense, if you walk in and see someone waiting,  you'd ask the person if they checked in. But she didn't. I didn't make a big deal out of it because I was with the kids. After the lady left, I went right where she was, and those two acted as if I wasn't there. I mean I was right in front of them looking at them. As I was waiting, they were talking amongst themselves, and then the girl left!! After she left the guy was writing something down. I kept looking at him, with no response. Finally, a manager had to come and she took down my info. She was nice, but it didn't make up for what happened in the beginning when I first walked in.  We waited for 30-40 minutes before getting a table. The kids were restless and I couldn't wait to eat. The waitress that we had was good, but I forget her name. We ordered avocado egg rolls, the kids got mac and cheese and pasta with Alfredo sauce, I got a salad and my parents got pizza and pasta (I forget the names of the dishes). The kids' food was OK. Didn't seem like it had much flavor, there was barely any sauce on it.  Service could use a little more training. First impressions are important..

Excellent food, though a little loud in the restaurant. It was my first time there and I ordered the chicken sesame and ginger dumplings and the kung pao chicken spaghetti, both of which were very tasty and better than I expected. The raspberry lemonade was tart and sweet - just perfect. I can't wait to come back and try more of their dishes and appetizers and hopefully next time I'll have room for dessert! Expect a long wait...we had to wait 35 minutes on a Sunday night.

Enjoyed the Thai salad. Haven't been here in a long time. Interesting to find my points were still valid. $10 off on $40 on my CPK app. Gave me Olive oil and baslimic vinegar. Guess they stopped the butter.  Thai salad was better than I remembered it. Wanted to ask for more dressing. But just as well. It was light and had plenty flavor. They were very attentive, and courteous for me coming in 40 minutes before closing. Restaurant still busy, so I decided to stay instead of To-Go. I wasn't even rushed. It was after closing when I left. And still had customers. Good job guys! Hats off to you.

Ordered take out a few months ago from this location.  The service was good and the food was good but a bit on the pricey side.  I ordered a BBQ chicken pizza, California club pizza, Sicilian pizza, and Bianco flatbread which costed $58.81.

Located in Aiea, HI, this franchise location suits anybodys food needs or cravings, there eloquently spacious restaurant accomadates everyone there. Whether its you and your spouse on a honeymoon or with your family wanting to find a place to eat nearby without driving away from the Mall, California Pizza Kitchen has what everyone looks for, Great Pizzas, Amazing steak plates and Delicious pasta dishes as well. I do recommend their Pasta dishes because they are famous for making such delicious succulent pasta.  One thing to keep in mind is during dinner hours from 5:00 to closing it gets really busy and packed. I recommend coming either an hour early or so to reserve a table. That way you can walk around the mall and don't have to worry about waiting in line for over 30 minutes (sometimes over an hour) just to get a table.

If you love a good jambalaya with a slight kick definitely recommend it. My son had the garlic chicken and it Tate's like garlic chicken lol simple as that. My 7 year old had the pepperoni pizza on the kids menu and loved it. She said she liked it because the crust was soft and didn't hurt her teeth and she said it had a little kick  to it. (We like spice in my household). My 9 yr old and the kids barbecue pizza and liked it. I say if you love barbecue and are a cheese head give it a try. She also had the biggest lol of shock when she got her kids sundae it was huge. We all suck a bite and the sundae was awesome. Our waiter had a ton of tables but was still quick and gave us lots of attention. Not your average way to spend a Sunday Easter but will be back again!

Last second decision to dine in the area and had a great meal with out of town friends. The food at CPK is always consistent, well-prepared and tasty, and this time, we had the pleasure of server Elizabeth. Pleasant and attentive as soon as we were seated, she took great care of us throughout the evening, from drink orders to food orders to dessert, etc. By the way, the chicken picatta, seafood tacos and cedar plank salmon were excellent. Thank you CPK and Elizabeth for a most pleasant dining experience!

2017.04.23 - Adventures with CPK.  I already had a silly experience with CPK Kapolei.  Let's see if "Corporate" has cleaned up there act with the double charge of a customer bill.  I should know if I have been charged more than $100 for a $70 tab.  No CPK corporate, if it is a pending charge on my account, I do not have access to those funds, yes it is a over charge on my bill.  It is now 708pm.  It's a 1 Star until I can confirm the correct transactions have taken place.  The server was great and this review does not include there service. 2017.04.29 - Ok CPK PearlRidge.  So far so good.  I still only see one charge on my account though it looks like it's short the servers tip.  Not sure how that is happening.  I hope this doesn't mean it was not processed due to my last CPK review.  I will give a better rating for not inconveniencing me as the customer.  Though I sure hope you are taking care of you team.  The service was great by the way.  Server was excellent.
Good food..They served bread for free. I had my Santa Fe bowl and  cucumber revived for drinks, i.like it bec. its refreshing .

Horrible service from our server. Families seated after us were done with their dinner (one family left) and we still didnt get ours. Asked to speak with the manager who said he would check on our food and immediately our waitress brought out our food. I think she forgot about us! We were very upset and asked for a box and bill as we wanted to leave. She brought the boxes and I gave the manager my credit card.  He knew I was upset and was nice enough to comp our food.  I told him I was not looking for him to comp our bill,  but he insisted.  I'm giving them 3 stars because he was nice to comp our bill, however I would give our server one star for service.
Shared the Thai crunch half salad and roasted garlic chicken pizza on wheat.  It all tasted good and server was attentive.
Yummy food    good steak.had  wild mushrooms  strozzapreti    If like mushrooms it's a must have!

This review could have easily been a 2-3 star review but luckily the server we had today saved it for CPK Pearlridge.  We went on a busy Saturday afternoon and was told the wait would be 30 minutes. Luckily, we didn't even wait that long and was seated 20 minutes in, yay! Once we were seated we had to wait about 10 minutes before our server came. She must have saw my hangry face because she immediately apologized for the wait and went ahead and took our drink order and our food order. I lightened up immediately because before she came to our table, I noticed her zone was opposite side of the restaurant AND she had a table of 8 year old kids behind us she was serving. As a server, serving kids isn't too fun because most of the time (especially at 8-17 years old) they don't tip or tip very well. Nonetheless as I was watching her, she was so pleasant and despite their age, she served them as she would any regular customer if not better. I was floored.  I ordered the usual Wild Mushroom with White Truffle Oil (the best thing in the world) and my boyfriend had the chicken fettuccini alfredo pasta. Our server was awesome and made sure we had water and drinks and also followed up on our food. She had some extra ground to cover but that never stopped her and I appreciated her positive attitude and friendliness. It's not always the easiest thing to maintain but she did it well. I only wish I got her name, I tried to read her nametag but it was a long Hawaiian name that started with a K. Kanoe- Maybe? Or kehau? Either way many people could learn from her. She completely made sure we left CPK with a better attitude and mood than from when we first came in. We will definitely continue to come to this location because of her and hopefully we always have her as our server.

Today is another perfect Sunday. Having been newly blessed from Sunday mass bringing me closer to enlightenment and forgiveness to anyone who crosses me, my gal and I set off to find food to compliment the afternoon. We decided on a light lunch of salad from California Pizza Kitchen at Mililani, but by the time we finalized the decision to eat at CPK, we were around the Pearl Ridge area. On a typical day, in a typical restaurant, with a typical party of two, the host or in our case the manager--usually a person who dresses differently from the standard uniform of the establishment--seats the party at a table, past other large empty tables, past​ the bar and the kitchen, next to an fire exit and a family of five or more, whose table is part of the family's table arrangement. However, I am not the typical party and our host did not ask if the location was acceptable. Once seeing where the table was, I demanded another location where the attention of service I required can be furnished. The host dared inquire what was wrong and I politely requested a venue within the main dining hall. In doing so, he seated us next to a window at a table perfect for a party of two (about 2.5 ft by 3.5 ft). By this time, I have been scorned and I was compelled by the spirit of vengeance. The following events could have been worse had it not been for my girlfriend's presence and insistance of accepting the situation. Ha! The meal started off with a Sangria honey concoction, which I sent back because the wine was unrefreshingly gross. I replaced it with some sort of mint mojito--it was forgettable. One full size Chinese Chicken Salad, Lemon Grass Chicken whose sauce tasted the same as Panda's Tofu and Eggplant, and a sausage pepperoni pizza--another forgettable paper thin crust pizza. By the time the salad plate came to our table, the realestate all were diminished. The manager eventually made his way to our table and inquired about our experience so far. I politely explained we no longer have table room for the other dishes we ordered. He then frantically started looking for a larger replacement table for fear of cancelled orders. We ended up moving to that table in the midst of eating our chicken salad with my drink in hand! By the time the meal was finished and the bill came and went, my satisfaction of a larger table located in the middle of the room was fulfilled. I just wish the meal was memorable and exceptional. Perhaps in this occasion, it was CPK that had it's final laugh; me deviating from my original plan of just a Chinese Chicken salad.
the salmon was ymmmmmmmy..... of course the pizza is number one here but the salmon is light if you are not that hungry and delicious.

First, it took about an hour to get our food after we had put our order in. During that time our server only came by the table once to see if we need anything or to reassure us that our food was on the way. Once we got the food it tasted very well. After we finished eating it took about another 15 minutes to get a box for the food and our check. Then we noticed the server was spending most of her time at another table. Poor service, decent food.

Dinner with the Ohana at the Pearl Ridge location, we arrived around.. 6ish... waited 25 mins, decided to walk around the mall to burn some calories, and to check out thee latest and greatest, the Mall was very dead that night, Tuesday Night, therefore it was pleasantly great knowing that I could focus on the task at hand verses who bump into me while they are on their phone? Anyways... we were seated sooner then expected, our waiter was a very handsome young gentlemen- So Mom and Dad got the Sandwich and Soup Meal Bf-got the Fish Tacos  Yours truly-got the GF Santa Fe Salad   Shared-Mushroom Pizza  The AC was very cold and forced me to shiver the whole dinner moment, over all the meal was great, the service was great.

We ordered delivery with Bite Squad and our estimated time for delivery was 50 min. We got our food in 1/2hr! We had their Caesar salad which was nothing to rave about due to a lot of wilted lettuce, mushroom pepperoni and sausage pizza which was also just ok, and their fettuccini garlic cream plus added shrimp which was delicious. The 5 star rating was for their awesome delivery time!

I like CPK and enjoy eating at there for the most of time. This pearlidge cpk is always crowded and little old inside. But often go there because that is the closest from home. Last night was horrible. I got such a bad service, very slow. It feels great if your server meet my need and know what to do next. Asian vetnamie female server was all over the place. I asked for my drink 4times, took while to have her bring. The server just kept forgetting thing and go on to next table to take others guest. I only order salada for main and it also took while to bring up. I had to ask if my older is coming. She forgot all the time and had to ask same thing over and over..  i am very patience myself but just couldn't stand her slow service. She has no Service. How could you expect much tip with this bad service... There are very good server that always watch over guest and go above beyond. But not with her, sorry to say it but  it was just  frustrating dining experience unfortunately.

Our server was very quick and attentive, which was impressive considering she had at least 4-5 other tables and 3 larger parties in her section. My mom ordered the spinach artichoke dip as she was walking to the table and our server brought out the appetizer within a few minutes. She was on top of her game... Constantly refilling our waters and sodas and checking on us every so often.  It's really refreshing how CPK has been changing their menu frequently recently -- it's always good to try new things! They added bowls to their menu, so my mom tried the bahn mi bowl. I had a bite and it was very refreshing! I had the chicken tequila fettuccine, and it was great as always. I love how they use spinach fettuccine instead of the regular pasta.  It can be a bit pricey but the portions are huge so I always have leftovers after dining here. Basically paying for two meals!

I always enjoy coming to this restaurant.. they are fast and friendly.. we had never had any issues..  I love their mushrooms, spinach flat bread and chicken piccata.. of course my wine..  oh.. and the bread
David was our server.  He was very attentive to our table and others in his section.  He knew when to give me a refill on my mango tea without me telling him.  He made our dining experience great.

Hands down I can't stand this place! If only I didn't have to put a star down at all. I've been to this location twice and have always been disappointed with service and quality of food. Too salty or not enough taste but because its conveniently located in Pearlridge then I figured, "ahh what the hell".  Service...ugh nothing to say besides the fact that their staff needs to step it up a notch and a half if they will be working in a high volume customer environment.  Now onto today's rant. So we were given a gift card for $50 to attend "THAT PLACE" again so, "what the hell", right? But this time we ordered online take out. Now what's pictured on their website verses what's actually given is a total monstrosity to say the least. I had ordered the seared ahi which is presented in the picture to be breaded and fried slightly with bak choy and some rice thing. Boy, when I say I didn't even recognize what was in front of me is quite the understatement. I live 5 mins away from this establishment so there is no excuse for why it looked like this. And the taste, UGH! I refused to take a second bite. I want my money back and I would highly recommend never to eat at this establishment!!!
Our server, Joey, was awesome!!!!  Service was consistent considering we had a party of 14.  Next time you come in, ask for Joey!

I would like to take a moment to recognize two young ladies in particular that have a thankless job and smile and teamwork with each other the whole way through it. I can't help but be proud of them because I watch how hard they work to make sure all the orders are accurate package correctly build for correctly with a smile on their face and always asking if there's anything else they can do. Last night Monday Kamehameha day, at about 7:30 p.m. the young lady it's signed to the to go station and the young lady in the chef outfit work together as a team beautifully when they got slammed. I brought it to the attention of the Caucasian manager and he beamed with pride and acknowledged to me that they are superstars. Not too many superstars in the world anymore for the food and beverage business. I highly recommend that your company take a few minutes to acknowledge the amazing guest satisfaction that they provide with humility! Congratulations girls!!!!

My daughter and I stopped by for a late lunch since we were in the area. Since it was after the lunch rush, we were seated immediately to a small table. After a few minutes, our waitress came by and took our drink orders. We got the passion fruit mango tea. We then proceeded to order the avocado club rolls and the chicken piccata.  Our drinks were brought in a few minutes, but we did have to wait awhile for the food. In the meantime, I was looking around at the restaurant and noticed it was very dirty. There was paper and other bits of trash all over the carpet.  Someone then came by and tried to drop off a spinach and artichoke appetizer which wasn't even ours. I told her we did not order this, so they took it away. Five minutes later a different server came by again with a spinach and artichoke appetizer trying to drop it off to our table. I told her again this is not what we ordered as our appetizer. The staff seemed very disorganized, not even knowing what each of the customers ordered and who to bring the food to!  Our avocado club rolls were brought out and were quite tasty. My daughter really enjoyed them. The chicken piccata was OK needed more seasoning and tasted on the bland side. While we were trying to enjoy our lunch, one of the employees noticed that the floor was filthy and brought out a vacuum cleaner and was vacuuming while customers were trying to enjoy their meal!!  Overall, food was decent but staff was disorganized and service poor and the restaurant looked unclean. The Kahala mall location is better, cleaner with better service.

Brought some moms here for dinner tonight-- our monthly "Mom's Night".  The food was great.  This was some of their first time, and they loved it!  I always get the lettuce wraps, but pretty much everything here is good. But I'd probably say that the most impressive thing about tonight was our server, Joey.  There were a total of 14 of us; some trickled in later than the rest, but he managed to keep all of us happy.  I definitely recommend asking for him!

So, my boyfriend and I are regulars here. Whenever I get to chose a place to eat, everyone knows I'll always say cpk.. tonight tho, I'm truly disappointed and this experience just changed everything I thought I knew about this place... We walked in about half an hour ago, i would say this is one of the slowest I've ever seen this particular location. Anyway, got seated and was ready to order because duhhhhh were regulars here....  our server tonight is Danielle, she seems new. She took our drink orders as well as our food order. Longer wait than usual for water, but I get it she's probably new and figuring out a system.  Soooo, we ordered our usual garlic cream fettuccini with chicken, and his with shrimp and mushroom.. around a 20 minute wait and the food comes out, as soon as we take the first bites we both notice something is missing the sauce is bland and the noodles are strangely cardboardish (rubbery, undercooked) so we wait for the waitress to come back and kindly let her know that the pasta is not to standard, they are missing a main ingredient GARLIC... so she goes back to the kitchen to get us more sauce?! Welllllp she comes out with "sauce" basically straight garlic literally chopped up garlic!!!!  We have now ruined our pasta by adding the sauce before tasting it! I'm just in awe of this whole situation, so I kindly ask her to just make new ones!!!  Well here we are, just waiting for the new pasta to come out and guess what? They forgot the mushrooms!!! You'd think that after all this mess about the pasta they wouldn't forget to get it right, right????  We are currently waiting for them to bring out the side of mushrooms so we can continue to eat, but we're already full from eating and stopping so the food settled, and of course the spinach and artichoke dip.... sighhhh I'm so bummed because I know this will probably be the last time my boyfriend will ever bring me here.... The only reason for the 3 stars is because I know our waitress is trying, I know the food mess ups aren't her fault, and the manager sam tonight did a good job in following up with us, he personally delivered the pasta and made sure the sauce was right, and when he found out about the mushrooms he came back and apologized and offered to take care of the bill, which was good because it softened the situation. He didn't want us to pay for a meal we didn't enjoy and we couldn't agree more.... so big ups to the manager tonight he handled the situation very well, and showed that he really cares about his customers and the service...  Overall, this is one of my favorite spots to eat, and I'm sure my boyfriend will never bring me back here, but I will probably be back with my family and friends because when they're on top of things the food is amazing as well as the drinks... I wouldn't say not to go here because at times they do get it all right, but there are times like these as well.... may the odds be ever in your favor

Yummy yummy! CPK is walking distance from work. So convenient! Usually if we have new hires, we like to take them here and get to know them. I love the summer time, especially since they have the Strawberry Shortcake.  Here's a few I get on a regular basis:  Chinese Chicken Salad - very refreshing! If it's just yourself eating, I suggest the half size, the full is huge! But that could just be me.  Spinach Artichoke Dip - my favorite! Definitely get as an appetizer to share with the table.  Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pizza - this has a little kick, but is very flavorful! Usually can't finish this myself, but it's okay you can always have leftovers.  Lettuce Wrap (w/ Chicken) - also refreshing if you're not up for a salad. The sauce is really good, put some on your wrap.  Strawberry Shortcake (w/ Ice Cream) - its summer... so it's in season!! GET IT BEFORE ITS GONE! Pretty much a biscuit with strawberries and yummy cold ice cream.  Tuna Egg Roll (only in Hawaii, shown in photo) - OMG IF LOVE TUNA, try this one! It has tuna, avocado, and a crispy outside. This is good for an appetizer or a meal!  Try it out!!
Pasta is always!!! Always not cook we gave it another try today and still disappointed!!!!!

I rarely come here with high expectations based on years of customer experience. The wait time is usually long--especially when attempting to be seated during their peak times (lunch & dinner). Yet, even if seated early, service is consistently hit-or-miss as well.  However, I can say that my experience today seems to show signs of CPK upping their customer service experience game. We arrived at 1:30pm on a busy Saturday and was told by the friendly hostess that the wait time would be 10-15 minutes. Happily, we were sat at the 7 minute mark. We were instantly greeted by our server and our dining experience began. Drink and appetizer orders were put in and bread and waters were brought out instantly. I was impressed by the high visibility of their floor manager--she was carrying out plates to the tables and checking on customers as well. Our food arrived at a good pace: our always-a-guarantee go-to Shrimp & Chicken lettuce wraps arrived with our kids' favorite--Artichoke Dip. During the time it took for us to enjoy it, our plates were cleared to make room for our main meals; nothing felt hurried.  I ordered the newly-added item Seared Ahi Chop Salad: WINNING! Gluten-free AND healthy AND delicious!  I'd highly recommend this. My daughter ordered a margharita pizza and the manager profusely apologized, explaining that the pizza was not up to their standard and thus, would drop the pizza with us and make another one that would be up to par. It was awesome to have the manager immediately acknowledge this shortfall and have a solution tied to it. Much appreciated!! In the end, our experience was great. We ended our meal with two desserts: seasonal Strawberry Shortcake & Flourless cake. Yum!!

Kungpao chicken is deliciously tasty here. One of my all time favorite dishes. I enjoy the amount of spice flavor. So glad they have delivery service through "Aloha Delivery". Living in a Condo with limited parking isn't always easy to get out.

Service was exceptional, although we were seated in the back of the restaurant where there was a great view of the trash piled up outside. Our server was great and attentive. She always made sure our water was filled and checked occasionally if we needed anything else. The food was great to boot.

Today service was exceptionally good. Our servers name was Brenden and he is one of the most fun and personable servers I've ever had. He made us feel very comfortable and kept us laughing the whole time we were there. You really can't go wrong with the food here. It's always a struggle to choose our meals because everything tastes so yummy. Today we decided on a lighter lunch so we got the buffalo cauliflower small plate (a bit too strong for my liking), half a Cobb salad, shrimp and chicken lettuce wraps and ahi spring rolls. We of course topped it off with the famous butter cake and vanilla ice cream. We were very happy with our fill of good food and great service.  Heads up: They don't take reservations so the wait can be pretty long on the weekends and dinner time. We usually try to come for a early or late lunch.

Love coming here monthly to spend my rewards I have in my account, playing the CPK game was worth it because I get free pizza every month for a year, how awesome is that. Spent this month can't wait for next month lol and yes I always spend more then the amount in the account because they food is soo good so many options to choose from.

I came in on a Sunday during the day, my server/bartender was Christie and she was very sweet and quick, she took care of me very well, the manager even came and checked to make sure I was doing well and the food was delicious. Thank you for the great service!

2.5  -Located in pearlridge shopping center.  -Upon entering this location usually has a line or wait, especially near 5-6 pm. I saw some tables open but maybe the servers/cooks were behind and needed to catch up which is understandable. So the wait was about 10-15 mins or so which isn't so bad since they give you the pagers (if I remember) to call you when you're ready.  -While being sat the waitress quickly brought out our waters then scurried off elsewhere. I can't say if she was slammed or what but I can just base this review off of my own experience. The bread was a bit hard and cold but at least the olive oil it came with helped it push along. We offered cocktails which took awhile to come out honestly considering, and at the start I asked for some Parmesan cheese which didn't come out for another 15mins. The cocktails were actually good and the appetizer which was a mushroom flatbread was also good. If you're a mushroom lover I'd recommend it. -Now for the entrees, that took quite awhile. Like, I honestly should have timed it but I tried to occupy myself with other things. It was definitely over 25-30 mins and this was AFTER our appetizers had arrived! Now I know it takes awhile for good food, but my steak was undercooked. I wanted med rare and most of the steak was still mooing! I was just starving by that point so I ate the med rare parts of it and figured I could save it for home and cook it to my correct temp. My girlfriends entree was a shrimp scampi and it was way to sour. Like they poured on the lemon juice and she couldn't enjoy some of the veggies mixed in it as it was way too sour. I ended up finishing it for her as I didn't want to waste food. Other then all of this the steak actually had pretty good flavor and if it was cooked perfectly it would have been great I'd even recommend getting it.  -Honestly, if the food takes that long I'd expect the steak to be cooked perfectly and not undercooked. I may or may not return to this location. The Alamoana location definitely seems like they have their stuff more together though.

Alright so I've not had so many not good things here the staff is fun the food is excellent the fettuccine Alfredo is awesome with some shrimp mmm  The drinks Are OK price I think but what I love is long Island ice tea and uh. . It's really expensive here like 10.99 so I'm like woah.. had 2 my and my fiance.. just with 2 each came out to 40.. way to much for us.. but I love the pizza and and pasta.. the ceasar..salad is good should  Check this place out customer service is pretty good and I'd recommend being able to spend some good money on food and stuff..

Terrible food and so expensive.  The place was packed and I was so surprised due to the horrible food.  Not impressed at all.  Loud and dirty.  Can't even write a long review as I disliked it so much I have no words..

Cpk has been a staple restaurant for me since I was a kid. The food is almost always great, I say almost because the amount of times I eat here your bound to have a burnt dish or two every once in a while lol but they are always willing to fix any kind of mistake with your food. My go-to's include spinach & artichoke dip, BBQ chic salad, Thai crunch salad, Jamaican jerk pizza, pepperoni pizza, garlic cream fettuccini with shrimp. My family and I will definitely be coming here for years to come.

I normally love CPK but today this was not the case. We placed an order for pick up and on our way there we got very lost. Once we called them we were placed on hold for an extended period of time and were not given sufficient directions to the location. Upon returning home and getting ready to eat we noticed that our dessert was poorly put together and lacked in the ingredients. There was a small scoop of whip cream for their strawberry shortcake and thrown together. Overall this was a mediocre experience at CPK

One of my favorite go to places! Service is always good at this location, no doubt about it. But tonight's visit was a little disappointing...  Service was great, timing of the food coming out was good as well but I'm just a little upset because first off.. I found one piece of pasta in my plate (no one on my table ordered that pasta), along with a tomato it looks like? And also, my noodles on my chicken piccata was super dry and barely had capers :( I never had this happen to me at this location before.  Just writing this review for a heads up next time!
Amazing, would've gave 5 stars but I'm sitting here with a crushed red pepper dispenser that never works every time I visit.  Invest in crushed red pepper dispensers!

Sat at the bar for dinner.  Bartender was very friendly and accommodating.   Although bar was busy, bartender was able to work efficiently with a constant smile on her face.   The pizza maker was awesome to watch.

California pizza kitchen is located street floor on the sears side of pearlridge  Lots of parking lots and garage nearby  Very busy location  Food was good. I ordered the steak which was good very well. The tortilla chips were surprisingly sweet. My alcoholic beverage was very well made and delicious!!  Service was great as well!!

This is one of my favorite places to eat and it's really close to my house so we go here all the time. The spinach artichoke dip is my absolute favorite thing to eat here. I think this is the best cpk location I've been too. I've never had a bad experience like I had with other locations and it's never really busy where we have to wait a long time.

I just love carbs in general HAHA so CPK is always my go to for dinner dates. Came here tonight for dinner and ordered the tequila fettuccine. I am vegetarian and have ordered this before, they've had no problem with subbing out the chicken for more veggies. However, tonight as I was a few bites in, I noticed they had put very tiny pieces of chicken in my dish. I haven't eaten meat in over a year so I immediately excused myself to the bathroom and threw up :( informed our waiter and he had the manger come by and was just as shocked and confused when he saw the meat.  They were super apologetic and I was offered a new dish. I just asked that they remake it and I took it to go. And they didn't charge me at all! Very upset that they did make that mistake and I now have slight food poisoning. However, they handled the situation very well and customer service is amazing!

Our favorite family restaurant. Food quality & customer service is consistently great. On a few occasions we were not happy with the food & service but our overall good experiences outweigh them & we dine here often. We've tried a variety of dishes here & they were all delicious. This location does get extremely busy during dinner time & especially on special occasions (Valentine's Day, Mother/Father's Day etc) so plan ahead because the wait time can get really long & they do not accept reservations.
Best location to go to! The food is great, the waitresses are amazing, kind and very helpful.  Forever my favorite location because it has the best service!!

BLUF: Good food! Service was pretty slow @ 1100 on a Friday (2 1/2hr lunch) Came out here with the coworkers for a going away. Ordered the Spicy Buffalo Cauliflower. Super bomb, but a little spicy. The only complaint I had was how slow the service was at the time we came through. It wasn't too packed but many other factors may have caused it. All in all, good food with some good company!

My family usually loves CPK, but this time our service was so slow. It was a pretty busy night so it would've been understandable but there was one waitress running around doing everything while we would see 4 people talking and standing around. Other people around us were getting upset. We would ask for something and get it like 20 minutes later. Everything was poorly made that we got. Pasta cold, salad soggy, ice cream melted. Really disappointing

Today my family and I got the carne asada pizza (amazing by the way), the spicy buffalo cauliflower (so tasty), the seared ahi plate (wife enjoyed it), two Spicy Bloody Marys (garnished with pepperoni, olive, lemon, and cheese), a Moscow Mule, a strawberry lemonade and cranberry refresher. Everything was on point. But the reason for my review is our waitress Meia. She is the epitome of customer service. She was helpful in our selection of food, she checked in on us regularly, had a great personality, friendly. She even spoke with my daughter about moving away, gave her some advice, very heartfelt. We felt taken care of. Thank you CPK and thank you Meia for treating us like family. We will remember your servitude to us. Wish you the best!
Awesome service by our waitress!  Good food!  And the desert was delicious!  Looks like they changed the menu a bit.

Always good food & service. Best to go after 2pm and before 6pm. Faster service & your food comes out quickly. I love everything I have ever ordered, pizza, pastas, and salads. This place is kid friendly with a kids menu & pricing.

Love the chicken piccata and salads here. Also love the pumpkin cheesecake (seasonal) we usually go during the weekdays for lunch when it's not busy. Always gets seated right away and service is always good and fast. And I love their chicken piccata. I love lemon and sour things so I love it a lot. But if you don't like sour or lemons I do not recommend. If you do, you'll love it.

The outside lights just came on and we are sitting near the window.  Looks like the mall installed LED lights and it's s bad glare!  I will tell CPK management.  We were sitting right away and serviced quickly.
Tried a cosmo for the first time, loved it! The margarita pizza and key lime pie are also my favorites. Service was friendly and fast.

I came here earlier today and was served by Bob. When I got in the reasturant I was seated very quickly by someone who I assumed was off the clock because he was not on uniform and had a backpack on.  I noticed the group of 2 that came in right before me was also seated in Bob's section and the table that came on after me was also seated in Bob's section.  Leading me to belive he was the only server working at the time.  VERY GOOD SERVICE.  I worked in the reasturant industry before I and understand how stressful have a bunch of table can be but he still took tome with me to help me figure out which tea I would like. (I was in the mood for a sweet tea)  I ended up ordering the mango tea (which is refillable !!!)  He double checked that I enjoyed the drink and took my food order.  Food came out on a decent amount of time. I didn't time it but it felt about 15 mintues and I was given bread and this made time go by a little faster because I was HUNGRY. I had the white corn guacamole I highly recommend it. Very good chip to guac ratio and o loved the texture of it. I also ordered a margarita pizza. It came out at the perfect temp so I didn't have to wait for it to cool off like how I would normally would at a pizza reasturant.  Next time I will be coming in and asking for bob as a server again and hopefully I'll have time to try dessert!! (I was in a rush today)

I am a regular at this California Pizza Kitchen. I want to say that I come here  once a week or so on the weekends. I am particularly a fan of this location because of the amazing service. There have been a couple misses where my server forgot to put my take out order in before the kitchen closed, or when my server wasn't too friendly, but 9 times out of 10, this place shines in terms of customer service.  I really enjoy the food here, too. My usual order is the California club sandwich with chicken and tortilla soup. I am never disappointed because the balance is great. I also fancy the Thai crunch salad, the spinach and artichoke dip, the pesto pasta with chicken, and the Sicilian pizza. I can never really go wrong when I go with one of these things. Their mango lemonade or strawberry iced tea is also delicious. I like that this place has a seasonally changing menu, which allows me to try new things out when I am not ordering from the list above.  Since this CPK is located at Pearlridge, it is very convenient to get to. Sometimes the waits are long (they don't take reservations), which can be a hassle especially if you are hungry, but the time usually goes by fast. I will probably be back very soon!

I got the creamy fettuccine with shrimp (from a pizza place, I know) but the texture was really weird (not creamy at all) and I had a really small portion. For the price, it wasn't good at all. Would not get anything other than pizza from here unless you absolutely don't want pizza for some reason.

California Pizza Kitchen!!! Great food! We ordered to jambalaya pasta and the mushroom pepperoni pizza. Definitely delicious and recommended if your are coming here any time. Our waitress was great too, Wendi I think was her name. So great when coming from Maui because we don't have too many restaurant options over there...

Let's start of my saying the food here is AMAZINGLY GOOD! I wasn't sure what to get so I the chicken Alfredo (don't remember the exact name) but they come in shrimp or mushrooms. We also go the pizza of course and just everything we ain't was great! On top of that, our waitress hustled very fast and well because they were going to close soon, so she did her part we did ours. She did great as well (sadly I didn't catch her name). Overall, I'd come back, just didn't know why I didn't come here in the first place.

It was very disappointing because I usually love CPK, but today @Pearl Ridge the food was not up to par. First, the chips for the spinach dip was not crispy. Second, the flatbread was a bit soft & not that hot. Third, my Chicken dish was nothing like the one I had @Mililani a few days ago. Sorry, but that is the truth.

The restaurant is very loud. I feel like they could put something up on the walls to dampen the noise. There's just not enough sauce on the pasta. It's a bit like eating a plate of just plain fettuccine noodles.  The sangria is on point. Phenomenal!  The menu was surprisingly diverse.

Need improvement towards customer service as far as seating from host and management. Servers are well in taking care of customers. The food however like the introductory bread is served too old and hard. Perhaps busy setting overcame their expectations. I wonder if better preparations can be done.
They Always Give Me Stale Chips. This Is The 3rd Time I've Ordered Their Spinach Artichoke Dip.

We love it here and Tiana was awesome!  She made us feel so comfortable specially when we had a 4 yr old boy who finished  school and was bouncing around on the benches.  The food was amazing as alway. Everyone is so friendly even with weird request like a plate of parmesan cheese that the 4 yr old eats alone waiting for his mac and cheese. Thank you everyone

They are located in the Pearlridge Mall and there's a lot of parking you can chose from. On our recent visit we went on a Sunday morning around 11 am and we didn't have to wait for a table. We were seated quickly and to my husband's delight he was able to watch his football game from our area. Our server was friendly but he did take a while to come back with water and our check since they were short staffed. He did keep apologizing for taking a while and since they were short staffed we were understanding.       They give you bread with olive oil for starters and we usually ask for balsamic vinegar to add to the olive oil. I feel they skimp on the bread now but it was fine for me because the less bread I see the less temptation I have. Lol. But of course my husband wanted more bread so we got three more pieces hahaha! We ordered their lettuce wraps for appetizers this time but we usually get their spinach and artichoke dip. I was kind of disappointed with the lettuce wraps because the meat was kind of salty for my taste. We got their Club Sandwich with chicken and tomato bisque to share. For lunch I feel that was enough food so I wasn't too stuffed. Now they have this program that you can sign up for and it keeps track of how much you spend there and you get food or money back when you spend a certain amount.      I hope the next time we go they aren't so short staffed but overall good service.

Located at the downtown Pearlridge shopping center, this location is usually pretty busy during the lunch and dinner hours. My fiancé got the kung pao spaghetti.  It has a Asian inspired twist to regular spaghetti. She enjoys it and gets it on the regular. I opted to order the ribeye steak. The steak was a good portion and cooked to my liking. It came with fingerling potatoes, which were good, and an arugula salad.  Our waitress, Ana, was very attentive and made sure we got everything we needed.
