I also watched her deal with what I would call rude  customers with poise and professionalism.  Me and my fiancé  enjoy visiting this location of shopping at Pearlridge.

Waited about 10 minutes just to get my soda I ordered and they forgot what I ordered and had to ask me again what I ordered while all my other friends got their food horrible service needs to be more aware

After some therapeutic shopping at Pearl Ridge shopping center, what better way to recharge than to have some lunch and a drink. California Pizza Kitchen is a great place to do this. Depending on time and day that you come, sometimes the wait can be horrendous!!! But, if timing is right, it's a great place to enjoy a good meal. I really like their thin crust pizzas. Service has always been on point every time that I have been there! I appreciate good service because it's hard to find now days! Drinks have always been on point too!! So, if you decide to go shopping at Pearl Ridge and wanna get a bite to eat but don't want fast food, stop by CPK to recharge!

Always been one of my "go-to's" when we cannot make up our minds about where to get a quick (delicious) bite.  Menu has a good variety for everyone, including my vegan mom! Service was mediocre.  Nothing went wrong, but could still be a little more sincere,  instead of rushing by. I understand it was busier than usual probably all the hungry holiday shoppers.

I ordered the Cobb salad and I thought it was so-so. The boiled egg was over boiled and bland. The chicken was a bit bland too. It was big salad, so that was a plus. I just don't think it was worth $20. Should probably stick to the pizza.

Gone to eat here last weekend. Our local braddah waiter was slow and wouldn't even check on my friend and I. Then i find a fly bug in my water and a fly bug in my ahi spring rolls. Gross! I tell our waiter and he says, "that's normal" and "we get fruit flies all the time. We have to leave the door open." OMG that pissed me off.  The fact that you know fly bugs are a problem there and don't say or do anything.  At least notify your customers. My stomach turned and i lost my appetite.  I'm not eating at that location again. Sooooo GROSS!!!

Great place for drinks, dinner and appetizers. Not to mention the best red velvet cake! There dinners are good too. This is a great place for families also! I love coming here and always have great service and I was so impressed with their sangrias! They have 3 different sangrias and they were all so good and really generous!

Meia was the best server we have had in a long time! She made me feel right at home and she really knew how to service her customers! She was prompt but the best thing of all was her vibes she gave off! She absolutely brings a different cheerful vibe! I would come back for her service even if the food wasnt good but its alwayss good! Thankyou Meia, your charm and great service made us feel right at home!!

my bartender was horrible last night. It was slow on the bar. She barley acknowledge me or my other half(she only talked to us for drinks, appetizers & entrees, that's it). We had to wait longer then everybody else who got sat after us for our meals. She refilled our drinks 1x, our coke was flat, never gave us any extra bread, never cleaned up Our plates but she checked on everybody else at the bar too besides us, THEN she had the audacity to talk story to another guest for half an hour, yes, half an hour might seem dramatic but we were timing her because the service we were getting was very horrible and how I watched other servers working harder then the bartender had me a little irritated. I'm pregnant & I wished I sat on a table instead, then after she's done talking, she reaches over & grabs my pizza without even saying excuse me or asked if I'm done or if I need a box(HOW RUDE), & she says "Oh I thought you were waiting on me." I was like...WTH! I was so over it but my food was really good, I felt bad for my other half, his pasta was sitting out and getting pushed to the side, waiting for someone to pick up his meal and give it to him, yes he was watching as well. I have experience in the restaurant business, I know how it goes. It was busy in the beginning, died down 15 min later but everybody else seemed to be working cohesively and smoothly, while the bartender looked flustered, doing what? Idk. Our bill came out to $55, we had a $50 GC and We always tip truthfully, if our sever deserves 20% we will give 20 but last night was less than 15% and the type of people we are we decided to tip her 20%, even though she did the bare minimum. I'm not being dramatic on here, if they have cameras they should rewind the tapes and watch us because I wouldn't be ranting on here if I had good service.

First and last time ever going here. Never once did our waitress come over asked us if everything was ok or refilled our water. But I see her go to other tables she was waiting on. I felt maybe it was the way we were dressed. No one should ever judge a person by the way they dress or look. I once was a food waitress, but made sure my customers were taken care of. Management needs to step up and do customer service training on your employees.

I only ate at this location twice, just because one they are always so busy & two the restaurant isn't really that big. But we came here on a Saturday, early dinner around 4ish. And to my surprise when we first got there she said there was no wait, but because all of our party wasn't here yet we had to wait. It wasn't too long after that we all were there & then all of a sudden there was a 20 min wait. The worker at the front said they were in between changing shifts so once that's done we can be seated ?! Foreal. That was the first time I have ever heard of that from any restaurant, they had so many tables available that they could've seated us at least. And then it takes them 20 mins to change shifts. UNREAL.  Good thing we were all catching up outside and talking stories. We were finally seated and me & my bf already knew what we wanted to eat. We never eat an actual meal, its always appetizers & salads. Our go-to's is the avocado rolls, artichoke dip,lettuce wraps with shrimp & chicken & the BBQ salad. Omg those are so ono (: We literally get full off of that. Its like a meal on its own!  For dessert we would normally get the butter cake, but we wanted to try something different & we got the chocolate soufflé cake I think its called with ice cream. It wasn't that bad at all. But I would rather get the butter cake instead!

Eddie the bartender was amazing. Very friendly and attentive. Cheyne is a great hostess. Very knowledgeable and friendly. Spoke to us while we waited for our table. This restaurant is a home away from home. They make you feel like family.
